typedef.name: Status
typedef.description: The status of an interface: 'enabled' indicates that it is willing to communicate with other OSPF Routers, while 'disabled' indicates that it is not.

typedef.name: PositiveInteger
typedef.description: A positive integer. Values in excess are precluded as unnecessary and prone to interoperability issues.

typedef.name: HelloRange
typedef.description: The range of intervals on which hello messages are exchanged.

typedef.name: UpToMaxAge
typedef.description: The values that one might find or configure for variables bounded by the maximum age of an LSA.

typedef.name: DesignatedRouterPriority
typedef.description: The values defined for the priority of a system for becoming the designated router.

typedef.name: KeySegment
typedef.description:
The total length of the key is 1024 characters, it is divided into 8 parts and stored in 8 separated mib variables as below:
Key1: part 1 of the key (1-128) Key2: part 2 of the key (129-256) Key3: part 3 of the key (257-384) Key4: part 4 of the key (385-512) Key5: part 5 of the key (513-640) Key6: part 6 of the key (641-768) Key7: part 7 of the key (769-896) Key8: part 8 of the key (897-1024)
Please note that if the key string is less then 1024 characters, the remaining part of the string will be filled by a zero-length string. For example, if the length of the key is 129, we will get a string of length 128 in Key1, and a string of length 1 in Key2, moreover, Key3 to Key8 will all be zero-length strings.

typedef.name: ValidStatus
typedef.description: A simple status value for the object to create and destroy a table entry. This is a simplified variant of RowStatus as it supports only two values. Setting it to valid(1) creates an entry. Setting it to invalid(2) destroys an entry.

typedef.name: StaPathCostMode
typedef.description: The path cost mode of a spanning tree algorithm, short(1) indicates that we retrieve/configure the spanning tree path cost as a 16 bit value and long(2) indicates that we retrieve/configure the spanning tree path cost as a 32 bit value.

scalar.name: switchNumber
scalar.description: The total number of switches present on this system.

table.name: switchInfoTable
table.description: Table of descriptive and status information about the switch units in this system.

row.name: switchInfoEntry
row.description: Table providing descriptions and status information for switch units.

column.name: swUnitIndex
column.description: This object identifies the switch within the system for which this entry contains information. This value can never be greater than switchNumber.

column.name: swHardwareVer
column.description: Hardware version of the main board.

column.name: swMicrocodeVer
column.description: Microcode version of the main board.

column.name: swLoaderVer
column.description: Loader version of the main board.

column.name: swBootRomVer
column.description: Boot ROM code version of the main board.

column.name: swOpCodeVer
column.description: Operation code version of the main board.

column.name: swPortNumber
column.description: The number of ports on this switch.

column.name: swPowerStatus
column.description: Indicates the switch using internalPower(1), redundantPower(2) or both(3)

column.name: swRoleInSystem
column.description: Indicates the switch is master(1), backupMaster(2) or slave(3) in this system.

column.name: swSerialNumber
column.description: Serial number of the switch.

column.name: swExpansionSlot1
column.description: Type of expansion module in this switch slot 1.

column.name: swExpansionSlot2
column.description: Type of expansion module in this switch slot 2.

column.name: swServiceTag
column.description: Service tag serial-number of the switch.

column.name: swModelNumber
column.description: Model number of the switch.

column.name: swEpldVer
column.description: The EPLD version of the switch.

column.name: swExpectedModuleOpCodeVer
column.description: The module opcode version reside in the switch, note that this variable represent the desired version of the module which might plug in. For version validation, only the swExpectedModuleOpCodeVer of the master is used. This object is compared with the swModuleOpCodeVer of the master and all slaves.

scalar.name: switchOperState
scalar.description: Global operation state of the switch.

scalar.name: swProdName
scalar.description: The product name of this switch.

scalar.name: swProdManufacturer
scalar.description: The product manufacturer of this switch.

scalar.name: swProdDescription
scalar.description: The product description of this switch.

scalar.name: swProdVersion
scalar.description: The runtime code version of this switch.

scalar.name: swProdUrl
scalar.description: The URL of this switch, which we can connect through a web browser.

scalar.name: swIdentifier
scalar.description: A unique identifier of which switch in the chassis is currently being looked at.

scalar.name: swChassisServiceTag
scalar.description: The service tag of the chassis this switch resides in.

table.name: switchIndivPowerTable
table.description: Table about the status of individual powers.

row.name: switchIndivPowerEntry
row.description: Table about the status of individual power.

column.name: swIndivPowerUnitIndex
column.description: This is defined as swUnitIndex.

column.name: swIndivPowerIndex
column.description: 1 means internal power, 2 means external power.

column.name: swIndivPowerStatus
column.description: notPresent(1) means not present, green(2) means up, red(3) means down.

scalar.name: switchJumboFrameStatus
scalar.description: enable(1) means the Jumbo Frame has enabled, disabled(2) means the Jumbo Frame has disabled.

scalar.name: amtrMacAddrAgingStatus
scalar.description: If this is enabled(1), the MAC address table will age out according to its timer. If this is disabled(2), the MAC address table will not age out.

table.name: switchFanTable
table.description: The fan status table.

row.name: switchFanEntry
row.description: A conceptual row of the switchFanTable.

column.name: switchUnitIndex
column.description: The unit of the switch for the stackable device.

column.name: switchFanIndex
column.description: The unit number of the fan.

column.name: switchFanStatus
column.description: Indicating the status of the fan, 1:ok; 2:failure.

column.name: switchFanOperSpeed
column.description: The operational value of the fan speed, measured in rpm (rotations per minute).

table.name: switchThermalTempTable
table.description: The table which collects switch temperature information.

row.name: switchThermalTempEntry
row.description: A conceptual row of the switchThermalTempTable.

column.name: switchThermalTempValue
column.description: The temperature of the device in degrees Celsius.

table.name: switchThermalActionTable
table.description: The table for configuring the thermal action.

row.name: switchThermalActionEntry
row.description: A conceptual row of the switchThermalActionTable.

column.name: switchThermalActionRisingThreshold
column.description: The rising threshold of the switch temperature.

column.name: switchThermalActionFallingThreshold
column.description: The falling threshold of the switch temperature.

column.name: switchThermalActionAction
column.description: The action that will be taken when the temperature exceeds the rising threshold or falls below the falling threshold.

column.name: switchThermalActionStatus
column.description: Set valid(1) to create an entry, Set Invalid(2) to delete an entry.

scalar.name: switchRenumberUnitID
scalar.description: The value renumber will automatically assign an ID to units in the stack; all UNIT IDs will be contiguous. The system configurations are not changed but the system will restart after renumbering is completed.

scalar.name: switchSystemJumboMtu
scalar.description: System jumbo frame size (MTU).

table.name: portTable
table.description: Table of descriptive and status information describing the configuration of each switch port. This table also contains information about each trunk.

row.name: portEntry
row.description: An entry in the table, describing the configuration of one switch port or trunk.

column.name: portIndex
column.description: The port and the trunk (including trunk members) interface of the portTable. The interface identified by a particular value of this index is the same interface as identified by the same value of ifIndex in the IF-MIB.

column.name: portName
column.description: The name of the port or trunk. This is the same as ifAlias in the IF-MIB (RFC2863 or later).

column.name: portType
column.description: Indicates the port type of the configuration of the switch.

column.name: portSpeedDpxCfg
column.description:
Configures the speed and duplex mode for a port or trunk, according to: halfDuplex10(2) - 10Mbps and half duplex mode fullDuplex10(3) - 10Mbps and full duplex mode halfDuplex100(4) - 100Mbps and half duplex mode fullDuplex100(5) - 100Mbps and full duplex mode halfDuplex1000(6) - 1000Mbps and half duplex mode fullDuplex1000(7) - 1000Mbps and full duplex mode halfDuplex10g(8) - 10g and half duplex mode fullDuplex10g(9) - 10g and full duplex mode
hundredBaseTX port can be set as: halfDuplex10(2) fullDuplex10(3) halfDuplex100(4) fullDuplex100(5) hundredBaseFX port can be set as: fullDuplex100(5) thousandBaseSX port can be set as: fullDuplex1000(7) thousandBaseLX port can be set as: fullDuplex1000(7) thousandBaseT port can be set as: halfDuplex10(2) fullDuplex10(3) halfDuplex100(4) fullDuplex100(5) thousandBaseGBIC port can be set as: fullDuplex1000(7) thousandBaseSfp port can be set as: fullDuplex1000(7) hundredBaseFxScSingleMode port can be set as: fullDuplex100(5) hundredBaseFxScMultiMode port can be set as: fullDuplex100(5) thousandBaseCX port can be set as: fullDuplex1000(7) tenG port can be set as: halfDuplex10g(8) fullDuplex10g(9)
The actual operating speed and duplex of the port is given by portSpeedDpxStatus.

column.name: portFlowCtrlCfg
column.description:
(1) Flow control mechanism is enabled with tx and rx pause mechansim. If the port type is hundredBaseTX or thousandBaseSX: When the port is operating in halfDuplex mode, the port uses backPressure flow control mechanism. When the port is operating in fullDuplex mode, the port uses IEEE 802.3x flow control mechanism. If the port type is hundredBaseFX: When the port is operating in halfDuplex mode, the port uses backPressure flow control mechanism. When the port is operating in fullDuplex mode, Flow control mechanism will not function. (2) Flow control mechanism is disabled. (5) Flow control mechanism is enabled with tx pause mechanism only. (6) Flow control mechansim is enabled with rx pause mechansim only.
Fast ethernet ports can be set as: enabled(1), disabled(2). Gigabit ethernet ports can be set as: enabled(1), disabled(2), tx(5), rx(6). The actual flow control mechanism is used given by portFlowCtrlStatus.

column.name: portCapabilities
column.description: Port or trunk capabilities.

column.name: portAutonegotiation
column.description: Whether auto-negotiation is enabled.

column.name: portSpeedDpxStatus
column.description: The operating speed and duplex mode of the switched port or trunk. If the entry represents a trunk, the speed is that of its individual members unless the member ports have been inconsistently configured in which case the value is error(1).

column.name: portFlowCtrlStatus
column.description: (2) BackPressure flow control mechanism is used. (3) IEEE 802.3 flow control mechanism is used. (4) Flow control mechanism is disabled. If the entry represents a trunk and the member ports have been inconsistently configured then this value is error(1).

column.name: portTrunkIndex
column.description: The trunk to which this port belongs. A value of 0 means that this port does not belong to any trunk. A value greater than zero means that this port belongs to a trunk in the trunkIndex, defined by the corresponding trunkPorts.

column.name: portComboForcedMode
column.description: This determines the running mode of a combo port. For a non-combo port, this variable has a value of none(1), and setting this variable to none(1) has no effect. For a combo port, this has its own valid values not equal to none(1), and setting this variable to none(1) is not allowed. copperForced(2) is set if user want to force this combo port running in copper mode. copperPreferredAuto(3) is obsoleted, and user shall not set this state. sfpForced(4) is set if user want to force this combo port running in fiber mode. sfpPreferredAuto(5) is set if user want to change copper or fiber mode automatically by SFP transceiver present state. If SFP transceiver is present, this combo port will run in fiber mode, and if SFP transceiver is not present, this combo port will run in copper mode.

column.name: portMtu
column.description: Maximum frame size of port. If the size of the incoming packet is larger than this value, the packet will be discarded.

column.name: portMacAddrLearningStatus
column.description: Set this variable to enabled(1) to start to learn MAC addresses. Set this variable to disabled(2) to stop to learn MAC addresses.

column.name: portMacAddrLearningCount
column.description: The current number of learned MAC addresses.

scalar.name: cableDiagCtlAction
scalar.description: To execute cable diagnostics on a port, assign cableDiagCtlAction to the value of ifIndex defined by the ifIndex in the IF-MIB. When read, this object always returns 0.

table.name: cableDiagResultTable
table.description: Table for cable diagnostics result.

row.name: cableDiagResultEntry
row.description: Entry for cable diagnostics result.

column.name: cableDiagResultIfIndex
column.description: This is defined as the ifIndex.

column.name: cableDiagResultStatusPairA
column.description: The result of cable diagnostics. If there is no fault on the cable, the value is ok(2). Value notTestedYet(1) means the pair is not tested yet. Value ok(2) means the pair works well. Value open(3) means there is a lack of continuity between pins at each end of the pair. Value short(4) means conductors are short-circuited together on the pair. Value openShort(5) means the pair has open and short issues. Value crosstalk(6) means the pair is incorrectly connected at one end. Value unknown(7) means pair has an error matching none of the above. Value impedanceMismatch(8) means different quality cables connected together. Value failed(9) means test failed. Value notSupported(10) means cable diagnostics is not supported. Value noCable(11) means there is no connected cable.

column.name: cableDiagResultStatusPairB
column.description: The result of cable diagnostics. If there is no fault on the cable, the value is ok(2). Value notTestedYet(1) means the pair is not tested yet. Value ok(2) means the pair works well. Value open(3) means there is a lack of continuity between pins at each end of the pair. Value short(4) means conductors are short-circuited together on the pair. Value openShort(5) means the pair has open and short issues. Value crosstalk(6) means the pair is incorrectly connected at one end. Value unknown(7) means pair has an error matching none of the above. Value impedanceMismatch(8) means different quality cables connected together. Value failed(9) means test failed. Value notSupported(10) means cable diagnostics is not supported. Value noCable(11) means there is no connected cable.

column.name: cableDiagResultStatusPairC
column.description: The result of cable diagnostics. If there is no fault on the cable, the value is ok(2). Value notTestedYet(1) means the pair is not tested yet. Value ok(2) means the pair works well. Value open(3) means there is a lack of continuity between pins at each end of the pair. Value short(4) means conductors are short-circuited together on the pair. Value openShort(5) means the pair has open and short issues. Value crosstalk(6) means the pair is incorrectly connected at one end. Value unknown(7) means pair has an error matching none of the above. Value impedanceMismatch(8) means different quality cables connected together. Value failed(9) means test failed. Value notSupported(10) means cable diagnostics is not supported. Value noCable(11) means there is no connected cable. If the port is 10/100 type, value of the node should be ignored.

column.name: cableDiagResultStatusPairD
column.description: The result of cable diagnostics. If there is no fault on the cable, the value is ok(2). Value notTestedYet(1) means the pair is not tested yet. Value ok(2) means the pair works well. Value open(3) means there is a lack of continuity between pins at each end of the pair. Value short(4) means conductors are short-circuited together on the pair. Value openShort(5) means the pair has open and short issues. Value crosstalk(6) means the pair is incorrectly connected at one end. Value unknown(7) means pair has an error matching none of the above. Value impedanceMismatch(8) means different quality cables connected together. Value failed(9) means test failed. Value notSupported(10) means cable diagnostics is not supported. Value noCable(11) means there is no connected cable. If the port is 10/100 type, value of the node should be ignored.

column.name: cableDiagResultDistancePairA
column.description: Displays the fault distance of pair A of the cable in meters.

column.name: cableDiagResultDistancePairB
column.description: Displays the fault distance of pair B of the cable in meters.

column.name: cableDiagResultDistancePairC
column.description: Displays the fault distance of pair C of the cable in meters. If the port is 10/100 type, value of the node is zero.

column.name: cableDiagResultDistancePairD
column.description: Displays the fault distance of pair D of the cable in meters. If the port is 10/100 type, value of the node is zero.

column.name: cableDiagResultDistanceAccuracy
column.description: Displays the accuracy in meters of the cable testing.

column.name: cableDiagResultTime
column.description: Displays the last time of cable diagnostics. For example, 'Jan 1 02:03:04 2002'.

scalar.name: loopInternalCtlAction
scalar.description: To execute internal loopback test on a port, assign loopInternalCtlAction to the value of ifIndex defined by the ifIndex in the IF-MIB. When read, this object always returns 0.

table.name: loopInternalResultTable
table.description: Table for internal loopback test result.

row.name: loopInternalResultEntry
row.description: Entry for internal loopback test result.

column.name: loopInternalResultIfIndex
column.description: This is defined as the ifIndex.

column.name: loopInternalResultStatus
column.description: The result of internal loopback.

column.name: loopInternalResultTime
column.description: Displays the last time of internal loopback. For example, 'Jan 1 02:03:04 2002'.

table.name: portUtilTable
table.description: Dispalys port utilization during recent 300 seconds.

row.name: portUtilEntry
row.description: Dispalys port utilization during recent 300 seconds.

column.name: portUtilIfIndex
column.description: The port and trunk interface of the portUtilTable. The interface identified by a particular value of this index is the same interface identified by the same value of ifIndex in the IF-MIB.

column.name: portInOctetRate
column.description: The input octet rate (kbits/sec) of the port.

column.name: portInPacketRate
column.description: The input packet rate (pkts/sec) of the port.

column.name: portInUtil
column.description: The input utilization of the port, in one per hundred.

column.name: portOutOctetRate
column.description: The output octet rate (kbits/sec) of the port.

column.name: portOutPacketRate
column.description: The output packet rate (pkts/sec) of the port.

column.name: portOutUtil
column.description: The output utilization of the port, in one per hundred.

table.name: portVlanTrunkingTable
table.description: Configures vlan trunking feature.

row.name: portVlanTrunkingEntry
row.description: Configures vlan trunking feature.

column.name: portVlanTrunkingIfIndex
column.description: The port and trunk interface of the portVlanTrunkingTable. The interface identified by a particular value of this index is the same interface identified by the same value of ifIndex in the IF-MIB.

column.name: portVlanTrunkingStatus
column.description: Whether vlan trunking is enabled(1) or disabled(2).

table.name: portMediaInfoTable
table.description: This table lists the information of the media device (SFP/XFP/Copper) installed in the physical port. Only the ifIndices of Ethernet ports those are associated with the operational cards will be included in this table.

row.name: portMediaInfoEntry
row.description: An entry in the Interface Media Information table. The ifIndices of ethernet interfaces will be used to index this table.

column.name: portMediaInfoIfIndex
column.description: ifindex.

column.name: portMediaInfoConnectorType
column.description: The connector type.

column.name: portMediaInfoFiberType
column.description: The fiber type.

column.name: portMediaInfoEthComplianceCodes
column.description: The ethernet compliance codes.

column.name: portMediaInfoBaudRate
column.description: The baud rate.

column.name: portMediaInfoVendorOUI
column.description: The OUI of the vendor.

column.name: portMediaInfoVendorName
column.description: The media vendor name, full name of the corporation.

column.name: portMediaInfoPartNumber
column.description: The media vendor part number.

column.name: portMediaInfoRevision
column.description: The media vendor product version number.

column.name: portMediaInfoSerialNumber
column.description: The vendor serial number of the media device.

column.name: portMediaInfoDateCode
column.description: The date code of the media device.

table.name: portOpticalMonitoringInfoTable
table.description: This table lists the instrumented parameters of all optical interfaces.

row.name: portOpticalMonitoringInfoEntry
row.description: Only the ifIndices of optical interfaces whose parameters need to be monitored will be used to index this table.

column.name: portOpticalMonitoringInfoIfIndex
column.description: This object holds the value of the transmitter laser diode temperature for the interface. This object indicates the health of the transmitter. The format is xxx.yyyy C(elcius). If the device supports ALARM WARNING TRAP, then followed by whether the measured value is normal, high/low alarm or high/low warning.

column.name: portOpticalMonitoringInfoTemperature
column.description: This object holds the value of the transmitter laser diode temperature for the interface. This object indicates the health of the transmitter. The format is xxx.yyyy C(elcius). If the device supports ALARM WARNING TRAP, then followed by whether the measured value is normal, high/low alarm or high/low warning.

column.name: portOpticalMonitoringInfoVcc
column.description: This object holds the value of the Vcc. It is measured in V. If the device supports ALARM WARNING TRAP, then followed by whether the measured value is normal, high/low alarm or high/low warning.

column.name: portOpticalMonitoringInfoTxBiasCurrent
column.description: Tx Bias Current. It is measured in mA. If the device supports ALARM WARNING TRAP, then followed by whether the measured value is normal, high/low alarm or high/low warning.

column.name: portOpticalMonitoringInfoTxPower
column.description: This object holds the value of the transmitter optical signal power for the interface, measured in dBm. If the device supports ALARM WARNING TRAP, then followed by whether the measured value is normal, high/low alarm or high/low warning.

column.name: portOpticalMonitoringInfoRxPower
column.description: This object holds the value of the receiver optical signal power for the interface, measured in dBm. If the device support ALARM WARNING TRAP, then followed by whether the measured value is normal, high/low alarm or high/low warning.

scalar.name: trunkMaxId
scalar.description: The maximum number for a trunk identifier.

scalar.name: trunkValidNumber
scalar.description: The number of valid trunks.

table.name: trunkTable
table.description: Table describing the configuration and status of each trunk.

row.name: trunkEntry
row.description: An entry describing the configuration and status of a particular trunk.

column.name: trunkIndex
column.description: Identifies the trunk within the switch that is described by the table entry.

column.name: trunkPorts
column.description: The complete set of ports currently associated with this trunk.

column.name: trunkCreation
column.description: A value of static(1) means a statically configured trunk. A value of lacp(2) means an LACP-configured trunk.

column.name: trunkStatus
column.description: Writing this to valid(1) creates an entry. Writing this to invalid(2) destroys an entry. A trunk created by LACP cannot be manually destroyed or (re)configured.

scalar.name: trunkBalanceMode
scalar.description: This defines the load balancing mode of trunks in the system. It may be based on source and/or destination MAC address or IP address. macSrc(1) means source MAC address. macDst(2) means destination MAC address. macSrcDst(3) means source and destination MAC address. ipSrc(4) means source IP address. ipDst(5) means destination IP address. ipSrcDst(6) means source and destination IP address.

table.name: lacpPortTable
table.description: Table for LACP port configuration.

row.name: lacpPortEntry
row.description: Entry for LACP port configuration. While an entry may exist for a particular port, the port may not support LACP and an attempt to enable LACP may result in failure.

column.name: lacpPortIndex
column.description: The port interface of the lacpPortTable. The interface identified by a particular value of this index is the same interface as identified by the same value of ifIndex in the IF-MIB.

column.name: lacpPortStatus
column.description: Whether 802.3ad LACP is enabled.

scalar.name: staSystemStatus
scalar.description: Global spanning tree status. (1) Spanning tree protocol is enabled. (2) Spanning tree protocol is disabled.

table.name: staPortTable
table.description: The table manages port settings for Spanning Tree Protocol 802.1d, 802.1w or 802.1s depending on the value specified by staProtocolType.

row.name: staPortEntry
row.description: The conceptual entry of staPortTable.

column.name: staPortProtocolMigration
column.description: When operating in RSTP (version 2) mode, writing true(1) to this object forces this port to transmit RSTP BPDUs. Any other operation on this object has no effect and it always returns false(2) when read.

column.name: staPortOperEdgePort
column.description: The operational value of the edge port parameter. The object is initialized to the value of staPortAdminEdgePort and is set false when a BPDU is received.

column.name: staPortAdminPointToPoint
column.description: The administrative point-to-point status of the LAN segment attached to this port. A value of forceTrue(0) indicates that this port should always be treated as if it is connected to a point-to-point link. A value of forceFalse(1) indicates that this port should be treated as having a shared media connection. A value of auto(2) indicates that this port is considered to have a point-to-point link if it is an Aggregator and all of its members are aggregatable, or if the MAC entity is configured for full duplex operation, either through auto-negotiation or by management means.

column.name: staPortOperPointToPoint
column.description: The operational point-to-point status of the LAN segment attached to this port. This indicates whether a port is considered to have a point-to-point connection or not. The value is determined by management or by auto-detection, as described in the staPortAdminPointToPoint object.

column.name: staPortSystemStatus
column.description: Per-port spanning tree status. (1) Spanning tree protocol is enabled. (2) Spanning tree protocol is disabled.

column.name: staPortLongAdminPathCost
column.description:
The admin value of the RSTP path cost or MST external pathcost. The contribution of this port to the path cost (in 32 bits value) of paths towards the spanning tree root which include this port.
This object is used to configure the spanning tree port path cost in the 32-bit value range when the staPathCostMethod is long(2).
If the staPathCostMethod is short(1), this mib object is not instantiated.
Setting this to 0 means that the path cost is automatically determined. In this case, read staPortLongOperPathCost to get the oper value.

column.name: staPortLongOperPathCost
column.description:
The oper value of the RSTP path cost or MST external pathcost. The contribution of this port to the path cost (in 32 bits value) of paths towards the spanning tree root which include this port.
This object is used to configure the spanning tree port path cost in the 32-bit value range when the staPathCostMethod is long(2).
If the staPathCostMethod is short(1), this mib object is not instantiated.

column.name: staPortBpduFlooding
column.description: This parameter is used to configure the capability of BPDUs flooding.

column.name: staPortBpduGuard
column.description: A value of enabled(1) indicates that BPDU port guard feature is enabled for each port. A value of disabled(2) indicates that the feature is disabled.

column.name: staPortAdminEdgePortWithAuto
column.description: The administrative value of the edge port parameter. A value of enable(1) indicates that this port should be assumed as an edge-port, a value of disable(2) indicates that this port should be assumed as a non-edge-port and a value of auot (3) indicates this port in RSPT or MSTP mode should be assumed as an edge-port after migration or max age expire without receiving any BPDU and sending BPDU with proposal flag on.

column.name: staPortBpduFilter
column.description: The administrative value of the BPDU filter parameter. A value of enabled(1) indicates that this port will avoid transmitting BPDUs on edge-port and the value of disabled(2) indicates that this port will not avoid transmitting BPDUs on edge-port.

column.name: staPortRootGuardStatus
column.description: Specifies the desired status of the root guard. This variable configures the root guard feature to enforce the root bridge placement in the network.

column.name: staPortBpduGuardAutoRecovery
column.description: A value of enabled(1) indicates that BPDU port guard auto recovery mechanism is enabled for this port. A value of disabled(2) indicates that the mechanism is disabled.

column.name: staPortBpduGuardAutoRecoveryInterval
column.description: The interval in seconds used by BPDU guard auto recovery mechanism.

column.name: staPortTcPropStop
column.description: Stop topology change progate on this ifindex. Don't enable on potentially ring port.

scalar.name: staProtocolType
scalar.description: The version of Spanning Tree Protocol the bridge is currently running. The value 'stp(1)' indicates the Spanning Tree Protocol is as specified in IEEE 802.1D,'rstp(2)' indicates that the Rapid Spanning Tree Protocol is as specified in IEEE 802.1w, and the value 'mstp(3)' indicates that the Multiple Spanning Tree Protocol is as specified in IEEE 802.1s. New values may be defined in the future as new or updated versions of the protocol become available.

scalar.name: staTxHoldCount
scalar.description: The value used by the Port Transmit state machine to limit the maximum transmission rate.

scalar.name: staPathCostMethod
scalar.description:
Indicates the type of spanning tree path cost mode configured on the switch. This mode applies to all instances of the spanning tree protocol running on the switch.
When the value of this MIB object is changed, the path cost of all ports will be reassigned to the default path cost values based on the new spanning tree path cost mode and the ports' speed.
When the value of this MIB object is set to long(2), the staPortLongPathCost MIB object must be used to retrieve/configure the spanning tree port path cost as a 32-bit value. The set operation on dot1dStpPortPathCost in BRIDGE-MIB will be rejected. While retrieving the value of dot1dStpPortPathCost, the maximum value of 65535 will be returned if the value of staPortLongPathCost for the same instance exceeds 65535.
When the value of this MIB object is set to short(1), the dot1dStpPortPathCost in BRIDGE-MIB must be used.

scalar.name: mstName
scalar.description: The name of the Multiple Spanning Tree region.

scalar.name: mstRevision
scalar.description: The Revision number of the Multiple Spanning Tree region.

scalar.name: mstMaxHops
scalar.description: The max hop number counts of the Multiple Spanning Tree region.

table.name: xstInstanceCfgTable
table.description: This table is used to configure the property of a specific instance in Multiple Spanning Tree or Rapid Spanning Tree. If Rapid Spanning Tree protocol is in use, the mstInstanceEditIndex is always 0.

row.name: xstInstanceCfgEntry
row.description: A conceptual row containing the property of the RST or MST instance.

column.name: xstInstanceCfgIndex
column.description: An arbitrary integer within the range from 1 to the value of the maximum instance that uniquely identifies a spanning tree instance.

column.name: xstInstanceCfgPriority
column.description: The priority of a specific spanning tree instance. The value assigned should be in the range 0-61440 in steps of 4096.

column.name: xstInstanceCfgTimeSinceTopologyChange
column.description: The time (in hundredths of a second) since the last topology change detected by the bridge entity in RST or MST.

column.name: xstInstanceCfgTopChanges
column.description: The total number of topology changes detected by this bridge in RST or MST since the management entity was last reset or initialized.

column.name: xstInstanceCfgDesignatedRoot
column.description: The bridge identifier of the root of the spanning tree as determined by the Multiple Spanning Tree Protocol. (802.1s) or Rapid Spanning Tree Protocol (802.1w) executed by this node. This value is used as the root identifier parameter in all configuration bridge PDUs originated by this node.

column.name: xstInstanceCfgRootCost
column.description: The cost of the path to the root as seen from this bridge of the RST or MST.

column.name: xstInstanceCfgRootPort
column.description: The number of the port which offers the lowest cost path from this bridge to the root bridge of the RST or MST.

column.name: xstInstanceCfgMaxAge
column.description: The maximum age of Multiple Spanning Tree Protocol (802.1s) or Rapid Spanning Tree Protocol (802.1w) information learned from the network on any port before it is discarded, in units of hundredths of a second. This is the actual value that this bridge is currently using.

column.name: xstInstanceCfgHelloTime
column.description: The amount of time between the transmission of configuration bridge PDUs by this node on any port when it is the root of the specific spanning tree or trying to become so, in units of hundredths of a second. This is the actual value that this bridge is currently using in RST or MST.

column.name: xstInstanceCfgHoldTime
column.description: This time value determines the interval length during which no more than two configuration bridge PDUs shall be transmitted by this node, in units of hundredths of a second.

column.name: xstInstanceCfgForwardDelay
column.description: For RST or MST protocol, this time value, measured in units of hundredths of a second, controls how fast a port changes its spanning state when moving towards the forwarding state. The value determines how long the port stays in each of the listening and learning states, which precede the forwarding state. This value is also used, when a topology change has been detected and is underway, to age all dynamic entries in the forwarding database. This value is the current value being used by the bridge. xstInstanceCfgBridgeForwardDelay defines the value that this bridge and all others would start using if/when this bridge were to become the root.

column.name: xstInstanceCfgBridgeMaxAge
column.description: For RST or MST protocol, the time (in hundredths of second) that all bridges use for MaxAge when this bridge is acting as the root. Note that 802.1D-1990 specifies that the range for this parameter is related to the value of xstInstanceCfgBridgeHelloTime. The granularity of this timer is specified by 802.1D-1990 to be 1 second.

column.name: xstInstanceCfgBridgeHelloTime
column.description: For RST or MST protocol,the time (in hundredths of a second) that all bridges use for HelloTime when this bridge is acting as the root. The granularity of this timer is specified by 802.1D-1990 to be 1 second.

column.name: xstInstanceCfgBridgeForwardDelay
column.description: For RST or MST protocol, the time (in hundredths of a second) that all bridges use for ForwardDelay when this bridge is acting as the root. Note that 802.1D-1990 specifies that the range for this parameter is related to the value of xstInstanceCfgBridgeMaxAge. The granularity of this timer is specified by 802.1D-1990 to be 1 second.

column.name: xstInstanceCfgTxHoldCount
column.description: For RST or MST protocol, the value used by the port transmit state machine to limit the maximum transmission rate.

column.name: xstInstanceCfgPathCostMethod
column.description:
For RST or MST protocol, this indicates the type of spanning tree path cost mode used by the switch. The mode applies to all instances of the Spanning Tree protocol running on the switch.
When the value of this MIB object is changed, the path cost of all ports will be reassigned to the default path cost values based on the new spanning tree path cost mode and the ports' speed.
When the value of this MIB object is set to long(2), the xstInstancePortPathCost MIB object must be used in order to retrieve/configure the spanning tree port path cost as a 32-bit value. The set operation on dot1dStpPortPathCost in BRIDGE-MIB will be rejected. While retrieving the value of dot1dStpPortPathCost, the maximum value of 65535 will be returned if the value of xstInstancePortPathCost for the same instance exceeds 65535.
When the value of this MIB object is set to short(1), the dot1dStpPortPathCost in BRIDGE-MIB must be used.

table.name: xstInstancePortTable
table.description: The extension table for dot1dStpPortEntry to provide additional Spanning Tree information and configuration.

row.name: xstInstancePortEntry
row.description: The conceptual row for xstInstancePortTable.

column.name: xstInstancePortPriority
column.description: Defines the priority used for this port in the Spanning Tree Algorithm. If the path cost for all ports on a switch is the same, the port with the highest priority (i.e., lowest value) will be configured as an active link in the Spanning Tree. This makes a port with higher priority less likely to be blocked if the Spanning Tree Algorithm is detecting network loops. Where more than one port is assigned the highest priority, the port with lowest numeric identifier will be enabled.

column.name: xstInstancePortState
column.description:
The port's current state as defined by application of the Spanning Tree Protocol. This state controls what action a port takes on reception of a frame: discarding(1): Port receives configuration messages, but does not forward packets. learning(2): Port has transmitted configuration messages for an interval set by the Forward Delay parameter without receiving contradictory information. Port address table is cleared, and the port begins learning addresses. forwarding(3): Port forwards packets, and continues learning addresses.
For ports which are disabled (see xstInstancePortEnable), this object will have a value of discarding(1).

column.name: xstInstancePortEnable
column.description: The enabled/disabled status of the port.

column.name: xstInstancePortDesignatedRoot
column.description: The unique bridge identifier of the bridge recorded as the root in the configuration BPDUs transmitted by the designated bridge for the segment to which the port is attached.

column.name: xstInstancePortDesignatedCost
column.description: The path cost of the designated port of the segment connected to this port. This value is compared to the root path cost field in received bridge PDUs.

column.name: xstInstancePortDesignatedBridge
column.description: The bridge identifier of the bridge which this port considers to be the designated bridge for this port's segment.

column.name: xstInstancePortDesignatedPort
column.description: The port identifier of the port on the designated bridge for this port's segment.

column.name: xstInstancePortForwardTransitions
column.description: The number of times this port has transitioned from the learning state to the forwarding state.

column.name: xstInstancePortPortRole
column.description: The role of the port in the RST or MST protocol: (1) The port has no role within the spanning tree (2) The port is part of the active topology connecting the bridge to the root bridge (i.e., root port) (3) The port is connecting a LAN through the bridge to the root bridge (i.e., designated port) (4) The port may provide connectivity if other bridges, bridge ports, or LANs fail or are removed. (5) The port provides backup if other bridges, bridge ports, or LANs fail or are removed. (6) For MST protocol only, indicates whether this instance is in a master role.

column.name: xstInstancePortAdminPathCost
column.description: The admin value of the MST internal path cost, in the range of 1 to 200000000. 0 indicate the pathcost is dynamically determined by attribute of the port. This parameter is used to determine the best path between devices. Therefore, lower values should be assigned to ports attached to faster media, and higher values assigned to ports with slower media. (Path cost takes precedence over port priority).

column.name: xstInstancePortOperPathCost
column.description: The oper value of the RST pathcost or MST internal pathcost, in the range of 1 to 200000000. This parameter is used to determine the best path between devices. Therefore, lower values should be assigned to ports attached to faster media, and higher values assigned to ports with slower media. (Path cost takes precedence over port priority).

table.name: mstInstanceEditTable
table.description: The instance table for the Multiple Spanning Tree region

row.name: mstInstanceEditEntry
row.description: A conceptual row containing the status of the MSTP instance.

column.name: mstInstanceEditIndex
column.description: An arbitrary integer within the range from 1 to the value of the maximum instance that uniquely identifies a spanning tree instance.

column.name: mstInstanceEditVlansMap
column.description:
A string of octets containing one bit per VLAN. The first octet corresponds to VLANs with vlanIndex values of 0 through 7; the second octet to VLANs 8 through 15; etc., The most significant bit of each octet corresponds to the lowest value vlanIndex in that octet.
For each VLAN, if it is mapped to this MSTP instance, then the bit corresponding to that VLAN is set to '1'.
To create a row, write any of mstInstanceEditVlansMap, mstInstanceEditVlansMap2k, mstInstanceEditVlansMap3k or mstInstanceEditVlansMap4k, to a non-empty list. To destroy a row, write all of these four variables to an empty list.

column.name: mstInstanceEditVlansMap2k
column.description:
A string of octets containing one bit per VLAN for VLANS with vlanIndex values of 1024 through 2047. The first octet corresponds to VLANs with vlanIndex values of 1024 through 1031; the second octet to VLANs 1032 through 1039; etc. The most significant bit of each octet corresponds to the lowest value vlanIndex in that octet.
For each VLAN, if it is mapped to this MSTP instance, then the bit corresponding to that VLAN is set to '1'.
To create a row, write any of mstInstanceEditVlansMap, mstInstanceEditVlansMap2k, mstInstanceEditVlansMap3k or mstInstanceEditVlansMap4k, to a non-empty list. To destroy a row, write all of these four variables to an empty list.

column.name: mstInstanceEditVlansMap3k
column.description:
A string of octets containing one bit per VLAN for VLANS with vlanIndex values of 2048 through 3071. The first octet corresponds to VLANs with vlanIndex values of 2048 through 2055; the second octet to VLANs 2056 through 2063; etc. The most significant bit of each octet corresponds to the lowest value vlanIndex in that octet.
For each VLAN, if it is mapped to this MSTP instance, then the bit corresponding to that VLAN is set to '1'.
To create a row, write any of mstInstanceEditVlansMap, mstInstanceEditVlansMap2k, mstInstanceEditVlansMap3k or mstInstanceEditVlansMap4k, to a non-empty list. To destroy a row, write all of these four variables to an empty list.

column.name: mstInstanceEditVlansMap4k
column.description:
A string of octets containing one bit per VLAN for VLANS with vlanIndex values of 3072 through 4095. The first octet corresponds to VLANs with vlanIndex values of 3072 through 3079; the second octet to VLANs 3080 through 3087; etc. The most significant bit of each octet corresponds to the lowest value vlanIndex in that octet.
For each VLAN, if it is mapped to this MSTP instance, then the bit corresponding to that VLAN is set to '1'.
To create a row, write any of mstInstanceEditVlansMap, mstInstanceEditVlansMap2k, mstInstanceEditVlansMap3k or mstInstanceEditVlansMap4k, to a non-empty list. To destroy a row, write all of these four variables to an empty list.

column.name: mstInstanceEditRemainingHops
column.description: The remaining hop count for this MST instance.

table.name: mstInstanceOperTable
table.description: The Multiple Spanning Tree region instance vlan mapped table.

row.name: mstInstanceOperEntry
row.description: A conceptual row containing the status of the MSTP instance.

column.name: mstInstanceOperIndex
column.description: An arbitrary integer within the range from 1 to the value of the maximum instance that uniquely identifies a spanning tree instance.

column.name: mstInstanceOperVlansMap
column.description:
A string of octets containing one bit per VLAN. The first octet corresponds to VLANs with vlanIndex values of 0 through 7; the second octet to VLANs 8 through 15; etc., The most significant bit of each octet corresponds to the lowest value vlanIndex in that octet.
For each VLAN, if it is mapped to this MSTP instance, then the bit corresponding to that VLAN is set to '1'.

column.name: mstInstanceOperVlansMap2k
column.description:
A string of octets containing one bit per VLAN for VLANS with vlanIndex values of 1024 through 2047. The first octet corresponds to VLANs with vlanIndex values of 1024 through 1031; the second octet to VLANs 1032 through 1039; etc. The most significant bit of each octet corresponds to the lowest value vlanIndex in that octet.
For each VLAN, if it is mapped to this MSTP instance, then the bit corresponding to that VLAN is set to '1'.

column.name: mstInstanceOperVlansMap3k
column.description:
A string of octets containing one bit per VLAN for VLANS with vlanIndex values of 2048 through 3071. The first octet corresponds to VLANs with vlanIndex values of 2048 through 2055; the second octet to VLANs 2056 through 2063; etc. The most significant bit of each octet corresponds to the lowest value vlanIndex in that octet.
For each VLAN, if it is mapped to this MSTP instance, then the bit corresponding to that VLAN is set to '1'.

column.name: mstInstanceOperVlansMap4k
column.description:
A string of octets containing one bit per VLAN for VLANS with vlanIndex values of 3072 through 4095. The first octet corresponds to VLANs with vlanIndex values of 3072 through 3079; the second octet to VLANs 3080 through 3087; etc. The most significant bit of each octet corresponds to the lowest value vlanIndex in that octet.
For each VLAN, if it is mapped to this MSTP instance, then the bit corresponding to that VLAN is set to '1'.

table.name: staLoopbackDetectionPortTable
table.description: A table provides the mechanism to configure the spanning tree loopback detection of each port or trunk

row.name: staLoopbackDetectionPortEntry
row.description: A conceptual row of staLoopbackDetectionPortTable.

column.name: staLoopbackDetectionPortIfIndex
column.description: The port and the trunk interfaces of the portTable. The interface identified by a particular value of this index is the same interface as identified by the same value of ifIndex in the IF-MIB.

column.name: staLoopbackDetectionPortStatus
column.description: Status of the port on whether spanning tree loopback detection is enabled.

column.name: staLoopbackDetectionPortTrapStatus
column.description: The parameter indicates whether the trap has to be sent when the loopback BPDUs have been detected.

column.name: staLoopbackDetectionPortReleaseMode
column.description: Setting it to auto(1) indicates that this port can be released from discarding state automatically after loopback has occurred. Setting it to manual(2) indicates that this port can be released from discarding state manually after loopback has occurred.

column.name: staLoopbackDetectionPortRelease
column.description: Set this to release(2) to release the port from discarding state. noRelease(1) will always be obtained when reading this variable.

scalar.name: staSystemBPDUFlooding
scalar.description: Global BPDU flooding behavior configuration. When BPDU is received on spanning tree disabled port. (1) BPDU is flooded to all other spanning tree disabled ports in vlan that received BPDU. (2) BPDU is flooded to all other spanning tree disabled ports.

scalar.name: restartOpCodeFile
scalar.description: Name of op-code file for start-up.

scalar.name: restartConfigFile
scalar.description: Name of configuration file for start-up.

scalar.name: restartControl
scalar.description: Setting this object to warmBoot(2) causes the device to reinitialize itself such that neither the agent configuration nor the protocol entity implementation is altered. Setting this object to coldBoot(3) causes the device to reinitialize itself such that the agent's configuration or the protocol entity implementation may be altered. When the device is running normally, this variable has a value of running(1).

table.name: mirrorTable
table.description: Table for port mirroring, enabling a port to be mirrored to/from another port. Not all ports can be mirrored and limitations may apply as to which ports can be used as either source or destination ports.

row.name: mirrorEntry
row.description: The conceptual row of mirrorTable.

column.name: mirrorDestinationPort
column.description: The destination port interface for mirrored packets. The interface identified by a particular value of this index is the same interface as identified by the same value of ifIndex in the IF-MIB.

column.name: mirrorSourcePort
column.description: The source port interface for mirrored packets. The interface identified by a particular value of this index is the same interface as identified by the same value of ifIndex in the IF-MIB.

column.name: mirrorType
column.description: If this value is rx(1), receive packets will be mirrored. If this value is tx(2), transmit packets will be mirrored. If this value is both(3), both receive and transmit packets will be mirrored.

column.name: mirrorStatus
column.description: Setting this to valid(1) creates an entry. Setting this to invalid(2) destroys an entry.

table.name: rspanTable
table.description: A table that contains the settings of RSPAN.

row.name: rspanEntry
row.description: The conceptual row of rspanTable.

column.name: rspanSessionId
column.description: The session ID that may specify an entry in the table which contains destination port(s) information.

column.name: rspanSrcTxPorts
column.description: Specifies the source port list in tx mode.

column.name: rspanSrcRxPorts
column.description: Specifies the source port list in rx mode.

column.name: rspanDstPort
column.description: The port number of a destination port. The interface identified by a particular value of this index is the same interface as identified by the same value of ifIndex in the IF-MIB.

column.name: rspanDstPortTag
column.description: Specifies the traffic which is sent out from source port with RSPAN VLAN ID or not.

column.name: rspanSwitchRole
column.description: Specifies the role of current switch.

column.name: rspanRemotePorts
column.description: Specifies the uplink port list.

column.name: rspanRemoteVlanId
column.description: Specifies the ID of a RSPAN VLAN.

column.name: rspanOperStatus
column.description: The operational status of the entry. A status of up(1) means the setting of a session is complete and it has started performing its function. A status of down(2) means no function is performed because of incompleted session setting.

column.name: rspanStatus
column.description: Set this to valid(1) to create an entry. Set this to invalid(2) to destroy an entry.

scalar.name: igmpSnoopStatus
scalar.description: Parameter to enable or disable IGMP snooping on the device. When enabled, the device will examine IGMP packets and set up filters for IGMP ports.

scalar.name: igmpSnoopQuerier
scalar.description: Enables (disables) whether the switch acts as an IGMP querier.

scalar.name: igmpSnoopRouterPortExpireTime
scalar.description: Sets the time (in seconds) the switch waits after the previous querier has stopped querying before the router port (which received query packets from previous querier) expires.

scalar.name: igmpSnoopVersion
scalar.description: IGMP version snooped

table.name: igmpSnoopRouterCurrentTable
table.description: Table for current router ports.

row.name: igmpSnoopRouterCurrentEntry
row.description: Entry for current router ports.

column.name: igmpSnoopRouterCurrentVlanIndex
column.description: The interface identified by a particular value of this index is the same interface as identified by the same value of dot1qVlanIndex in the Q-BRIDGE-MIB. The entry will only appear here after a configure to igmpSnoopRouterStaticTable.

column.name: igmpSnoopRouterCurrentPorts
column.description: The set of ports which are current router ports, including static router ports. Please refer to igmpSnoopRouterStaticTable.

column.name: igmpSnoopRouterCurrentStatus
column.description: The set of ports which are static multicast router ports.

table.name: igmpSnoopRouterStaticTable
table.description: Table for static router ports.

row.name: igmpSnoopRouterStaticEntry
row.description: Entry for static router ports.

column.name: igmpSnoopRouterStaticVlanIndex
column.description: The interface identified by a particular value of this index is the same interface as identified by the same value of dot1qVlanIndex in the Q-BRIDGE-MIB. The entry will only appear here after a configure to igmpSnoopRouterStaticTable.

column.name: igmpSnoopRouterStaticPorts
column.description: The set of ports which are static router ports.

column.name: igmpSnoopRouterStaticStatus
column.description: Setting this to valid(1) creates an entry. Setting this to invalid(2) destroys an entry.

table.name: igmpSnoopMulticastStaticTable
table.description: Table for static multicast addresses.

row.name: igmpSnoopMulticastStaticEntry
row.description: Entry for static multicast addresses.

column.name: igmpSnoopMulticastStaticVlanIndex
column.description: The interface identified by a particular value of this index is the same interface as identified by the same value of dot1qVlanIndex in the Q-BRIDGE-MIB. The entry will only appear here after a configure to igmpSnoopMulticastStaticTable.

column.name: igmpSnoopMulticastStaticIpAddress
column.description: IP address of multicast group.

column.name: igmpSnoopMulticastStaticPorts
column.description: The set of ports which are members.

column.name: igmpSnoopMulticastStaticStatus
column.description: Setting this to valid(1) creates an entry. Setting this to invalid(2) destroys an entry.

table.name: igmpSnoopCurrentVlanTable
table.description: Table for configuring IGMP snooping for each VLAN which exists in the device by (local or network) management, or dynamically created as a result of GVRP requests received.

row.name: igmpSnoopCurrentVlanEntry
row.description: Entry for configuring IGMP snooping.

column.name: igmpSnoopCurrentVlanIndex
column.description: Same is dot1qVlanIndex in the Q-BRIDGE-MIB. This table has only one entry - the entry for the VLAN of the management interface.

column.name: igmpSnoopCurrentVlanStatus
column.description: Parameter to enable or disable IGMP snooping on this VLAN. When enabled, the device will examine IGMP packets and set up filters for IGMP ports.

column.name: igmpSnoopCurrentVlanImmediateLeave
column.description: The parameter to enable or disable the Immediate-Leave feature on this VLAN.

column.name: igmpSnoopCurrentVlanGeneralQuerySuppression
column.description: The parameter to enable or disable the general query suppresion on this VLAN.

column.name: igmpSnoopCurrentVlanLastMemQueryCount
column.description: Represents the number of queries sent by the switch before it assumes there are no local members.

column.name: igmpSnoopCurrentVlanLastMemQueryIntvl
column.description: The last member query interval is the max response time inserted into group-specific queries sent in response to leave group messages,and is also the the max response time inserted into group-and-source-specific query messages.

column.name: igmpSnoopCurrentVlanProxyAddress
column.description: Represents the address of queries sent by the switch.

column.name: igmpSnoopCurrentVlanQueryIntvl
column.description: Represents the query interval of queries sent by the switch.

column.name: igmpSnoopCurrentVlanQueryRespIntvl
column.description: Represents the query response interval of queries sent by the switch.

column.name: igmpSnoopCurrentVlanProxyReporting
column.description: Set this variable to enabled(1) to enable the feature. Set this variable to disabled(2) to disable the feature. Set this variable to default(3), the status of the feature is decided by the global configuration.

column.name: igmpSnoopCurrentVlanVersion
column.description: the version of igmp packets is supported by this vlan.

column.name: igmpSnoopCurrentVlanVersionExclusive
column.description: Enable/disable control of the IGMP Snooping exclusive supported version.

table.name: igmpSnoopMulticastGroupTable
table.description: Table for current multicast addresses.

row.name: igmpSnoopMulticastGroupEntry
row.description: Entry for Group multicast addresses.

column.name: igmpSnoopMulticastGroupVlanIndex
column.description: The interface identified by a particular value of this index is the same interface as identified by the same value of dot1qVlanIndex in the Q-BRIDGE-MIB. The entry will only appear here after a configure to igmpSnoopMulticastStaticTable.

column.name: igmpSnoopMulticastGroupIpAddress
column.description: IP address of multicast group.

column.name: igmpSnoopMulticastGroupSourceIPAddress
column.description: Source IP address of source.

column.name: igmpSnoopMulticastGroupPorts
column.description: The set of ports which are members of a multicast group, including static members. Please refer to igmpSnoopMulticastStaticTable.

column.name: igmpSnoopMulticastGroupStatus
column.description: The set of ports which are static IGMP member ports.

scalar.name: igmpSnoopFilterStatus
scalar.description: Parameter to enable or disable IGMP filtering on the device.

table.name: igmpSnoopProfileTable
table.description: The table for configuring the IGMP snooping profile.

row.name: igmpSnoopProfileEntry
row.description: The entry for configuring the IGMP snooping profile.

column.name: igmpSnoopProfileId
column.description: The ID of the IGMP snooping profile.

column.name: igmpSnoopProfileAction
column.description: The access mode of the IGMP snooping profile.

column.name: igmpSnoopProfileStatus
column.description: Setting this to valid(1) creates an entry. Setting this to invalid(2) destroys an entry.

scalar.name: igmpSnoopProfileCtlId
scalar.description: The ID of the IGMP snooping profile. The default value is zero, meaning that no ID is specified. In order to create a profile, a non-zero value must be specified.

scalar.name: igmpSnoopProfileCtlInetAddressType
scalar.description: The address type is associated with this agent. Only ipv4(1) type is supported.

scalar.name: igmpSnoopProfileCtlStartInetAddress
scalar.description: The specified addresses in the start of the controlled IP multicast addresses.

scalar.name: igmpSnoopProfileCtlEndInetAddress
scalar.description: The specified addresses in the end of the controlled IP multicast addresses.

scalar.name: igmpSnoopProfileCtlAction
scalar.description: Setting it to create(2) creates the range of the controlled IP multicast addresses. Setting it to destroy(3) destroys the range of the controlled IP multicast addresses. When the action is completed, this object becomes noAction(1).

table.name: igmpSnoopProfileRangeTable
table.description: The table for configuring the range of the IGMP snooping profile.

row.name: igmpSnoopProfileRangeEntry
row.description: The entry for configuring the range of the IGMP snooping profile.

column.name: igmpSnoopProfileRangeProfileId
column.description: This is defined as igmpSnoopProfileId.

column.name: igmpSnoopProfileRangeInetAddressType
column.description: The address type is associated with this agent. Only ipv4(1) type is supported.

column.name: igmpSnoopProfileRangeStartInetAddress
column.description: The specified addresses in the start of the controlled IP multicast addresses.

column.name: igmpSnoopProfileRangeEndInetAddress
column.description: The specified addresses in the end of the controlled IP multicast addresses.

column.name: igmpSnoopProfileRangeAction
column.description: The access mode of the IGMP snooping profile.

table.name: igmpSnoopFilterPortTable
table.description: Table for port configuration in IGMP filtering.

row.name: igmpSnoopFilterPortEntry
row.description: Entry for port configuration in IGMP filtering.

column.name: igmpSnoopFilterPortIndex
column.description: The port and trunk (including trunk members) interface of the portTable. The interface identified by a particular value of this index is the same interface identified by the same value of ifIndex in the IF-MIB.

column.name: igmpSnoopFilterPortProfileId
column.description: The igmpSnoopProfileEntry identified by a particular value of this index is the same interface identified by the same value of the igmpSnoopProfileId object. If there is no corresponding entry in the igmpSnoopProfileTable, then no association exists. In particular, if this value is zero, no associated profile will be generated, as zero is not a valid profile index.

table.name: igmpSnoopThrottlePortTable
table.description: Table for port configuration in IGMP throttling.

row.name: igmpSnoopThrottlePortEntry
row.description: Entry for port configuration in IGMP throttling.

column.name: igmpSnoopThrottlePortIndex
column.description: The port and trunk (including trunk members) interface of the portTable. The interface identified by a particular value of this index is the same interface identified by the same value of ifIndex in the IF-MIB.

column.name: igmpSnoopThrottlePortRunningStatus
column.description: Describes the running status of the IGMP throttling to the switch. A value of true(1) indicates the IGMP throttling mechanism is active. A value of false(2) indicates the IGMP throttling mechanism is inactive.

column.name: igmpSnoopThrottlePortAction
column.description: The action mode of the IGMP throttling. A value of replace(1) means to replace a joined multicast group randomly when an interface receives an IGMP report and the number of current joined multicast groups is equal to the maximum number of IGMP groups that the interface can join. A value of deny(2) means to deny the IGMP report request when an interface receives an IGMP report and the number of current joined multicast groups is equal to the maximum number of IGMP groups that the interface can join.

column.name: igmpSnoopThrottlePortMaxGroups
column.description: The maximum number of IGMP groups that the interface can join.

column.name: igmpSnoopThrottlePortCurrentGroups
column.description: The current number of IGMP groups that the interface has joined.

table.name: igmpSnoopPortTable
table.description: Table of IGMP Snooping service per port.

row.name: igmpSnoopPortEntry
row.description: Entry of IGMP Snooping service per port.

column.name: igmpSnoopPortIndex
column.description: The port and the trunk (excluding trunk members) interface of the igmpSnoopPortTable. The interface identified by a particular value of this index is the same interface as identified by the same value of ifIndex in the IF-MIB.

column.name: igmpSnoopQueryDrop
column.description: Parameter to enable or disable dropping IGMP Query packet.

column.name: igmpSnoopMulticastDataDrop
column.description: Parameter to enable or disable dropping IP multicast data

scalar.name: igmpSnoopProxyReporting
scalar.description: Parameter to enable or disable IGMP snooping proxy reporting on the device.

scalar.name: igmpSnoopRouterAlertOptionCheck
scalar.description: Parameter to enable or disable IGMP snooping router alert option check on the device.

scalar.name: igmpSnoopTcnFlood
scalar.description: Parameter to enable or disable IGMP snooping tcn flood on the device.

scalar.name: igmpSnoopTcnQuerySolicit
scalar.description: Parameter to enable or disable IGMP snooping tcn query solicit on the device.

scalar.name: igmpSnoopUnregisteredDataFlood
scalar.description: Parameter to enable or disable IGMP snooping Unregistered data flood solicit on the device.

scalar.name: igmpSnoopUnsolicitedReportInterval
scalar.description: Setting this value to specify how long (in seconds) the uplink ports should transmit unsolicited reports.

scalar.name: igmpSnoopVersionExclusive
scalar.description: Parameter to enable or disable IGMP snooping version exclusive on the device.

scalar.name: igmpSnoopMrouterForwardMode
scalar.description: Paremete to set IGMP snooping Mrouter port forward mode. When set dynamic, IGMP snooping Mrouter port won't forward multicast streams received from other mrouter port. When set forward, IGMP snooping Mrouter port will forward multicast streams received from other mrouter port.

scalar.name: netDefaultGateway
scalar.description: The IP Address of the default gateway. If this value is undefined or unknown, it shall have the value 0.0.0.0.

scalar.name: ipHttpState
scalar.description: Whether HTTP is enabled.

scalar.name: ipHttpPort
scalar.description: The port number for HTTP.

scalar.name: ipDhcpRestart
scalar.description: When set to restart(1) the DHCP server will restart. When read, this value always returns noRestart(2).

scalar.name: ipHttpsState
scalar.description: Whether HTTPS is enabled.

scalar.name: ipHttpsPort
scalar.description: The port number for HTTPS.

table.name: dhcpcInterfaceTable
table.description: Table for DHCP client information listed by interface. Depending on the nature of the product, this table may have only one entry(e.g. for the management VLAN), or may have many entries(e.g. for all ports, or for all static VLANs).

row.name: dhcpcInterfaceEntry
row.description: Entry for DHCP client information listed by interface.

column.name: dhcpcIfIndex
column.description: This is defined by ifIndex in the IF-MIB (static vlan if index).

column.name: dhcpcIfClientIdMode
column.description: Whether the Client ID is in text mode or in Hex mode.

column.name: dhcpcIfClientId
column.description: The value that the DHCP client sets in the client_id option of DHCPDISCOVER and DHCPREQUEST messages. This value may be used by DHCP servers to uniquely identify the client.

column.name: dhcpcIfVendorClassIdMode
column.description: Whether the vendor class ID is in text mode or in Hex mode.

column.name: dhcpcIfVendorClassId
column.description: The value that the DHCP client sets in the vendor class_id option of DHCPDISCOVER and DHCPREQUEST messages. This value may be used by DHCP servers to identify vendor classof the client.

table.name: dhcpRelayServerAddrTable
table.description: The role of the DHCP relay agent is to forward requests and replies between server and client when they are not in the same subnet. To enable DHCP relay service the user needs to specify relay server IP address and then restart DHCP relay. This table is to specify relay server IP address, the maximum number of server IP addresses user can specify is 5. To restart DHCP relay, please use the dhcpRelayRestart variable.

row.name: dhcpRelayServerAddrEntry
row.description: A conceptual row of dhcpRelayServerAddrTable.

column.name: dhcpRelayServerAddrServerIp
column.description: The IP address of the relay server.

scalar.name: dhcpRelayRestart
scalar.description: Set this object to restart(1) to restart DCHP Relay. Always get noRestart(2) when you read this variable.

table.name: dhcpRelayServerInetAddrTable
table.description: The role of DHCP Relay Agent is to forward requests and replies between server and client when they are not in the same subnet. To enable DHCP Relay service user needs to specify Relay Server IP address and then restart DHCP Relay. This Table is to specify Relay Server IP address,the maximum numbers of server IP address user can specify is 5.To Restart DHCP Relay, please use the dhcpRelayRestart variable.

row.name: dhcpRelayServerInetAddrEntry
row.description: A conceptual row of dhcpRelayServerAddrTable.

column.name: dhcpRelayServerInetAddressType
column.description: The INET address type of the relay server.

column.name: dhcpRelayServerInetAddress
column.description: The INET address of the relay server.

table.name: dhcpPoolTable
table.description: A dhcp pool is a collection of user configuration such as option config-lease time or dns-server IPs, a network address for network pool, or a host IP plus a hardware address pair for host pool. However, a dhcp pool only can either be a network pool or a host pool, or none of them (such as that pool only containing option config no network address config or a host ip config as well)

row.name: dhcpPoolEntry
row.description: A conceptual row of dhcpPoolTable.

column.name: dhcpPoolPoolType
column.description: Pool Type: notSpecify(1); netWork(2);host(3)

column.name: dhcpPoolPoolAddress
column.description: Pool Address

column.name: dhcpPoolSubnetMask
column.description: Subnet Mask

column.name: dhcpPoolHardwareType
column.description: Hardware type: notSpecify(1); ethernet(2); ieee802(3); fddi(4)

column.name: dhcpPoolMacAddress
column.description: MAC address

column.name: dhcpPoolstatus
column.description: Setting this to valid(1) creates an entry. Setting this to invalid(2) destroys an entry.

table.name: dhcpPoolOptionTable
table.description: This is the Option table of the dhcpPoolTable, user can specify Options configuration in this table

row.name: dhcpPoolOptionEntry
row.description: A conceptual row of dhcpPoolOptionTable.

column.name: dhcpPoolOptionNextServer
column.description: Specifies the IP address of the next server in the boot process, which is typically a Trivial File Transfer Protocol(TFTP) server. One IP address is required.

column.name: dhcpPoolOptionNetbiosNodeType
column.description: Specifies the NetBIOS node type. Valid types are: none(1) b-node(2) - Broadcast p-node(3) - Peer-to-peer m-node(4) - Mixed h-node(5) - Hybrid.

column.name: dhcpPoolOptionDomainName
column.description: Specifies the domain name string.

column.name: dhcpPoolOptionBootFile
column.description: To specify the name of the default boot image.

column.name: dhcpPoolOptionLeaseTime
column.description: To configure the duration of the lease, in seconds, of an IP address that is assigned from a DHCP Server to a DHCP client. Valid values are from 1 to 31536000 (365 days), and a large number '7FFFFFFF'h, which is 'practically infinite'.

column.name: dhcpPoolOptionCidMode
column.description: Set this variable to text(2) of hex(3) to specify the mode of the Client Id, which is useful for CLI to determine the display way of the Client Id. You will get default value 'notSpecify(1)'when this variable had never been set. Setting this to notSpecify(1) is a invalid operation.

column.name: dhcpPoolOptionCidBuffer
column.description: Content of Client Id. You MUST specify the dhcpPoolOptionCidMode before setting this variable.

table.name: dhcpPoolOptionDnsSerTable
table.description: To specify the DNS IP servers available to a DHCP client, you can specify up to two addresses for each DHCP pool.

row.name: dhcpPoolOptionDnsSerEntry
row.description: A conceptual row of dhcpPoolOptionDnsSerTable.

column.name: dhcpPoolOptionDnsSerIpAddress
column.description: Ip address of the DNS server.

table.name: dhcpPoolOptDefaultRouterTable
table.description: Specifices the default router list for a DHCP Client, you can specify up to two addresses for each DHCP pool.

row.name: dhcpPoolOptDefaultRouterEntry
row.description: A conceptual row of dhcpPoolOptDefaultRouterTable.

column.name: dhcpPoolOptDefaultRouterIpAddress
column.description: Specifies the IP address of a router. One IP address is required.

table.name: dhcpPoolOptNetbiosServerTable
table.description: To configure the NetBIOS WINS name servers that are available to DHCP clients. You can specify up to eight addressed for each DHCP pool.

row.name: dhcpPoolOptNetbiosServerEntry
row.description: A conceptual row of dhcpPoolOptNetbiosServerTable.

column.name: dhcpPoolOptNetbiosServerIpAddress
column.description: Specifies the IP address of the NetBIOS WINS name server. One IP address is required.

table.name: dhcpServerExcludedIpAddrTable
table.description: To specify IP addresses that a DHCP Server shuld not assign to DHCP clients.

row.name: dhcpServerExcludedIpAddrEntry
row.description: A conceptual row of dhcpServerExcludedIpAddrTable.

column.name: dhcpServerExcludedIpAddrStatus
column.description: Setting this to valid(1) creates an entry. Setting this to invalid(2) destroys an entry.

table.name: dhcpServerLeaseBindingTable
table.description: To configure the address bindings on the DHCP server.

row.name: dhcpServerLeaseBindingEntry
row.description: A conceptual row of dhcpServerLeaseBindingTable.

column.name: dhcpServerLeaseBindingMac
column.description: The MAC address of the host as recorded on the DHCP Server.

column.name: dhcpServerLeaseBindingLeaseTime
column.description: The lease expiration date of the IP address of the host.

column.name: dhcpServerLeaseBindingStartTime
column.description: Show current system real time in sec.

column.name: dhcpServerLeaseBindingStatus
column.description: Setting this to valid(1) creates an entry. Setting this to invalid(2) destroys an entry.

scalar.name: dhcpServerServiceStatus
scalar.description: Setting this to 1 to enable the dhcp server service. Setting this to 2 to disable the dhcp server service.

table.name: dhcpPoolInetTable
table.description: A DHCP pool is a collection of user configuration such as option config-lease time or DNS-server IPs, a network address for network pool, or a host IP plus a hardware address pair for host pool. However, a DHCP pool only can either be a network pool or a host pool, or none of them (such as that pool only containing option config no network address config or a host IP config as well).

row.name: dhcpPoolInetEntry
row.description: A conceptual row of dhcpPoolInetTable.

column.name: dhcpPoolInetPoolType
column.description: Pool type: notSpecify(1), netWork(2), host(3).

column.name: dhcpPoolInetAddressType
column.description: Pool address type

column.name: dhcpPoolInetAddress
column.description: Pool address

column.name: dhcpPoolInetSubnetMaskType
column.description: subnet mask type

column.name: dhcpPoolInetSubnetMask
column.description: subnet mask

column.name: dhcpPoolInetHardwareType
column.description: Hardware type: notSpecify(1), ethernet(2), ieee802(3) ,fddi(4).

column.name: dhcpPoolInetMacAddress
column.description: MAC address.

column.name: dhcpPoolInetStatus
column.description: Setting this to valid(1) creates an entry. Setting this to invalid(2) destroys an entry.

table.name: dhcpPoolInetOptionTable
table.description: This is the Option table of the dhcpPoolTable, user can specify options configuration in this table.

row.name: dhcpPoolInetOptionEntry
row.description: A conceptual row of dhcpPoolOptionTable.

column.name: dhcpPoolInetOptionNextServerAddrType
column.description: Specifies the INET address type of the next server in the boot process.

column.name: dhcpPoolInetOptionNextServerAddr
column.description: Specifies the INET address of the next server in the boot process, which is typically a Trivial File Transfer Protocol(TFTP) server. One INET address is required.

column.name: dhcpPoolInetOptionNetbiosNodeType
column.description: Specifies the NetBIOS node type. Valid types are: none(1) b-node(2) - Broadcast p-node(3) - Peer-to-peer m-node(4) - Mixed h-node(5) - Hybrid.

column.name: dhcpPoolInetOptionDomainName
column.description: Specifies the domain name string.

column.name: dhcpPoolInetOptionBootFile
column.description: To specify the name of the default boot image.

column.name: dhcpPoolInetOptionLeaseTime
column.description: To configure the duration of the lease, in seconds, of an IP address that is assigned from a DHCP Server to a DHCP client. Valid values are from 1 to 31536000 (365 days), and a large number '7FFFFFFF'h, which is 'practically infinite'.

column.name: dhcpPoolInetOptionCidMode
column.description:
Set this variable to text(2) or hex(3) to specify the mode of the client ID, which is useful for CLI to determine the display format of the client ID.
The original value of object is set to 'notSpecify(1)'. But setting it to notSpecify(1) is a invalid operation.

column.name: dhcpPoolInetOptionCidBuffer
column.description:
Content of Client Id.
dhcpPoolOptionCidMode MUST be specified before setting this variable.

table.name: dhcpPoolInetOptionDnsSerTable
table.description: To specify the DNS IP servers available to a DHCP client, you can specify up to two addresses for each DHCP pool.

row.name: dhcpPoolInetOptionDnsSerEntry
row.description: A conceptual row of dhcpPoolOptionDnsSerTable.

column.name: dhcpPoolInetOptionDnsSerAddrType
column.description: INET address type of the DNS server.

column.name: dhcpPoolInetOptionDnsSerAddr
column.description: INET address of the DNS server.

table.name: dhcpPoolOptInetDefaultRouterTable
table.description: Specifies the default router list for a DHCP Client, you can specify up to two addresses for each DHCP pool.

row.name: dhcpPoolOptInetDefaultRouterEntry
row.description: A conceptual row of dhcpPoolOptDefaultRouterTable.

column.name: dhcpPoolOptInetDefaultRouterAddrType
column.description: Specifies the INET address type of a router.

column.name: dhcpPoolOptInetDefaultRouterAddr
column.description: Specifies the INET address of a router.

table.name: dhcpPoolOptInetNetbiosServerTable
table.description: To configure the NetBIOS WINS name servers that are available to DHCP clients. You can specify up to eight addressed for each DHCP pool.

row.name: dhcpPoolOptInetNetbiosServerEntry
row.description: A conceptual row of dhcpPoolOptNetbiosServerTable.

column.name: dhcpPoolOptInetNetbiosServerAddrType
column.description: Specifies the INET address type of the NetBIOS WINS name server.

column.name: dhcpPoolOptInetNetbiosServerAddr
column.description: Specifies the INET address of the NetBIOS WINS name server.

table.name: dhcpServerExcludedInetAddrTable
