table.description: To specify IP addresses that a DHCP Server should not assign to DHCP clients.

row.name: dhcpServerExcludedInetAddrEntry
row.description: A conceptual row of dhcpServerExcludedIpAddrTable.

column.name: dhcpServerExcludedInetAddrStatus
column.description: Setting this to valid(1) creates an entry. Setting this to invalid(2) destroys an entry.

table.name: dhcpServerInetLeaseBindingTable
table.description: To configure the address bindings on the DHCP server.

row.name: dhcpServerInetLeaseBindingEntry
row.description: A conceptual row of dhcpServerLeaseBindingTable.

column.name: dhcpServerInetLeaseBindingMac
column.description: The MAC address of the host as recorded on the DHCP Server.

column.name: dhcpServerInetLeaseBindingLeaseTime
column.description: The lease expiration date of the INET address of the host.

column.name: dhcpServerInetLeaseBindingStartTime
column.description: Show current system real time in sec.

column.name: dhcpServerInetLeaseBindingStatus
column.description: Setting this to valid(1) creates an entry. Setting this to invalid(2) destroys an entry.

table.name: dhcpInformTable
table.description: Table for DHCP Inform configuration.

row.name: dhcpInformEntry
row.description: A conceptual row of dhcpInformTable.

column.name: dhcpInformStatus
column.description: The status of the DHCP Inform.

scalar.name: pingIpAddress
scalar.description: Specifies the IP address of the device that is planned to ping.

scalar.name: pingPacketSize
scalar.description: Specifies the size of each data potion of ping packets in bytes.

scalar.name: pingCompleted
scalar.description: A value of true(1) will be read when this ping operation has been either responded to or changed to the time-out status. A value of false(2) will be read when there is a ping operation running and all associated objects in the pingMgt operation cannot be modified during this period.

scalar.name: pingAction
scalar.description: The action of the pingMgt operation. Sets these objects to pingStart(2) to begin the ping operation. Once the action is set to pingStart(2), the associated pingMgt objects cannot be modified until this ping operation is completed (pingCompleted is true). When the ping has ended or there is no ping operation performing, this object will get a value of noAction(1).

scalar.name: pingProbeCount
scalar.description: Specifies the number of times to perform a ping operation at a remote host.

scalar.name: pingSentPackets
scalar.description: The value of this object reflects the number of probes sent. The value of this object must be reported as 0 when no probes have been sent.

scalar.name: pingReceivedPackets
scalar.description: Number of responses received. The value of this object must be reported as 0 when no probe responses have been received.

scalar.name: pingPacketLossRate
scalar.description: Packet loss rate of this ping operation. This variable is calculated by pingReceivedPackets and pingSentPackets. The rate is expressed as a percentage.

table.name: pingHistoryTable
table.description: Contains the executive result information for the ping operation.

row.name: pingHistoryEntry
row.description: A conceptual row in the pingHistory table.

column.name: pingHistoryIndex
column.description: A new entry in this table is created when the result of a ping probe is determined. The old entries will be cleared when a new ping action is started.

column.name: pingHistoryResponse
column.description: This variable represents the round trip time and is measured in milliseconds. The variable is the difference between received time and sent time for a ping probe. If the difference value is more than the time-out value or no response is received, then the variable will be 5000 milliseconds.

table.name: iPAddrTable
table.description: A table of iPAddrEntry.

row.name: iPAddrEntry
row.description:
A set of configuration parameters for a particular network interface on this device. If the device has no network interface, this table is empty.
The index is composed of the ifIndex assigned to the corresponding interface.

column.name: iPAddrPrimaryInterface
column.description: Whether this is a primary interface.

column.name: iPAddrUnnumbered
column.description: Whether this is an unnumbered interface.

column.name: iPAddrStatus

table.name: vlanTable
table.description: Table for VLAN configuration.

row.name: vlanEntry
row.description: Entry for VLAN configuration.

column.name: vlanIndex
column.description: Based on dot1qVlanIndex in the Q-BRIDGE-MIB. This table has only one entry - the entry for the VLAN of the management interface.

column.name: vlanAddressMethod
column.description: Method to get the IP address.

table.name: vlanPortTable
table.description: Table for port configuration in VLAN.

row.name: vlanPortEntry
row.description: Entry for port configuration in VLAN.

column.name: vlanPortIndex
column.description: The port and the trunk (excluding trunk members) interface of the portTable. The interface identified by a particular value of this index is the same interface as identified by the same value of dot1qPvid in the Q-BRIDGE-MIB.

column.name: vlanPortMode
column.description: This variable sets the 802.1Q VLAN mode. Setting it to hybrid(1) sets a hybrid link. Setting it to dot1qTrunk(2) sets a trunk link. Setting it to access(3) sets an access link.

column.name: vlanPortPrivateVlanType
column.description: The port type defined for private VLAN.

table.name: voiceVlanOuiTable
table.description: A table containing the mac address which can be identified by Voice VLAN.

row.name: voiceVlanOuiEntry
row.description: A table containing the mac address which can be identified by Voice VLAN.

column.name: voiceVlanOuiAddress
column.description: MAC address can be identified by voice vlan.

column.name: voiceVlanOuiMask
column.description: The mask of MAC address.

column.name: voiceVlanOuiDescription
column.description: The description of OUI.

column.name: voiceVlanOuiStatus
column.description: Current operation status of the row.

scalar.name: voiceVlanEnabledId
scalar.description: Voice VLAN enabled status and VLAN ID: enabled (1..4093), disabled (-1).

scalar.name: voiceVlanAgingTime
scalar.description: Voice VLAN aging time, the unit of which is minute.

table.name: voiceVlanPortTable
table.description: A list of voice VLAN port entries.

row.name: voiceVlanPortEntry
row.description: An entry containing Voice VLAN port information, which is applicable to a Voice VLAN enabled interface.

column.name: voiceVlanPortIfIndex
column.description: The index of interface on which Voice VLAN function is enabled.

column.name: voiceVlanPortMode
column.description: Voice VLAN configuration mode status.

column.name: voiceVlanPortSecurity
column.description: If the security is enabled, the port only allows voice traffic for the Voice VLAN.

column.name: voiceVlanPortPriority
column.description: The priority of the voice vlan traffic in the port.

column.name: voiceVlanPortRuleOui
column.description: The address of voice device is learned from OUI table.

column.name: voiceVlanPortRuleLldp
column.description: The address of voice device is learned from LLDP discovery.

column.name: voiceVlanPortRemainAge
column.description: Remaining aging time, the unit of which is minute.

scalar.name: vlanDot1qTunnelStatus
scalar.description: This parameter is used to globally enable/disable 802.1Q Tunneling on the device.

table.name: vlanDot1qTunnelPortTable
table.description: Table for port configuration in 802.1Q Tunneling.

row.name: vlanDot1qTunnelPortEntry
row.description: Entry for port configuration in 802.1Q Tunneling.

column.name: vlanDot1qTunnelPortMode
column.description: This variable sets the 802.1Q Tunneling mode. Setting it to none(1) indicates no mode in this port. Setting it to access(2) sets as dot1q-tunnel mode port which link to customer. Setting it to uplink(3) sets as dot1q-tunnel mode port which link to service-provider. If vlanDot1qTunnelStatus is disabled, it means vlanDot1qTunnelPortMode is inactive.

column.name: vlanDot1qTunnelPortEtherType
column.description: TPID for 802.1Q encapsulation. It's used to select a nonstandard (nondefault) 2-byte ethertype to identify 802.1Q tagged frames.

table.name: macVlanTable
table.description: A table that contains the settings for MAC-based VLAN.

row.name: macVlanEntry
row.description: A conceptual row in the macVlanTable.

column.name: macVlanMacAddress
column.description: The MAC address that may specify an entry in the table which contains MAC-based VLAN information.

column.name: macVlanId
column.description: Specifies the VLAN ID which the MAC address associates with.

column.name: macVlanPriority
column.description: Specifies the priority whcich the MAC address associates with.

column.name: macVlanStatus
column.description: Set this to valid(1) to create an entry. Set this to invalid(2) to destroy an entry.

scalar.name: macVlanClearAction
scalar.description: Action for clearing macVlanTable. When this object is set to clear(2), all entries in macVlanTable will be cleared. When this object is read, the value of this object is always noClear(1).

table.name: subnetVlanTable
table.description: A table that contains the settings for IP subnet-based VLAN.

row.name: subnetVlanEntry
row.description: A conceptual row in the subnetVlanTable.

column.name: subnetVlanIpAddress
column.description: The IPv4 address of a subnet. Any assignment (implicit or otherwise) of an instance of this object to a value x must be rejected if the bitwise logical-AND of x with the value of the corresponding instance of the subnetVlanMask object is not equal to x.

column.name: subnetVlanMask
column.description: The netmask of a subnet. Any assignment (implicit or otherwise) of an instance of this object to a value x must be rejected if the bitwise logical-AND of x with the value of the corresponding instance of the subnetVlanIpAddress object is not equal to subnetVlanIpAddress.

column.name: subnetVlanId
column.description: Specifies the VLAN ID which the subnet associates with.

column.name: subnetVlanPriority
column.description: Specifies the priority whcich the subnet associates with.

column.name: subnetVlanStatus
column.description: Set this to valid(1) to create an entry. Set this to invalid(2) to destroy an entry.

scalar.name: subnetVlanClearAction
scalar.description: Action for clearing subnetVlanTable. When this object is set to clear(2), all entries in subnetVlanTable will be cleared. When this object is read, the value of this object is always noClear(1).

table.name: vlanStaticExtTable
table.description: The extension table of dot1qVlanStaticTable. This table enhances the original table with extra vlanStaticExtRspanStatus to create and destroy RSPAN VLAN(s).

row.name: vlanStaticExtEntry
row.description: A conceptual row in the vlanStaticExtTable.

column.name: vlanStaticExtRspanStatus
column.description: Displays type of a VLAN is vlan(2) or rspanVlan(3). Set this to destroy(1) to destroy a RSPAN VLAN. Set this to rspanVlan(3) to create a RSPAN VLAN. Setting this to vlan(2) is not allowed.

table.name: vlanStaticTable
table.description: Table for static VLAN configuration including VLAN aggregation support.

row.name: vlanStaticEntry
row.description: Static information for a VLAN configured on the device by (local or network) management.

column.name: vlanStaticIndex
column.description: The VLAN ID of the VLAN.

column.name: vlanStaticInterfaceType
column.description: The interface type of the VLAN (there is a subtype of IANAifType). l2vlan(135) refers to L2 interface and can't accept any L3 related configuration. l3ipvlan(136) refers to L3 interface and can accept L3 related configuration.

table.name: vlanDot1qTunnelSrvCvidPortTable
table.description: Table for port configuration to specify how to insert outer tag by matching customer VLAN ID.

row.name: vlanDot1qTunnelSrvCvidPortEntry
row.description: Entry for port configuration to specify how to insert outer tag by matching customer VLAN ID.

column.name: vlanDot1qTunnelSrvCvidPortIndex
column.description: The port interface of the vlanDot1qTunnelSrvCvidPortTable. The interface identified by a particular value of this index is the same interface as identified by the same value of ifIndex in the IF-MIB.

column.name: vlanDot1qTunnelSrvCvidPortCvid
column.description: Specifies customer VLAN ID.

column.name: vlanDot1qTunnelSrvCvidPortSvid
column.description: Specifies service VLAN ID.

column.name: vlanDot1qTunnelSrvCvidPortStatus
column.description: Sets to valid(1) to create an entry. Sets to invalid(2) to destroy an entry.

column.name: vlanDot1qTunnelSrvCvidPortAction
column.description: Sets to assignSvid(2) to assign service VLAN ID. Sets to removeCtag(4) to remove customer VLAN tag.

table.name: prioWrrPortTable
table.description: Table for per port weighted round robin (WRR).

row.name: prioWrrPortEntry
row.description: Entry for per port weighted round robin (WRR).

column.name: prioWrrPortWeight
column.description: Weight for this entry.

table.name: prioSchedModePortTable
table.description: Table for per port scheduling mode.

row.name: prioSchedModePortEntry
row.description: Entry for per port scheduling mode.

column.name: prioSchedModePort
column.description: The scheduling mode status of ethernet port. wrr(1), strict(2), strict-wrr(4)

scalar.name: trapIpFilterRejectMode
scalar.description: This variable is for trap var binding, indicated the ipfilter reject mode. web(1), snmp(2), telnet(3).

scalar.name: trapIpFilterRejectIp
scalar.description: This variable is for trap var binding, indicating the IP address that rejected by the ipfilter.

scalar.name: trapVarLoginUserName
scalar.description: The name of the user who logs into the switch.

scalar.name: trapVarSessionType
scalar.description: The method by which the user logs in to control the switch.

scalar.name: trapVarLoginInetAddressType
scalar.description: The address type of the address associated with this agent. Only IPv4 and IPv6 types are supported.

scalar.name: trapVarLoginInetAddress
scalar.description: The IP address from which the user logs into the switch.

scalar.name: trapIpFilterRejectInetAddressType
scalar.description: This variable is for trap var binding, indicating the IP address that was rejected by the IP filter.

scalar.name: trapIpFilterRejectInetAddress
scalar.description: This variable is for trap var binding, indicating the IP address that was rejected by the IP filter.

scalar.name: trapAutoUpgradeResult
scalar.description: The parameter indicates which result triggers the trap.

scalar.name: trapAutoUpgradeNewVer
scalar.description: The parameter indicates new version which was upgraded to. When trapAutoUpgradeResult was failed(2), it would be null string.

scalar.name: trapPortSecurityIntrusionMac
scalar.description: This variable indicates the intrusion MAC address.

table.name: rateLimitPortTable
table.description: Table for rate limit of each port.

row.name: rateLimitPortEntry
row.description: Entry for rate limit of each port.

column.name: rlPortIndex
column.description: The port and the trunk (including trunk member) interface of the portTable. The interface identified by a particular value of this index is the same interface as identified by the same value of ifIndex in the IF-MIB.

column.name: rlPortInputStatus
column.description: Whether input rate limit is enabled for this port.

column.name: rlPortOutputStatus
column.description: Whether output rate limit is enabled for this port.

column.name: rlPortInputLimitInKilo
column.description: Value of the input rate limit. Its unit is kilobits per second. For a 100 Mbps port, the range is 64 to 100000. For a 1000 Mbps port, the range is 64 to 1000000.

column.name: rlPortOutputLimitInKilo
column.description: Value of the output rate limit. Its unit is kilobits per second. For a 100 Mbps port, the range is 64 to 100000. For a 1000 Mbps port, the range is 64 to 1000000.

table.name: prioAclToCosMappingTable
table.description: Table for ACL to CoS Mapping.

row.name: prioAclToCosMappingEntry
row.description: Entry for ACL to CoS Mapping.

column.name: prioAclToCosMappingIfIndex
column.description: The port interface of the prioAclToCosMappingEntry. The interface identified by a particular value of this index is the same interface as identified by the same value of ifIndex in the IF-MIB.

column.name: prioAclToCosMappingAclName
column.description: The name of an IP ACL. Within a feature a unique name is used to identify the list to which the entry belongs in the device.

column.name: prioAclToCosMappingCosValue
column.description: CoS value of the prioAclToCosMappingTable.

column.name: prioAclToCosMappingStatus

table.name: prioIfClassificationModeTable
table.description: Table for setting the interface Qos mapping classification mode.

row.name: prioIfClassificationModeEntry
row.description: Entry for setting the interface Qos mapping classification mode.

column.name: prioIfClassificationModeIf
column.description: The port or trunk interface of the device. The interface identified by a particular value of this index is the same interface as identified by the same value of ifIndex in the IF-MIB.

column.name: prioIfClassificationModeStatus
column.description: The Qos mapping classification mode of the interface. cos mode means that the internal priority is mapped from priority field of packet's VLAN tag if a VLAN tag exists; IP precedence mode means that the internal priority is mapped from the IP precedence value of IP packets; DSCP mode means the internal priority is mapped from the dscp value of IP packets.

table.name: prioCosToDscpTable
table.description: Table for CoS/CFI to internal QoS label mapping.

row.name: prioCosToDscpEntry
row.description: Entry for CoS/CFI to internal QoS label mapping.

column.name: prioCosToDscpIfValue
column.description: The port or the trunk interface of the device. The interface identified by a particular value of this index is the same interface as identified by the same value of ifIndex in the IF-MIB.

column.name: prioCosToDscpCosValue
column.description: The CoS value (0~7) mapped to an internal QoS label value which is composed of PHB(3 bits) and drop precedence(2 bits).

column.name: prioCosToDscpCFIValue
column.description: The CFI value (0 or 1) mapped to an internal QoS label value which is composed of PHB(3 bits) and drop precedence(2 bits).

column.name: prioCosToDscpDscpValue
column.description:
The DSCP value used to represent the internal QoS label (3 bits PHB+2 bits Drop precedence). The MSB 4 bits of DSCP is used to represent PHB value of QoS label; The LSB 2 bits of DSCP are used to represent the drop precedence value of QoS label. Green(0), Yellow(3), Red(1). In a word, PHB=(DSCP>>2), Drop precedence=(DSCP & 0x3).
Note: The setting range of PHB value must be 0~7 and the setting drop precedence value must be one of the values (0,1,3).

table.name: prioPrecToDscpTable
table.description: Table for IP precedence to internal QoS label mapping. This table setting will take effect only when the interface QoS mapping classification mode is set to IP precedence mode.

row.name: prioPrecToDscpEntry
row.description: Entry for IP precedence to internal QoS label mapping.

column.name: prioPrecToDscpIfValue
column.description: The port or trunk interface of the device. The interface identified by a particular value of this index is the same interface as identified by the same value of ifIndex in the IF-MIB.

column.name: prioPrecToDscpPrecValue
column.description: The IP precedence value mapped to internal QoS label value which is composed of PHB (3 bits) and drop precedence (2 bits).

column.name: prioPrecToDscpDscpValue
column.description: The DSCP value used to represent internal QoS label (3 bits PHB + 2 bits Drop precedence). The MSB 4 bits of DSCP are used to represent PHB value of QoS label; The LSB 2 bits of DSCP are used to represent the drop precedence value of QoS label. Green(0),Yellow(3), Red(1). In a word, PHB=(DSCP>>2), Drop precedence=(DSCP & 0x3). Note: The setting range of PHB value must be 0~7 and the setting drop precedence value must be one of values(0,1,3).

table.name: prioDscpToDscpTable
table.description: Table for DSCP to internal QoS label mapping. This table setting will take effect only when the interface Qos mapping classification mode is set to DSCP mode.

row.name: prioDscpToDscpEntry
row.description: Entry for ingress DSCP to internal QoS label mapping.

column.name: prioDscpToDscpIfValue
column.description: The port or trunk interface of the device. The interface identified by a particular value of this index is the same interface as identified by the same value of ifIndex in the IF-MIB.

column.name: prioDscpToDscpIngressDscpValue
column.description: The ingress DSCP value which will be mapped to internal QoS label value.

column.name: prioDscpToDscpDscpValue
column.description:
The DSCP value used to represent internal QoS label (3 bits PHB + 2 bits Drop precedence). The MSB 4 bits of DSCP are used to represent PHB value of Qos label. The LSB 2 bits of DSCP are used to represent the drop precedence value of QoS label. Green(0),Yellow(3), Red(1). In a word, PHB=(DSCP>>2), Drop precedence=(DSCP & 0x3).
Note: The setting range of PHB value must be 0~7 and the setting drop precedence value must be one of values (0,1,3).

table.name: prioDstPortToDscpTable
table.description: Table for TCP/UDP destination port number to internal Qos label mapping. This table setting will always take effect for TCP/UDP packets no matter of what interface QoS mapping classification mode is set.

row.name: prioDstPortToDscpEntry
row.description: Entry for TCP/UDP destination port to internal QoS label mapping.

column.name: prioDstPortToDscpIfValue
column.description: The port or the trunk interface of the device. The interface identified by a particular value of this index is the same interface as identified by the same value of ifIndex in the IF-MIB.

column.name: prioDstPortToDscpProtocolValue
column.description: The protocol value (TCP:6, UDP:17) which will be mapped to internal QoS label value.

column.name: prioDstPortToDscpDstPortValue
column.description: The destination port number value which will be mapped to internal QoS label value.

column.name: prioDstPortToDscpDscpValue
column.description: The DSCP value used to represent internal QoS label (3 bits PHB + 2 bits Drop precedence). The MSB 4 bits of DSCP is used to represent PHB value of QoS label. The LSB 2 bits of DSCP is used to represent the drop precedence value of Qos label. Green(0),Yellow(3), Red(1). In a word, PHB=(DSCP>>2), Drop precedence=(DSCP & 0x3). Note: The setting range of PHB value must be 0~7 and the setting drop precedence value must be one of values (0,1,3).

table.name: prioDscpToCosTable
table.description: Table for internal QoS label to CoS and CFI mapping.

row.name: prioDscpToCosEntry
row.description: Entry for internal QoS label to CoS and CFI mapping.

column.name: prioDscpToCosIfValue
column.description: The port or trunk interface of the device. The interface identified by a particular value of this index is the same interface as identified by the same value of ifIndex in the IF-MIB.

column.name: prioDscpToCosPHBValue
column.description: The PHB value of internal QoS label.

column.name: prioDscpToCosDropPrecedenceValue
column.description: The drop precedence value of internal QoS label. Green(0), Yellow(3), Red(1).

column.name: prioDscpToCosCFICosValue
column.description: The remarked CFI and CoS value mapped from the internal Qos label value when the packet leaves the device. The egress remarked CFI value equals to (prioDscpToCosCFICosValue >>3) and the egress remarked CoS value equals to (prioDscpToCosCFICosValue & 0x7).

table.name: prioPrioToDropPrecTable
table.description: Table for packet priority to drop precedence mapping.

row.name: prioPrioToDropPrecEntry
row.description: Entry for packet priority to drop precedence mapping.

column.name: prioPrioToDropPrecIfValue
column.description: The port or the trunk interface of the device. The interface identified by a particular value of this index is the same interface as identified by the same value of ifIndex in the IF-MIB.

column.name: prioPrioToDropPrecPriorityValue
column.description: The value of packet default priority.

column.name: prioPrioToDropPrecPrecValue
column.description: The drop precedence value of internal QoS label. Green(0),Yellow(3), Red(1).

table.name: prioDscpToQueueTable
table.description: Table for PHB to queue mapping.

row.name: prioDscpToQueueEntry
row.description: Entry for PHB to queue mapping.

column.name: prioDscpToQueueIfValue
column.description: The port or trunk interface of the device. The interface identified by a particular value of this index is the same interface as identified by the same value of ifIndex in the IF-MIB.

column.name: prioDscpToQueuePHBValue
column.description: The PHB value of internal QoS label.

column.name: prioDscpToQueueQueueValue
column.description: The queue value which is mapped from the PHB value of QoS label.

table.name: diffServPortTable
table.description: Table for differentiated services on each port.

row.name: diffServPortEntry
row.description: Entry for differentiated services on each port.

column.name: diffServPortIfIndex
column.description: This object is the interface index of diffServPortEntry. The interface identified by a particular value of this index is the same interface as identified by the same value of ifIndex in the IF-MIB.

column.name: diffServPortPolicyMapIndex
column.description: Specifies the policy map binding to the interface. The policy map identified by a particular value of this index is associated with the same DiffServPolicyMapEntry as identified by the same value of diffServPolicyMapIndex.

column.name: diffServPortIngressIpAclIndex
column.description: Specifies the ingress IP ACL binding to the interface. The ingress IP ACL identified by a particular value of this index is associated with the same diffServAclEntry as identified by the same value of diffServAclIndex.

column.name: diffServPortIngressMacAclIndex
column.description: Specifies the ingress MAC ACL binding to the interface. The ingress MAC ACL identified by a particular value of this index is associated with the same diffServAclEntry as identified by the same value of diffServAclIndex.

column.name: diffServPortIngressIpv6AclIndex
column.description: Specifies the ingress IPv6 ACL binding to the interface. The ingress IPv6 ACL identified by a particular value of this index is associated with the same diffServAclEntry as identified by the same value of diffServAclIndex.

table.name: diffServPolicyMapTable
table.description: Table for policy map.

row.name: diffServPolicyMapEntry
row.description: Entry for policy map.

column.name: diffServPolicyMapIndex
column.description: An index that uniquely identifies an entry in this table.

column.name: diffServPolicyMapName
column.description: The name of this entry.

column.name: diffServPolicyMapDescription
column.description: The description of this entry.

column.name: diffServPolicyMapElementIndexList
column.description: The octet string containes the diffServPolicyMapElementEntry indexes. Two octets express one index and it is represented in network order. This index list indicates the diffServPolicyMapEntrys which belong to this entry.

column.name: diffServPolicyMapStatus

scalar.name: diffServPolicyMapAttachCtlIndex
scalar.description: Index for attachment control. Specifies the policy map as the target to relate with the policy map element. The policy map identified by a particular value of this index is associated with the same diffServPolicyMapEntry as identified by the same value of diffServPolicyMapIndex.

scalar.name: diffServPolicyMapAttachCtlElementIndex
scalar.description: Element Index for attachment control.Specifies the policy map element to relate with the policy map. The policy map element identified by a particular value of this index is associated with the same diffServPolicyMapElementEntry as identified by the same value of diffServPolicyMapElementIndex.

scalar.name: diffServPolicyMapAttachCtlAction
scalar.description: Action for attachment control. When setting this object to attach(2) to begin the attaching operation, a particular policy map element is attached to a particular policy map. When setting this object to detach(3) to begin the not attached operation, a particular policy map element is not attached to a particular policy map. When the action is finshed or no action is taken, the value of this object is noAction(1). A particular policy map is specified in the diffServPolicyMapAttachCtlIndex. A particularpolicy map element is specified in the diffServPolicyMapAttachCtlElementIndex.

table.name: diffServPolicyMapElementTable
table.description: Table for policy map element.

row.name: diffServPolicyMapElementEntry
row.description: Entry for policy map element.

column.name: diffServPolicyMapElementIndex
column.description: An index that uniquely identifies an entry in this table.

column.name: diffServPolicyMapElementClassMapIndex
column.description: Specifies the class map binding to this entry. The class map identified by a particular value of this index is associated with the same diffServClassMapEntry as identified by the same value of diffServClassMapIndex.

column.name: diffServPolicyMapElementMeterIndex
column.description: Specifies the meter binding to this entry. The meter identified by a particular value of this index is associated with the same diffServMeterEntry as identified by the same value of diffServMeterIndex. If this value is zero, no associated meter will be associated, as zero is not a valid meter index.

column.name: diffServPolicyMapElementActionIndex
column.description: Specifies the action binding to this entry. The action identified by a particular value of this index is associated with the same diffServActionEntry as identified by the same value of diffServActionIndex.

column.name: diffServPolicyMapElementStatus

table.name: diffServClassMapTable
table.description: Table for class map.

row.name: diffServClassMapEntry
row.description: Entry for class map.

column.name: diffServClassMapIndex
column.description: An index that uniquely identifies an entry in this table.

column.name: diffServClassMapName
column.description: The name of this entry.

column.name: diffServClassMapDescription
column.description: The description of this entry.

column.name: diffServClassMapMatchType
column.description: The map match type of this entry.

column.name: diffServClassMapElementIndexTypeList
column.description: The octet string containes the type of class map element indexes. Two octets which are represented in network order express one type of the class map element index in network order and it maps the index of differServClasssMapElementIndexList in order. When the type is macAce(1), the maping index of differServClasssMapElementIndexList is the diffServMacAceEntry. When the type is ipAce(2), the maping index of differServClasssMapElementIndexList is the diffServIpAceEntry. When the type is acl(3), the maping index of differServClasssMapElementIndexList is the diffServAclEntry.

column.name: diffServClassMapElementIndexList
column.description: The octet string containes the class map element indexes. Two octets express one index and it is represented in network order. This index list indicates the particular class map elements which belong to this table. The class map element uses type to indicate diffServAclEntry, the diffServIpAceEntry or diffServMacAceEntry. The type is two octet specified in differServClasssMapElementIndexTypeList in order. When the type is macAce(1), the maping index of differServClasssMapElementIndexList is the diffServMacAceEntry. When the type is ipAce(2), the maping index of differServClasssMapElementIndexList is the diffServIpAceEntry. When the type is acl(3), the maping index of differServClasssMapElementIndexList is the diffServAclEntry.

column.name: diffServClassMapStatus

scalar.name: diffServClassMapAttachCtlIndex
scalar.description: Index for attachment control. Specifies the class map as the target to relate with class map elements. The class map identified by a particular value of this index is associated with the same diffServClassMapEntry as identified by the same value of diffServClassMapIndex.

scalar.name: diffServClassMapAttachCtlElementIndexType
scalar.description: Element Index for attachment control. Specifies the type of class map element to relate with the class map. When type is macAce(1), the index of diffServClassMapAttachCtlElementIndex is the index of diffServMacAceEntry. When the type is ipAce(2), the index of diffServClassMapAttachCtlElementIndex is the index of diffServIpAceEntry. When the type is acl(3), the index of diffServClassMapAttachCtlElementIndex is the index of diffServAclEntry.

scalar.name: diffServClassMapAttachCtlElementIndex
scalar.description: Element Index for attachment control. Specifies the class map element related with the class map. The class map element uses type to indicate diffServAclEntry, the diffServIpAceEntry or diffServMacAceEntry. The type is specified in diffServClassMapAttachCtlElementIndexType. When the type is macAce(1), the maping index of differServClasssMapElementIndexList is the diffServMacAceEntry. When the type is ipAce(2), the maping index of differServClasssMapElementIndexList is the diffServIpAceEntry. When the type is acl(3), the maping index of differServClasssMapElementIndexList is the diffServAclEntry.

scalar.name: diffServClassMapAttachCtlAction
scalar.description: Action for attachment control. When setting this object to attach(2) to begin the attaching operation, a particular class map element is attached to a particular class map. When setting this object to detach(3) to begin the not attached operation, then a particular class map element is not attached to a particular class map. When the action is finshed whether successfully or not, or no action is taken, the value of this object always is noAction(1). The value of a particular class map is specified in the AclAttachCtlTargetIndex. The class map element is specified by diffServClassMapAttachCtlElementIndexType and diffServClassMapAttachCtlElementIndex.

table.name: diffServAclTable
table.description: Table for ACL.

row.name: diffServAclEntry
row.description: Entry for ACL.

column.name: diffServAclIndex
column.description: An index that uniquely identifies an entry in the ACL table.

column.name: diffServAclName
column.description: The name of this entry.

column.name: diffServAclType
column.description: The type of this entry. When the value of ACL type is modified, then the ACEs in the diffServAclAceIndexList of this entry will be auto-removed, and this entry will be auto- unbound from the diffServPortTable and the diffServClassMapTable.

column.name: diffServAclAceIndexList
column.description: The octet string containes the ACE indexes. Two octets express one index and it is represented in network order. This index list indicates the particular ACEs which belong to this table. The ACE uses type to indicate the diffServMacAceEntry, the diffServIpAceEntry, the diffServIpv6AceEntry or the diffServArpAceEntry. The type is specified in diffServAclType. When the type is mac(1), the index of diffServAclAceIndexList is the diffServMacAceEntry. When the type is ipstandard(2) or ipextended(3), the index of diffServAclAceIndexList is the diffServIpAceEntry. When the type is ipv6standard(4) or ipv6extended(5), the index of diffServAclAceIndexList is the diffServIpv6AceEntry. When the type is arp(6), the index of diffServAclAceIndexList is the diffServArpAceEntry.

column.name: diffServAclStatus

scalar.name: diffServAclAttachCtlIndex
scalar.description: Index for attachment control. Specifies the ACL as the target to relate with the IP ACE, the MAC ACE or IPv6 ACE. The ACL identified by a particular value of this index is associated with the same diffServAclEntry as identified by the same value of diffServAclIndex.

scalar.name: diffServAclAttachCtlAceType
scalar.description: Type for attachment control. Specifies the type of diffServAclAttachCtlAceIndex to relate with the diffServAclAttachCtlIndex. When the type is macAce(1), the index of diffServAclAceIndexList is the diffServMacAceEntry. When the type is ipAce(2), the index of diffServAclAceIndexList is the diffServIpAceEntry. When the type is ipv6Ace(3), the index of diffServAclAceIndexList is the diffServIpv6AceEntry. When the type is arpAce(4), the index of diffServAclAceIndexList is the diffServArpAceEntry.

scalar.name: diffServAclAttachCtlAceIndex
scalar.description: Index for attachment control. Specifies the ACE to relate with the diffServAclAttachCtlIndex. When diffServAclAttachCtlAceType is macAce(1), the value of diffServAclAttachCtlIndex is the diffServMacAceEntry. When diffServAclAttachCtlAceType is ipAce(2), the value of diffServAclAttachCtlIndex is the diffServIpAceEntry. When diffServAclAttachCtlAceType is ipv6Ace(3), the value of diffServAclAttachCtlIndex is the diffServIpv6AceEntry. When diffServAclAttachCtlAceType is arpAce(4), the value of diffServAclAttachCtlIndex is the diffServArpAceEntry.

scalar.name: diffServAclAttachCtlAction
scalar.description: Action for attachment control. When setting this object to attach(2) to begin the attaching operation, a particular ACE is attached to a particular ACL. When setting this object to detach(3) to begin the not attached operation, then a particular ACE is not attached to a particular ACL. When the action is finshed whether successfully or not, or no action is taken, the value of this object always is noAction(1), The value of a particular ACL is specified in the diffServAclAttachCtlAceType and diffServAclAttachCtlAceIndex.

table.name: diffServIpAceTable
table.description: Table for IP ACE.

row.name: diffServIpAceEntry
row.description: Entry for IP ACE.

column.name: diffServIpAceIndex
column.description: An index that uniquely identifies an entry in the IP ACE table.

column.name: diffServIpAceType
column.description: The specified IP ACE type. When the type of this entry is modified, then this entry will be auto-unbound from the diffServAclEntry and the not supporting field of this entry will be set 0.

column.name: diffServIpAceAccess
column.description: Indicates the action to be taken if a packet matches this ACE.

column.name: diffServIpAceSourceIpAddr
column.description: The specified source IP address. The packet's source address is AND-ed with the value of IpAceSourceIpAddrBitmask and then compared against the value of this object.

column.name: diffServIpAceSourceIpAddrBitmask
column.description: The specified source IP address mask. The packet's source address is AND-ed with the value of IpAceSourceIpAddr and then compared against the value of this object.

column.name: diffServIpAceDestIpAddr
column.description: The specified destination IP address. The packet's destination address is AND-ed with the value of diffServIpAceDestIpAddrBitmask and then compared against the value of this object. This object may not be modified if the associated diffServIpAceType object is equal to standard(1).

column.name: diffServIpAceDestIpAddrBitmask
column.description: The specified destination IP address mask. This object may not be modified if the associated diffServIpAceType object is equal to standard(1).

column.name: diffServIpAceProtocol
column.description: The protocol number field in the IP header used to indicate the higher layer protocol as specified in RFC 1700. A value of 0 matches every IP packet. The object=256 means 'any'. For example: 0 is IP, 1 is ICMP, 2 is IGMP, 4 is IP in IP encapsulation, 6 is TCP, 9 is IGRP, 17 is UDP, 47 is GRE, 50 is ESP, 51 is AH, 88 is IGRP, 89 is OSPF, 94 is KA9Q/NOS compatible IP over IP, 103 is PIMv2, 108 is PCP. This object may not be modified if the associated diffServIpAceType object is equal to standard(1).

column.name: diffServIpAcePrec
column.description: Specifies the IP precedence value to match against. The value of this object is ignored whenever the value of diffServIpAcePrec object is 8. This object may not be modified if the associated diffServIpAceType object is equal to standard(1).

column.name: diffServIpAceTos
column.description: Specifies the IP ToS facility value to match against. The value of this object is ignored whenever the value of diffServIpAcePrec object is 9. This object may not be modified if the associated diffServIpAceType object is equal to standard(1).

column.name: diffServIpAceDscp
column.description: Specifies the DSCP value to match against. The value of this object is ignored whenever the value of diffServIpAcePrec object is 64. This object may not be modified if the associated diffServIpAceType object is equal to standard(1).

column.name: diffServIpAceSourcePortOp
column.description: Indicates how a packet's source TCP/UDP port number is to be compared. noOperator(1), which is the default value, means no comparison is to be made with the source TCP/UDP port number. equal(2), which is used the diffServIpAceSourcePortBitmask and the diffServIpAceMinSourcePort to match against. range(3),which is used the diffServIpAceMinSourcePort and the diffServIpAceMaxSourcePort to match against. This object may not be modified if the associated diffServIpAceType object is equal to standard(1).

column.name: diffServIpAceMinSourcePort
column.description: If the diffServIpAceSourcePortOp is range(3), this indicates the lower bound of the TCP/UDP port number value range. This object may not be modified if the associated diffServIpAceType object is equal to standard(1).

column.name: diffServIpAceSourcePortBitmask
column.description: If the diffServIpAceSourcePortOp is equal(2), this indicates the bitmask of the diffServIpAceMinSourcePort. This object may not be modified if the associated diffServIpAceType object is equal to standard(1).

column.name: diffServIpAceDestPortOp
column.description: Indicates how a packet's destination TCP/UDP port number is to be compared. noOperator(1), which is the default value, means that no comparison is to be made with the destination TCP/UDP port number. equal(2), which is used the diffServIpAceSourcePortBitmask and the diffServIpAceMinDestPort to match against. range(3),which is used the diffServIpAceMinDestPort and the diffServIpAceMaxDestPort to match against. This object may not be modified if the associated diffServIpAceType object is equal to standard(1).

column.name: diffServIpAceMinDestPort
column.description: If the diffServIpAceDestPortOp is range(3), this indicates the lower bound of the TCP/UDP port number value range. This object may not be modified if the associated diffServIpAceType object is equal to standard(1).

column.name: diffServIpAceDestPortBitmask
column.description: If the diffServIpAceDestPortOp is equal(2), this indicates the bitmask of the diffServIpAceMinDestPort. This object may not be modified if the associated diffServIpAceType object is equal to standard(1).

column.name: diffServIpAceControlCode
column.description: Indicates how the control flags of TCP packets are to be compared. diffServIpAceControlCode is AND-ed with diffServIpAceControlCodeBitmask. This object may not be modified if the associated diffServIpAceType object is equal to standard(1).

column.name: diffServIpAceControlCodeBitmask
column.description: Indicates how the control flags of TCP packets are to be compared. It can be used to check multiple flags of the FIN, SYN, RST, PSH, ACK, URG by the sum of FIN=1, SYN=2, RST=4, PSH=8, ACK=16, URG=32. This object may not be modified if the associated diffServIpAceType object is equal to standard(1).

column.name: diffServIpAceStatus

table.name: diffServMacAceTable
table.description: Table for MAC ACE.

row.name: diffServMacAceEntry
row.description: Entry for MAC ACE.

column.name: diffServMacAceIndex
column.description: An index that uniquely identifies an entry in the MAC ACE table.

column.name: diffServMacAceAccess
column.description: Indicates the action to be taken if a packet matches this ACE.

column.name: diffServMacAcePktformat
column.description: Used to check the packet format of the packets. This object cannot be configured when the status of the entry, diffServMacAceStatus, is active(1).

column.name: diffServMacAceSourceMacAddr
column.description: Indicates the 48-bit source MAC address. The specified source MAC of the packet. The packet's source MAC address is AND-ed with the value of diffServMacAceSourceMacAddrBitmask and then compared against the value of this object.

column.name: diffServMacAceSourceMacAddrBitmask
column.description: The specified source MAC address mask.

column.name: diffServMacAceDestMacAddr
column.description: Indicates the 48-bit destination MAC address. The specified destination MAC of the packet. The packet's destination MAC address is AND-ed with the value of diffServMacAceDestMacAddrBitmask and then compared against the value of this object.

column.name: diffServMacAceDestMacAddrBitmask
column.description: The specified destination MAC address mask.

column.name: diffServMacAceVidOp
column.description: Indicates how a packet's VID is to be compared. This object cannot be configured when the status of the entry, diffServMacAceStatus, is active(1).

column.name: diffServMacAceMinVid
column.description: Indicates the lower bound of the VID value range if the diffServMacAceVidOp is range(3).

column.name: diffServMacAceVidBitmask
column.description: The bit mask of the VID. The default value is 0.

column.name: diffServMacAceEtherTypeOp
column.description: Indicates how a packet's ether type is to be compared.

column.name: diffServMacAceEtherTypeBitmask
column.description: The bit mask of Ether type. The default value is 0.

column.name: diffServMacAceMinEtherType
column.description: Indicates the lower bound of the ether type value range if the diffServMacAceEtherTypeOp is range(3).

column.name: diffServMacAceStatus
diffServMacAceCosOp
column.description: Indicates how a packet's CoS is compared. If the object type of diffServMacAceCosOp is equal(2), diffServMacAceMinCos indicates the CoS value for comparing, and diffServMacAceCosBitmask is used as the bitmask of the CoS value. If the object type of diffServMacAceCosOp is range(3), diffServMacAceMinCos should be used as the lower bound of the CoS value.

column.name: diffServMacAceCosBitmask
column.description: Indicates the bitmask of the CoS value if the object type of diffServMacAceCosOp is equal(2). The default value is 0.

column.name: diffServMacAceMinCos
column.description: If the object type of diffServMacAceCosOp is equal(2), diffServMacAceMinCos indicates the CoS value for comparing. If the object type of diffServMacAceCosOp is range(3), diffServMacAceMinCos indicates the lower bound of the CoS value.

table.name: diffServActionTable
table.description: Table for action.

row.name: diffServActionEntry
row.description: Entry for action.

column.name: diffServActionIndex
column.description: An index that uniquely identifies an entry in the action table.

column.name: diffServActionList
column.description: The bitmap value used to identify which action capabilities are enabled on the entry. The actionPktNewPri and actionPktNewDscp can not be enabled at the same time on the entry. The actionRedPktNewDscp and actionRedDrop can not be enabled at the same time on the entry.

column.name: diffServActionPktNewPri
column.description: Specifies the new priority value for the packet when the action is satisfied. If the actionPktNewPri bit of the diffServActionList is not enabled, this object can not be set.

column.name: diffServActionPktNewPhb
column.description: Specifies the inner priority value for the packet when the action is satisfied. If the actionPktNewPhb bit of the diffServActionList is not enabled, this object can not be set.

column.name: diffServActionGreenPktTransmit
column.description: The actionGreenPktTransmit bit of the diffServActionList is for configuring this object. If the value of this object is enabled, the green marking packet will be Transmitted.

column.name: diffServActionGreenPktNewDscp
column.description: Specifies the new DSCP value for the packet when the action is satisfied. The value of this object is ignored whenever the value of diffServActionGreenPktNewDscp object is 64. If the actionGreenPktNewDscp bit of the diffServActionList is not enabled, this object can not be set.

column.name: diffServActionYellowPktNewDscp
column.description: Specifies the new DSCP value for the packet when the action is satisfied. The value of this object is ignored whenever the value of diffServActionYellowPktNewDscp object is 64. If the actionYellowPktNewDscp bit of the diffServActionList is not enabled, this object can not be set.

column.name: diffServActionYellowPktDrop
column.description: The actionYellowPktDrop bit of the diffServActionList is for configuring this object. If the value of this object is enabled, the red marking packet will be dropped.

column.name: diffServActionRedPktNewDscp
column.description: Specifies the new DSCP value for the red marking packet when the action is satisfied. The value of this object is ignored whenever the value of diffServActionRedPktNewDscp object is 64. If the actionRedPktNewDscp bit of the diffServActionList is not enabled, this object can not be set.

column.name: diffServActionRedPktDrop
column.description: The actionRedPktDrop bit of the diffServActionList is for configuring this object. If the value of this object is enabled, the red marking packet will be dropped.

column.name: diffServActionStatus
diffServActionPktNewIpPrec
column.description: Specifies the new precedence value for the packet when the action is satisfied. If the actionPktNewIpPrec bit of the diffServActionList is not enabled, this object can not be set.

column.name: diffServActionPktNewDscp
column.description: Specifies the new DSCP value for the packet when the action is satisfied. If the actionPktNewDscp bit of the diffServActionList is not enabled, this object can not be set.

table.name: diffServMeterTable
table.description: Table for meter.

row.name: diffServMeterEntry
row.description: Entry for meter.

column.name: diffServMeterIndex
column.description: An entry that describes a single set of token bucket parameters.

column.name: diffServMeterModel
column.description: The Metering algorithm associated with the Token Bucket parameters. The zeroDotZero indicates this is unknown.

column.name: diffServMeterRate
column.description: The token-bucket rate, in kilobits per second (kbps).

column.name: diffServMeterBurstSize
column.description: The maximum number of bytes in a single transmission burst.

column.name: diffServMeterStatus
diffServMeterPeakRate
column.description: The token-bucket rate, in kilobits per second (kbps).

column.name: diffServMeterPeakBurstSize
column.description: The maximum number of bytes in a double transmission burst.

scalar.name: privateVlanStatus
scalar.description: This controls whether private VLAN is enabled.

table.name: privateVlanVlanTable
table.description: A table containing private VLAN information on the VLANs which currently exist.

row.name: privateVlanVlanEntry
row.description: A conceptual row containing the private VLAN information on the VLANs for a particular management domain.

column.name: privateVlanVlanIndex
column.description: The VLAN ID of this private VLAN.

column.name: privateVlanVlanType
column.description: The VLAN type as defined for Private VLAN feature. Set the value to invalid(1) to destroy an entry. Set other values to create an entry. If an index already exists, set others to modifiy it. Note that a VLAN's private VLAN type cannot be changed once it has any port members.

column.name: privateVlanAssoicatedPrimaryVlan
column.description:
The VLAN ID of the associated primary VLAN used for the private VLAN feature if privateVlanVlanType has the value of isolated(3), community(4). If privateVlanVlanType has the value of primary(2), then this object has the value of 0.
Note that one isolated VLAN can only be associated with one unique primary VLAN. One primary VLAN can only be associated with one isolated VLAN.
One primary VLAN can be associated with multiple community VLANs; one community VLAN can only be associated with one unique primary VLAN.

table.name: privateVlanPrivatePortTable
table.description: A table containing information on the configuration of secondary VLANs on the device ports.

row.name: privateVlanPrivatePortEntry
row.description: A conceptual row containing information of the configuration of secondary VLANs for each port. An entry is created by the managed system for each interface which can be configured as a private port for Private VLAN feature.

column.name: privateVlanPrivatePortIfIndex
column.description: This is defined as the ifIndex.

column.name: privateVlanPrivatePortSecondaryVlan
column.description:
The VLAN ID of the secondary VLAN configured on this private port. A private port is a port that allows ingress traffic of the secondary VLAN as well as egress traffic of its associated primary VLAN, but blocks the egress traffic of the isolated VLAN while allowing the egress traffic of the community or twoWayCommunity VLAN depending on the type of the secondary VLAN.
Note that a port can join a secondary VLAN only after this secondary VLAN has been associated with a primary VLAN, i.e., the cpvlanVlanAssociatedPrimaryVlan has a non-zero value. The default value of 0 for this object means this port has not yet joined a secondary VLAN.

table.name: privateVlanPromPortTable
table.description: A table containing secondary VLAN to primary VLAN remapping information on ports of the device.

row.name: privateVlanPromPortEntry
row.description: A conceptual row containing secondary VLAN to primary VLAN remapping information for each port. An entry is created by the managed system for each interface which can be configured as a promiscuous port for the private VLAN feature.

column.name: privateVlanPromPortIfIndex
column.description: This is defined as ifIndex.

column.name: privateVlanPromPortPrimaryVlanId
column.description: The primary VLAN ID of the promiscous port.

column.name: privateVlanPromPortSecondaryRemap
column.description:
A string of octets containing one bit per VLAN in the management domain on this port. The first octet corresponds to VLANs with VlanIndexOrZero values of 0 through 7; the second octet to VLANs 8 through 15; etc. The most significant bit of each octet corresponds to the lowest value VlanIndexOrZero in that octet.
Note that if the length of this string is less than 128 octets, any 'missing' octets are assumed to contain the value zero. An NMS may omit any zero-valued octets from the end of this string in order to reduce SetPDU size, and the agent may also omit zero-valued trailing octets, to reduce the size of GetResponse PDUs.

column.name: privateVlanPromPortSecondaryRemap2k
column.description:
A string of octets containing one bit per VLAN for VLANs with VlanIndexOrZero values of 1024 through 2047 in the management domain on this port. The first octet corresponds to VLANs with VlanIndexOrZero values of 1024 through 1031; the second octet to VLANs 1032 through 1039; etc. The most significant bit of each octet corresponds to the lowest value VlanIndexOrZero in that octet.
Note that if the length of this string is less than 128 octets, any 'missing' octets are assumed to contain the value zero. An NMS may omit any zero-valued octets from the end of this string in order to reduce SetPDU size, and the agent may also omit zero-valued trailing octets, to reduce the size of GetResponse PDUs.
This object is only instantiated on devices which support the range of VlanIndexOrZero up to 4095.

column.name: privateVlanPromPortSecondaryRemap3k
column.description:
A string of octets containing one bit per VLAN for VLANs with VlanIndexOrZero values of 2048 through 3071 in the management domain on this port. The first octet corresponds to VLANs with VlanIndexOrZero values of 2048 through 2055; the second octet to VLANs 2056 through 2063; etc. The most significant bit of each octet corresponds to the lowest value VlanIndexOrZero in that octet.
Note that if the length of this string is less than 128 octets, any 'missing' octets are assumed to contain the value zero. An NMS may omit any zero-valued octets from the end of this string in order to reduce SetPDU size, and the agent may also omit zero-valued trailing octets, to reduce the size of GetResponse PDUs.
This object is only instantiated on devices which support the range of VlanIndexOrZero up to 4095.

column.name: privateVlanPromPortSecondaryRemap4k
column.description:
A string of octets containing one bit per VLAN for VLANs with VlanIndexOrZero values of 3072 through 4095 in the management domain on this port. The first octet corresponds to VLANs with VlanIndexOrZero values of 3072 through 3079; the second octet to VLANs 3080 through 3087; etc. The most significant bit of each octet corresponds to the lowest value VlanIndexOrZero in that octet.
Note that if the length of this string is less than 128 octets, any 'missing' octets are assumed to contain the value zero. An NMS may omit any zero-valued octets from the end of this string in order to reduce SetPDU size, and the agent may also omit zero-valued trailing octets, to reduce the size of GetResponse PDUs.
This object is only instantiated on devices which support the range of VlanIndexOrZero up to 4095.

table.name: privateVlanSessionTable
table.description: Contains the settings for private VLAN Session.

row.name: privateVlanSessionEntry
row.description: A conceptual row in the privateVlanSession table.

column.name: privateVlanSessionId
column.description: The session ID that may specifiy certain entry in the table which contains private VLAN session information.

column.name: privateVlanSessionUplinkPorts
column.description: This is the list of uplink ports for a session of private VLAN. They should not overlap with the privateVlanSessionPortDownlink of the same session, and they also should not overlap with the privateVlanSessionPortUplink and the privateVlanSessionPortDownlink of other session.

column.name: privateVlanSessionDownlinkPorts
column.description: This is the list of downlink ports for a session of private VLAN. They should not overlap with the privateVlanSessionPortUplink of the same session, and they also should not overlap with the privateVlanSessionPortUplink and the privateVlanSessionPortDownlink of other session.

column.name: privateVlanSessionStatus
column.description: Set this to valid(1) to create an entry. Sets this to invalid(2) to destroy an entry.

scalar.name: privateVlanUplinkToUplink
scalar.description: Sets this to blocking(2) to deny the traffic of uplink ports between different sessions. Set this to forwarding(1) to allow the traffic of uplink ports between different sessions.

table.name: portSecPortTable
table.description: The port security(MAC binding) Table.

row.name: portSecPortEntry
row.description: The entry of portSecPortTable.

column.name: portSecPortStatus
column.description: Set enabled(1) to enable port security and set disabled(2) to disable port security.

column.name: portSecPortIndex
column.description: The port and the trunk (excluding trunk members) interface of the portTable. The interface identified by a particular value of this index is the same interface as identified by the same value of ifIndex in the IF-MIB.

column.name: portSecAction
column.description: The corresponding actions that will take place when a port is under intrusion, when this variable is set to none(1), no action will be performed, when this variable is set to trap(2), a swPortSecurityTrap trap will be sent, when this variable is set to shutdown(3), the port will shutdown, when this variable is set to trapAndShutdown(4), a swPortSecurityTrap will be sent and the port will shutdown.

column.name: portSecMaxMacCount
column.description: Configures max-mac-count on a port to limit the maximum allowed MAC address on Port Security enabled port. Change this number on a Port Security enabled port and this number is smaller than current lenared number of secure MAC address, all learned secure MAC address will be deleted.

scalar.name: radiusServerGlobalAuthPort

scalar.name: radiusServerGlobalAcctPort

scalar.name: radiusServerGlobalKey
scalar.description: Key for RADIUS. This variable can only be written. When this variable is read, it always returns a zero-length string. When specified radius server do not set key, this this value is used.

scalar.name: radiusServerGlobalRetransmit
scalar.description: Maximum number of retransmissions for RADIUS. When specified radius server do not set maximum number of retransmissions, this value is used.

scalar.name: radiusServerGlobalTimeout
scalar.description: Timeout for RADIUS. When specified radius server do not set timeout, this value is used.

When this variable is read, it always returns a zero-length string.When specified TACACS+ server do not set the encryption key , this this value is used.

column.description: TCP port number of a TACACS+ server.

column.name: tacacsPlusServerKey
column.description: The encryption key used to encrpt the traffic between client and TACACS+ server. Do not use blank spaces in the string. This variable can only be set. When this variable is read, it always returns a zero-length string.

column.name: tacacsPlusServerStatus
column.description: Setting this to valid(1) creates an entry. Setting this to invalid(2) destroys an entry.

scalar.name: sshServerStatus
scalar.description: The status of Secure Shell Server. Set this value to enabled(1) to enable SSH server, set this value to disabled(2) to disable the SSH server.

scalar.name: sshServerMajorVersion

scalar.name: sshServerMinorVersion

scalar.name: sshTimeout
scalar.description: The time interval that the router waits for the SSH client to respond. The range is 1-120.

scalar.name: sshAuthRetries

scalar.name: sshHostKeyGenAction
scalar.description:
This variable is for host key generating.
For the set behavior: Set it to genRsaKey(2) to generate the RSA host key, and to genDsaKey(3) to generate the DSA host key, if genBothKeys(4) is set, both RSA and DSA host key are generated.
For the get behavior: You will get genRsaKey(2), genDsaKey(3) or genBothKeys(4) when the key gen action is in progress. otherwise, you will get noGen(1).

scalar.name: sshHostKeyGenStatus
scalar.description: The result of the last KeyGen status. if no key gen action has been performed. you will get unknown(1) status.

scalar.name: sshHostKeySaveAction
scalar.description:
To save host key from memory to flash.
For the set behavior: Set it to save(2) to perform the save operation.
For the get behavior: You will get save(1) when the save action is in progress. Otherwise, you will get noSave(1).

scalar.name: sshHostKeySaveStatus
scalar.description: The result of the last savekey status. If no save action has been performed, you will get unknown(1) status.

scalar.name: sshHostKeyDelAction
scalar.description:
To delete the host key.
For the set behavior: Set it to delRsaKey(2) to delete the RSA host key, to delDsaKey(3) to delete the DSA host key, or to delBothKeys(4) to delete both RSA and DSA host key.
For the get behavior: You will get delRsaKey(2), delDsaKey(3) or delBothKeys(4) when the delete operation is in progress. Otherwise, you will get noDel(1).

table.name: aclIpAceTable
table.description: The conceptual table of all of aclIpAceEntry.

row.name: aclIpAceEntry
row.description: The conceptual row for aclIpAceTable.

column.name: aclIpAceType
column.description: The specified IP ACE type. When the type of this entry is modified, then this entry will be auto-unbound from the aclEntry and the not supporting field of this entry will be set 0.

column.name: aclIpAceAccess
column.description: Indicates the action to be taken if a packet matches this ACE. This object cannot not be configured when the status of the entry, aclIpAceStatus, is active(1).

column.name: aclIpAceSourceIpAddr
column.description: The specified source IP address. The packet's source address is AND-ed with the value of aclIpAceSourceIpAddrBitmask and then compared against the value of this object. This object cannot be configured when the status of the entry, aclIpAceStatus, is active(1).

column.name: aclIpAceSourceIpAddrBitmask
column.description: The specified source IP address mask. The packet's source address is AND-ed with the value of IpAceSourceIpAddr and then compared against the value of this object.

column.name: aclIpAceDestIpAddr
column.description: The specified destination IP address. The packet's destination address is AND-ed with the value of aclIpAceDestIpAddrBitmask and then compared against the value of this object. This object may not be modified if the associated aclIpAceType object is equal to standard(1).

column.name: aclIpAceDestIpAddrBitmask
column.description: The specified destination IP address mask. This object may not be modified if the associated aclIpAceType object is equal to standard(1).

column.name: aclIpAceProtocol
column.description: The protocol number field in the IP header used to indicate the higher layer protocol as specified in RFC 1700. A value of 0 matches every IP packet. The object=256 means 'any'. For example: 0 is IP, 1 is ICMP, 2 is IGMP, 4 is IP in IP encapsulation, 6 is TCP, 9 is IGRP, 17 is UDP, 47 is GRE, 50 is ESP, 51 is AH, 88 is IGRP, 89 is OSPF, 94 is KA9Q/NOS compatible IP over IP, 103 is PIMv2, 108 is PCP. This object may not be modified if the associated daclIpAceType object is equal to standard(1).

column.name: aclIpAcePrec
column.description: Specifies the IP precedence value to match against. The value of this object is ignored whenever the value of aclIpAcePrec object is 8. This object may not be modified if the associated aclIpAceType object is equal to standard(1).

column.name: aclIpAceTos
column.description: Specifies the IP ToS facility value to match against. The value of this object is ignored whenever the value of aclIpAcePrec object is 9. This object may not be modified if the associated aclIpAceType object is equal to standard(1).

column.name: aclIpAceDscp
column.description: Specifies the DSCP value to match against. The value of this object is ignored whenever the value of aclIpAcePrec object is 64. This object may not be modified if the associated aclIpAceType object is equal to standard(1).

column.name: aclIpAceSourcePortOp
column.description: Indicates how a packet's source TCP/UDP port number is to be compared. noOperator(1), which is the default value, means no comparison is to be made with the source TCP/UDP port number. equal(2), which is used the aclIpAceSourcePortBitmask and the aclIpAceMinSourcePort to match against. range(3),which is used the aclIpAceMinSourcePort and the aclIpAceMaxSourcePort to match against. This object may not be modified if the associated aclIpAceType object is equal to standard(1).

column.name: aclIpAceMinSourcePort
column.description: If the aclIpAceSourcePortOp is range(3), this indicates the lower bound of the TCP/UDP port number value range. This object may not be modified if the associated aclIpAceType object is equal to standard(1).

column.name: aclIpAceMaxSourcePort
column.description: If the aclIpAceSourcePortOp is range(3), this indicates the upper bound of the TCP/UDP port number value range.

column.name: aclIpAceSourcePortBitmask
column.description: If the aclIpAceSourcePortOp is equal(2), this indicates the bitmask of the aclIpAceMinSourcePort. This object may not be modified if the associated aclIpAceType object is equal to standard(1).

column.name: aclIpAceDestPortOp
column.description: Indicates how a packet's destination TCP/UDP port number is to be compared. noOperator(1), which is the default value, means that no comparison is to be made with the destination TCP/UDP port number. equal(2), which is used the aclIpAceSourcePortBitmask and the aclIpAceMinDestPort to match against. range(3),which is used the aclIpAceMinDestPort and the aclIpAceMaxDestPort to match against. This object may not be modified if the associated aclIpAceType object is equal to standard(1).

column.name: aclIpAceMinDestPort
column.description: If the aclIpAceDestPortOp is range(3), this indicates the lower bound of the TCP/UDP port number value range. This object may not be modified if the associated aclIpAceType object is equal to standard(1).

column.name: aclIpAceMaxDestPort
column.description: If the aclIpAceDestPortOp is range(3), this indicates the upper bound of the TCP/UDP port number value range.

column.name: aclIpAceDestPortBitmask
column.description: If the aclIpAceDestPortOp is equal(2), this indicates the bitmask of the aclIpAceMinDestPort. This object may not be modified if the associated aclIpAceType object is equal to standard(1).

column.name: aclIpAceControlCode
column.description: Indicates how the control flags of TCP packets are to be compared. aclIpAceControlCode is AND-ed with aclIpAceControlCodeBitmask. This object may not be modified if the associated aclIpAceType object is equal to standard(1).

column.name: aclIpAceControlCodeBitmask
column.description: Indicates how the control flags of TCP packets are to be compared. It can be used to check multiple flags of the FIN, SYN, RST, PSH, ACK, URG by the sum of FIN=1, SYN=2, RST=4, PSH=8, ACK=16, URG=32. This object may not be modified if the associated aclIpAceType object is equal to standard(1).

column.name: aclIpAceStatus

table.name: aclMacAceTable
table.description: The conceptual table of all of aclMacAceEntry.

row.name: aclMacAceEntry
row.description: The conceptual row for aclMacAceTable.

column.name: aclMacAceAccess
column.description: Indicates the action to be taken if a packet matches this ACE. This object cannot be configured when the status of the entry, aclMacAceStatus, is active(1).

column.name: aclMacAcePktformat
column.description: Used to check the packet format of the packets. This object cannot be configured when the status of the entry, aclMacAceStatus, is active(1).

column.name: aclMacAceSourceMacAddr
column.description: Indicates the 48-bit destination MAC address. The specified source MAC of the packet The packet's source MAC address is AND-ed with the value of aceMacSourceMacAddrBitmask and then compared against the value of this object. This object cannot be configured when the status of the entry, aclMacAceStatus, is active(1).

column.name: aclMacAceSourceMacAddrBitmask
column.description: The specified source MAC address mask. This object cannot be configured when the status of the entry, aclMacAceStatus, is active(1).

column.name: aclMacAceDestMacAddr
column.description: Indicates the 48-bit destination MAC address. The specified destination MAC of the packet. The packet's destination MAC address is AND-ed with the value of aceMacDestMacAddrBitmask and then compared against the value of this object. This object cannot be configured when the status of the entry, aclMacAceStatus, is active(1).

column.name: aclMacAceDestMacAddrBitmask
column.description: The specified destination MAC address mask. This object cannot be configured when the status of the entry, aclMacAceStatus, is active(1).

column.name: aclMacAceVidOp
column.description: Indicates how a packet's vid is to be compared. This object cannot be configured when the status of the entry, aclMacAceStatus, is active(1).

column.name: aclMacAceMinVid
column.description: Indicates the lower bound of the vid value range if the aclMacAceVidOp is range(3). This object cannot be configured when the status of the entry, aclMacAceStatus, is active(1).

column.name: aclMacAceVidBitmask
column.description: The bitmask of vid if the aclMacAceVidOp is equal, default value is 0xfff.

column.name: aclMacAceMaxVid
column.description: Indicates the upper bound of the vid value range if the aclMacAceVidOp is range(3). This object cannot be configured when the status of the entry, aclMacAceStatus, is active(1).

column.name: aclMacAceEtherTypeOp
column.description: Indicates how a packet's ethertype is to be compared. This object cannot be configured when the status of the entry, aclMacAceStatus, is active(1).

column.name: aclMacAceEtherTypeBitmask
column.description: The bitmask of ether type if the aclMacAceVidOp is equal(2), default value is 0xFFFF.

column.name: aclMacAceMinEtherType
column.description: Indicates the lower bound of the ether type value range if the aclMacAceEtherTypeOp is range(3). This object cannot be configured when the status of the entry, aclMacAceStatus, is active(1).

column.name: aclMacAceMaxEtherType
column.description: Indicates the upper bound of the ether type value range if the aclMacAceEtherTypeOp is range(3). This object cannot be configured when the status of the entry, aclMacAceStatus, is active(1).

column.name: aclMacAceStatus

table.name: aclAclGroupTable
table.description: The conceptual table of aclAclGroupEntry.

row.name: aclAclGroupEntry
row.description: The conceptual row for aclAclGroupTable.

column.name: aclAclGroupIngressIpAcl
column.description: Specifies the ingress IP ACL(standard or extended) binding to the interface.

column.name: aclAclGroupEgressIpAcl
column.description: Specifies the egress IP ACL(standard or extended) binding to the interface.

column.name: aclAclGroupIngressMacAcl
column.description: Specifies the ingress MAC ACL binding to the interface.

column.name: aclAclGroupEgressMacAcl
column.description: Specifies the egress MAC ACL binding to the interface.

table.name: aclIpv6AceTable
table.description: Table for IPv6 ACE.

row.name: aclIpv6AceEntry
row.description: Entry fo IPv6 ACE.

column.name: aclIpv6AceType
column.description: The specified IP v6 ACE type. When the type of this entry is modified, then this entry will be auto-unbound from the aclEntry and the not supporting field of this entry will be set 0.

column.name: aclIpv6AceAccess
column.description: Indicates the action to be taken if a packet matches this ACE.

column.name: aclIpv6AceSourceIpAddr
column.description: Specifies the source IPv6 address.

column.name: aclIpv6AceSourceIpAddrPrefixLen
column.description: The length (in bits) associated with the source IPv6 address prefix of this entry.

column.name: aclIpv6AceDestIpAddr
column.description: Specifies the destination IPv6 address. This object may not be modified if the associated aclIpv6AceType object is equal to standard(1).

column.name: aclIpv6AceDestIpAddrPrefixLen
column.description: The length (in bits) associated with the destination IPv6 address prefix of this entry. This object may not be modified if the associated aclIpv6AceType object is equal to standard(1).

column.name: aclIpv6AceDscp
column.description: Specifies the DSCP value to match against. This object may not be modified if the associated aclIpv6AceType object is equal to standard(1).

column.name: aclIpv6AceStatus

scalar.name: aclAttachCtlIndex
scalar.description: Index for attachment control. Specifies the ACL as the target to relate with the IP ACE, the MAC ACE or IPv6 ACE. The ACL identified by a particular value of this index is associated with the same aclEntry as identified by the same value of aclIndex.

scalar.name: aclAttachCtlAceType
scalar.description: Type for attachment control. Specifies the type of aclAttachCtlAceIndex to relate with the aclAttachCtlIndex. When the type is macAce(1), the index of aclAceIndexList is the aclMacAceEntry. When the type is ipAce(2), the index of aclAceIndexList is the aclIpAceEntry. When the type is ipv6Ace(3), the index of aclAceIndexList is the aclIpv6AceEntry.

scalar.name: aclAttachCtlAceIndex
scalar.description: Index for attachment control. Specifies the ACE to relate with the aclAttachCtlIndex. When aclAttachCtlAceType is macAce(1), the value of aclAttachCtlIndex is the diffServMacAceEntry. When aclAttachCtlAceType is ipAce(2), the value of aclAttachCtlIndex is the diffServIpAceEntry. When aclAttachCtlAceType is ipv6Ace(3), the value of aclAttachCtlIndex is the diffServIpv6AceEntry.

scalar.name: aclAttachCtlAction
scalar.description: Action for attachment control. When setting this object to attach(2) to begin the attaching operation, a particular ACE is attached to a particular ACL. When setting this object to detach(3) to begin the not attached operation, then a particular ACE is not attached to a particular ACL. When the action is finshed whether successfully or not, or no action is taken, the value of this object always is noAction(1), The value of a particular ACL is specified in the aclAttachCtlAceType and aclAttachCtlAceIndex.

table.name: aclTable
table.description: Table for ACL.

row.name: aclEntry
row.description: Entry for ACL.

column.name: aclName
column.description: The name of this entry.

column.name: aclType
column.description: The type of this entry. When the value of ACL type is modified, then the ACEs in the aclAceIndexList of this entry will be auto-removed, and this entry will be aoto- unbound from the PortTable and the diffServClassMapTable.

column.name: aclAceIndexList
column.description: The octet string containes the ACE indexes. Two octets express one index and it is represented in network order. This index list indicates the particular ACEs which belong to this table. The ACE uses type to indicate the aclIpAceEntry, the aclMacAceEntry or the aclIpv6AceEntry. The type is specified in aclType. When the type is macAce(1), the index of aclAceIndexList is the aclMacAceEntry. When the type is ipAce(2), the index of aclAceIndexList is the aclIpAceEntry. When the type is ipv6Ace(3), the index of aclAceIndexListis the aclIpv6AceEntry.

column.name: aclStatus

table.name: ipFilterSnmpInetTable
table.description: A list of IP address entries.

row.name: ipFilterSnmpInetEntry
row.description: This entry includes an IP address range which the system will allow to connect to this device through SNMP.

column.name: ipFilterSnmpInetAddressEnd
column.description: The end IP address.

column.name: ipFilterSnmpInetStatus
column.description: Setting this to valid(1) creates an entry. Setting this to invalid(2) destroys an entry.

table.name: ipFilterHttpInetTable
table.description: A list of IP address entries.

row.name: ipFilterHttpInetEntry
row.description: This entry includes an IP address range which the system will allow to connect to this device through SNMP.

column.name: ipFilterHttpInetAddressEnd
column.description: The end IP address.

column.name: ipFilterHttpInetStatus
column.description: Setting this to valid(1) creates an entry. Setting this to invalid(2) destroys an entry.

table.name: ipFilterTelnetInetTable
table.description: A list of IP address entries.

row.name: ipFilterTelnetInetEntry
row.description: This entry includes an IP address range which the system will allow them to connect to this device through SNMP.

column.name: ipFilterTelnetInetAddressEnd
column.description: The end IP address.

column.name: ipFilterTelnetInetStatus
column.description: Setting this to valid(1) creates an entry. Setting this to invalid(2) destroys an entry.

scalar.name: ipFilterAllClientCtlInetAddressType
scalar.description: The type of IP address filter. Only supports IPv4 and IPv6 address types.

scalar.name: ipFilterAllClientCtlInetAddressStart
scalar.description: The start IP address.

scalar.name: ipFilterAllClientCtlInetAddressEnd
scalar.description: The end IP address.
