scalar.name: ipFilterAllClientCtlAction
scalar.description: Action for IP filter control. Set this object to create(2) to create entries in the ipFilterSnmpInetTable, ipFilterHttpInetTable and ipFilterTelnetInetTable. Set this object to destroy(3) to destroy specified entries in the ipFilterSnmpInetTable, ipFilterHttpInetTable and ipFilterTelnetInetTable. When the action is finshed, whether successfully or not, or no action is taken, the value of this object is always noAction(1).

scalar.name: userAuthEnablePassword
scalar.description: Set enable password or delete enable password. NULL is used to delete the enable password. The password is starting with alphanumeric.

scalar.name: userAuthMethod
scalar.description: Set user authencation method for system.

table.name: userAuthTable
table.description: This table is for creating the new user.

row.name: userAuthEntry
row.description: Entries in this table correspond to the users entries in system.

column.name: userAuthPassword
column.description: Specifies the user password. zero length input will set the user enrty without password. If the user is not exist, it will create the user with the giving password and privilege 0. The password is starting with alphanumeric.

column.name: userAuthPrivilege
column.description: Specifies the user level. If the user is not exist, it will create the user with the giving privilege with none password. Privilege 15 is maximum privilege that only can be applied to system administrator.

column.name: userAuthPublicKey
column.description: User public key, the value can be 'RSA' or 'DSA' or 'Both' or 'None'.

column.name: userAuthStatus
column.description: This node is used to create the user entry by '1' and to delete one user entry by '0'.

table.name: dot1xAuthConfigExtTable
table.description: The extension table of dot1xAuthConfigTable.

row.name: dot1xAuthConfigExtEntry
row.description: The entry of dot1xAuthConfigExtTable.

column.name: dot1xAuthConfigExtOperMode
column.description: The operation mode of dot1x port which allows host connection to 802.1x-authorized ports.

column.name: dot1xAuthConfigExtMultiHostMaxCnt
column.description: The maximum number of hosts when the dot1xAuthConfigExtOperMode is multiHost(2). When the operation Mode is singleHost(1), we can ignore this variables.

column.name: dot1xAuthConfigExtPortIntrusionAction

scalar.name: dot1xEapolPassThrough
scalar.description: When this variable is enabled(1), EAPOL frames will be forwarded to all ports where the Spanning Tree status is forwarding. When this variable is disabled(2), EAPOL frames will be discarded. EAPOL Pass-Through operates when the global status of 802.1X is disabled.

table.name: aaaMethodTable
table.description: Contains the settings needed for accounting.

row.name: aaaMethodEntry
row.description: A conceptual row in the aaaMethodTable.

column.name: aaaMethodIndex
column.description: Specifies the index for the entry.

column.name: aaaMethodName
column.description: Name for the method.

column.name: aaaMethodGroupName
column.description: Name for the server to use, pointing to aaaRadiusGroupName or aaaTacacsPlusGroupName.

column.name: aaaMethodMode
column.description: start-stop(1),sends a 'start' accounting notice at the beginning of a process and a 'stop' accounting notice at the end of a process. The 'start' accounting record is sent in the background. The requested user process begins regardless of whether or not the 'start' accounting notice was received by the accounting server.

column.name: aaaMethodStatus
column.description: Set to 1 to initiate the aaaMethodTable, 2 to destroy the table.

column.name: aaaMethodClientType
aaaMethodPrivilegeLevel
column.description: Specifies the privilege level for the entry. When aaaMethodClientType is in the mode of command(3), the privilege level is enabled to be accessed.

table.name: aaaRadiusGroupTable
table.description: Uses a subset of RADIUS servers for accounting as defined by the server group

row.name: aaaRadiusGroupEntry
row.description: A conceptual row of aaaRadiusGroupEntry.

column.name: aaaRadiusGroupIndex
column.description: Specifies the index for the entry.

column.name: aaaRadiusGroupServerBitMap
column.description: Identifies which RADIUS sever to use, each bit points to each radius server. 80 (1000 0000) point to radius server 1, C0 (11000000) points to radius 1 and radius 2.

column.name: aaaRadiusGroupName
column.description: Uses a subset of servers for accounting as defined by the server group. The same name as aaaTacasPlusGroupName is not allowed.

column.name: aaaRadiusGroupStatus
column.description: Set to 1 to initiate the aaaRadiusGroupTable, 2 to destroy the table.

table.name: aaaTacacsPlusGroupTable
table.description: Uses a subset of TACACS+ servers for accounting as defined by the server group

row.name: aaaTacacsPlusGroupEntry
row.description: A conceptual row of aaaTacacsPlusGroupEntry.

column.name: aaaTacacsPlusGroupIndex
column.description: Specifies the index for the entry.

column.name: aaaTacacsPlusGroupServerBitMap
column.description: Identifies which TACACS+ sever to use.

column.name: aaaTacacsPlusGroupName
column.description: Uses a subset of servers for accounting as defined by the server group. We can't have the same name as aaaRadiusGroupName

column.name: aaaTacacsPlusGroupStatus
column.description: Set to 1 to initiate the aaaRadiusGroupTable, 2 to destroy the table.

scalar.name: aaaUpdate
scalar.description: Specifies the periodic interim accounting records to be sent to the accounting server and periodic intervals to send accounting update records(in minutes).

table.name: aaaAccountTable
table.description: Specifies an interface or a set of interfaces that the accounting method list will be applied to.

row.name: aaaAccountEntry
row.description: A conceptual row of aaaAccountTable.

column.name: aaaAccountIfIndex
column.description: Defined as the ifIndex

column.name: aaaAccountMethodName
column.description: Specifies the name of the list of accounting methods to use. If no method name is specified, the system uses the default.

column.name: aaaAccountProtocol
column.description: Get the protocol type of a list method to know which server (RADIUS or TACACS+) is in use.

column.name: aaaAccountStatus
column.description: Set to 1 to initiate the aaaRadiusGroupTable, 2 to destroy the table.

table.name: aaaAccExecTable
table.description: Specifies an interface or a set of interfaces that the accounting method list will be applied to.

row.name: aaaAccExecEntry
row.description: A conceptual row of aaaAccExecTable.

column.name: aaaAccExecIndex
column.description: The method of accessing CLI management.

column.name: aaaAccExecMethodName
column.description: Specifies the name of the list of accounting methods to use. If no method name is specified, the system uses the default.

table.name: networkAccessPortTable
table.description: A table contains the information of network access about every port.

row.name: networkAccessPortEntry
row.description: A conceptual row in the networkAccessPort table.

column.name: networkAccessPortPortIndex
column.description: The port and the trunk (excluding trunk members) interface of the portTable. The interface identified by a particular value of this port index is the same interface identified by the same value of ifIndex in the IF-MIB.

column.name: networkAccessPortDynamicVlan
column.description: Sets enabled(1) to enable dynamic VLAN assigment and sets disabled(2) to disable dynamic VLAN assigment.

column.name: networkAccessPortMaxMacCount
column.description: Specifies the maximum number of authenticated MAC address.

column.name: networkAccessPortMode
column.description: Specifies the secure port mode. enabled(1) means that Mac address authentication is used and disabled(2) means that the authentication is disabled.

column.name: networkAccessPortMacFilter
column.description: Specifies the MAC filter ID, Set this variable to zero to disable MAC filter.

column.name: networkAccessPortGuestVlan
column.description: Specifies the guest VLAN ID. To disable the VLAN, set the value to 0.

column.name: networkAccessPortLinkDetectionStatus
column.description: Set this object to enabled(1) to enable link detection. Set this object to disabled(2) to disable link detection.

column.name: networkAccessPortLinkDetectionMode
column.description: Specifies the detection event for a port. Set this object to linkUp(1) to detect a link-up event. Set this object to linkDown(2) to detect a link-down event. Set this object to linkUpDown(3) to detect both link up and link down events.

column.name: networkAccessPortLinkDetectionAciton
column.description: Specifies the action to take when a networkAccessPortLinkDetection event is triggered. Set this object to trap(1) to send a trap when a networkAccessPortLinkDetection event is triggered. Set this object to shutDown(2) to shut down the port when a networkAccessPortLinkDetection event is triggered. Set this object to trapAndShutDown(3) to send a trap and shut down the port when a networkAccessPortLinkDetection event is triggered.

column.name: networkAccessPortDynamicQos
column.description: Set this object to enabled(1) to enable Dynamic QoS. Set this object to disabled(2) to disable Dynamic QoS.

scalar.name: networkAccessClearMacAddressAttribute
scalar.description: Attribute for clearing Mac address. Specifies the certain attribute in Mac address table. all(1) indicates both reauthorized and learnt secure MAC address; static(2) indicates reauthorized MAC address; dynamic(3) indicates learnt secure MAC address.

scalar.name: networkAccessClearMacAddressMacAddress
scalar.description: Specifies MAC address in the MAC address table for clearing MAC address. '000000' represents that no MAC address is specified.

scalar.name: networkAccessClearMacAddressPort
scalar.description: The specifies port in the MAC address table for clearing MAC address. '0' represents that no port is specified.

scalar.name: networkAccessClearMacAddressAction
scalar.description: Action for clearing MAC address . When setting this object to clear(2) to begin the clearing MAC address operation, a particular MAC address is cleared from the MAC address table. When the action is finshed whether or not it is successful or no action is taken, the value of this object is always noclear(1).

table.name: networkAccessMacAddressTable
table.description: Contains the information of network access MAC addresses.

row.name: networkAccessMacAddressEntry
row.description: A conceptual row in the networkAccessMacAddress table.

column.name: networkAccessMacAddressAddress
column.description: Specifies the authenticated MAC address.

column.name: networkAccessMacAddressPort
column.description: Specifies the port of authenticated MAC address.

column.name: networkAccessMacAddressInetAddressType
column.description: This object indicates the type of IP address denoted in networkAccessMacAddressRadiusServerInetAddress type.

column.name: networkAccessMacAddressRadiusServerInetAddress
column.description: Displays the IP address of radius server that authenticates the specified Mac address.

column.name: networkAccessMacAddressTime
column.description: Displays the authentication time of the authenticated MAC address. The following form is a text string; 'yyyy MMm DDd HHh MMm SSs'. 'yyyy' is a four-digit year. 'MM' is a month. A single-digit month is preceded by a zero. 'DD' is the day of a month. A single-digit day is preceded by the value zero. 'HH', 'MM' and 'SS' are hour, minute, and second respectively. A single-digit hour, minute, and second are preceded by a zero value. An example is: '2001y 01m 01d 00h 04m 43s'.

column.name: networkAccessMacAddressAttribute
column.description: Displays the attribute of an authenticated MAC address. static(1) indicates resauthorized secure MAC address. dynamic(2) indicates learnt secure MAC address.

scalar.name: networkAccessAging
scalar.description: Set this object to enabled(1) to enable MAC address aging feature. Set this object to disabled(2) to disable MAC address aging feature.

table.name: networkAccessMacFilterWithMaskTable
table.description: Contains the settings for MAC filter.

row.name: networkAccessMacFilterWithMaskEntry
row.description: A conceptual row in the networkAccessMacFilterWithMaskTable.

column.name: networkAccessMacFilterWithMaskID
column.description: Specifies the MAC filter ID.

column.name: networkAccessMacFilterWithMaskMacAddress
column.description: Specifies the MAC address to be filtered.

column.name: networkAccessMacFilterWithMaskMacAddressMask
column.description: Specifies the MAC mask to be filtered.

column.name: networkAccessMacFilterWithMaskStatus
column.description: Set this object to valid(1) to create an entry. Set this object to invalid(2) to destroy an entry.

scalar.name: macAuthReauthTime
scalar.description: Specifies the reauthentication time period.

table.name: macAuthPortTable
table.description: Contains the settings for mac authentication of each port.

row.name: macAuthPortEntry
row.description: A conceptual row in the macAuthPort table.

column.name: macAuthPortIndex
column.description: The port and the trunk (including trunk members) interface of the port table. The interface identified by a particular value of this index is the same interface identified by the same value of ifIndex in the IF-MIB.

column.name: macAuthPortMaxMacCount
column.description: Specifies the maximum number of authenticated MAC addresses for MAC authentication.

column.name: macAuthPortIntrusionAction

scalar.name: webAuthSystemAuthControl
scalar.description: Sets enabled(1) to enable WebAuth feature and sets disabled(2) to disable WebAuth feature.

scalar.name: webAuthSessionTimeout
scalar.description: For authenticated success users, they can use internet service during a certain period. Whenever this period expires, users need to be re-authenticated again. This period is called session time.

scalar.name: webAuthQuietPeriod
scalar.description: Specifies the re-authentication interval when the authentication fail attempts reach the webAuthLoginAttempts value. Unauthenticated user won't be authenticated during this period.

scalar.name: webAuthLoginAttempts
scalar.description: Specifies the counter that configures the authentication fail times for a client. If authentication fail times reaches the specified value, the client are not allowed to login for some period.

scalar.name: webAuthReauthenticatePort
scalar.description: Specifies the port to re-authenticate for all of its authenticated hosts.

scalar.name: webAuthReauthenticateInetAddressType
scalar.description: Specifies host type to re-authenticate.

scalar.name: webAuthReauthenticateInetAddress
scalar.description: Specificies host to re-authenticate.

scalar.name: webAuthReauthenticateAction
scalar.description: Action for WebAuth re-authenication. When setting this object to reauth(2) to begin the re-authenticated operation, a particular user is re-authenticated. When the action is finshed whether it is successfully, or no action is taken, the value of this object is always noReauth(1).

table.name: webAuthPortConfigTable
table.description: Contains the settings for web authentication of each port.

row.name: webAuthPortConfigEntry
row.description: A conceptual row in the webAuthPortConfigTable.

column.name: webAuthPortConfigPortIndex
column.description: The port number of the port that may specify certain entry in the table which contains web authentication information.

column.name: webAuthPortConfigStatus
column.description: Sets enabled(1) to enable web authentication feature for each port and sets disabled(2) to disable web authentication for each port.

column.name: webAuthPortConfigAuthenticatedHostCount
column.description: Displays the authenticated host counts for each port

table.name: webAuthPortInfoTable
table.description: Contains the information for web authentication of each port.

row.name: webAuthPortInfoEntry
row.description: A conceptual row in the webAuthPortTable.

column.name: webAuthPortInfoPortIndex
column.description: The port number for which this entry contains web authentication information.

column.name: webAuthPortInfoPortAuthSuccessIndex
column.description: The authentication success number of port for which this entry contains web authentication information.

column.name: webAuthPortInfoInetAddressType
column.description: This object indicates the type of IP address denoted in webAuthPortInfoIpAddress type.

column.name: webAuthPortInfoInetAddress
column.description: The IP address which may specify the entry containing web authentication information.

column.name: webAuthPortInfoRemainingSessiontime
column.description: The remaining session time for authenticated hosts. During this period, they may use internet resource. When the session time expires, they will need to re-authenticate again.

column.name: webAuthPortInfoStatus
column.description: Displays the web authentication status for each port. authenticated (1) means the user is authenticated.

scalar.name: dosLandStatus
scalar.description: The status of Land protection. Set this to enabled(1) to enable the feature, and set this to disabled(2) to disable the feature.

scalar.name: dosTcpScanStatus
scalar.description: The status of TCP scan protection. Set this to enabled(1) to enable the feature, and set this to disabled(2) to disable the feature.

scalar.name: arpCacheDeleteAll
scalar.description: To delete all dynamic entries in the ARP cache, write this variable to delete(1). Writing this variable to noDelete(2) has no effect on the device. When read, this variable always returns noDelete(2).

scalar.name: arpCacheTimeout
scalar.description: Timeout is provided for entries in the ARP Cache. It is for dynamic mapping only. Static mapping by creating an entry that associates a logical address with a physical address is never aged out.

scalar.name: arpStatSendRequestPackets
scalar.description: The number of ARP Request packets sent by the ARP process.

scalar.name: arpStatRcvRequestPackets
scalar.description: The number of ARP Request packets received by the ARP process.

scalar.name: arpStatSendReplyPackets
scalar.description: The number of ARP Reply packets sent by the ARP process.

scalar.name: arpStatRcvReplyPackets
scalar.description: The number of ARP Reply packets received by the ARP process.

table.name: arpProxyArpTable
table.description: A list of Proxy ARP status. This table has entries for all static VLANs.

row.name: arpProxyArpEntry
row.description: An entry in the table, containing information about Proxy ARP configuration.

column.name: arpProxyArpStatus
column.description: Enable or disable proxy ARP process on an interface.

scalar.name: ripUpdateBasicTimer
scalar.description: The update time in seconds controls the advertising of regular update messages. In the real implementation, the actual timer is this value offset by a random time (+/-50%) each time it is set.

scalar.name: ripTimeoutBasicTimer
scalar.description: The timeout timer in seconds governs the validity of a route. It is initialized when a route is established, and any time an update message is received for the route. If the setting time elapses from the last time the timeout was initialized, the route is considered to have expired, and the hop count of the route is set to infinite. It should be at least three times the value of the update timer.

scalar.name: ripGarbageCollectionBasicTimer
scalar.description: When the information about a route becomes invalid, the system does not immediately purge that route from its table. Instead, it continues to advertise the route with an infinite metric. At the same time, the garbage-collection timer is set for that route. When the count reaches zero, the route is purged from the table. This timer allows neighbors to become aware of the invalidity of a route prior to purging.

scalar.name: ripRoutingProcessStatus
scalar.description: Enable or disable RIP routing process on a system.

scalar.name: ripGlobalRouterVersion
scalar.description: To specify a RIP version used globally by the router. If interface version is configurated, router will use the interface configuration; and if version is not configurated on interface, router will use this global version; and if both interface and global are not configurated, router will use interface's default configuration.

table.name: ripInstabilityPreventingTable
table.description: A list of RIP instability preventing status.

row.name: ripInstabilityPreventingEntry
row.description: An entry in the table, containing information about RIP instability preventing configuration. The ifIndex index is a VLAN's ifIndex.

column.name: ripSplitHorizonStatus
column.description: Enable or disable RIP poison reverse on an interface.

scalar.name: ripStatisticsReset
scalar.description: Write it to reset(1), the following objects in RFC 1724 should be reset: 1. Global Counters: 'rip2GlobalRouteChanges', 'rip2GlobalQueries'. 2. Interface Status Table, for each 'rip2IfStatAddress': 'rip2IfStatRcvBadPackets', 'rip2IfStatRcvBadRoutes', 'rip2IfStatSendUpdates' 3. Peer Table, for each 'rip2PeerAddress' and 'rip2PeerDomain', 'rip2PeerRcvBadPackets', 'rip2PeerRcvBadRoutes' When read this value always is noReset(2).

table.name: ripNetworkByInetAddrTable
table.description: The RIP network address table.

row.name: ripNetworkByInetAddrEntry
row.description: A conceptual row of the ripNetworkByInetAddrTable.

column.name: ripNetworkByInetAddrStatus
column.description: Set this variable to create or destroy a RIP network address.

table.name: ripNetworkByIfindexTable
table.description: The RIp network ifindex table.

row.name: ripNetworkByIfindexEntry
row.description: A conceptual row of the ripNetworkByIfindexTable.

column.name: ripNetworkByIfindexStatus
column.description: Set this variable to create or destroy a RIP network ifindex table.

table.name: ripDistributeListTable
table.description: The RIP distribute list table. It's used to filter incoming or outgoing route updates using the access-list or prefix-list.

row.name: ripDistributeListEntry
row.description: A conceptual row of the ripDistributelistTable.

column.name: ripDistributeListIncomingRouteFilterName
column.description: Specifies access-list or prefix-list name to filter incoming routing updates.

column.name: ripDistributeListOutgoingRouteFilterName
column.description: Specifies access-list or prefix-list name to filter outgoing routing updates.

column.name: ripDistributeListStatus
column.description: Set this variable to create or destroy a distribute list.

table.name: ripRedistributeTable
table.description: The RIP Redistribute table. Config rip redistribute type, metric.

row.name: ripRedistributeEntry
row.description: A conceptual row of the ripRedistributeTable.

column.name: ripRedistributeMetric
column.description: Metric value to be used in redistributing.

column.name: ripRedistributeStatus
column.description: Set this variable to create or destroy redistribute information.

scalar.name: ripDefaultMetric
scalar.description: A metric for redistribute routes.

table.name: ripNeighborTable
table.description: The RIP neighbor table.

row.name: ripNeighborEntry
row.description: A conceptual row of the ripNeighborTable.

column.name: ripNeighborAddressStatus
column.description: Set this variable to create or destroy a RIP neighbor address.

table.name: ripPassiveInterfaceTable
table.description: A list of RIP passive interface status.

row.name: ripPassiveInterfaceEntry
row.description: An entry in the table, containing information about RIP passive interface(s) configuration. The index is a VLAN's ifIndex.

column.name: ripPassiveInterfaceStatus
column.description: Set this variable to create or destroy a RIP passive interface.

scalar.name: ripMaxPrefix
scalar.description: Max number of RIP dynamic routes.

scalar.name: ripRouteClearByType
scalar.description: Write this object value 2-6 to clear rip route by type, when read, this always return noClear(1).

table.name: ripRouteClearByNetworkTable
table.description: Clear rip route by network address.

row.name: ripRouteClearByNetworkEntry
row.description: Clear rip route by network address.

column.name: ripRouteClearByNetworkClearAction
column.description: Write this object value 2(clear) to clear rip route by spicify network address, when read, this always return noClear(1).

scalar.name: ripDefaultInformationOriginate
scalar.description: Write this object value 2(originate) to originate default information, write this object value 1(noOriginate) to not originate default information.

scalar.name: ripDefaultDistance
scalar.description: Default distance value.

table.name: ripDistanceTable
table.description: Rip distance table

row.name: ripDistanceEntry
row.description: Rip distance entry

column.name: ripDistanceValue
column.description: The RIP distance table distance value.

column.name: ripDistanceAlistName
column.description: The RIP distance table access list name. If delete the access list name ,set null string

column.name: ripDistanceRowStatus
column.description: This object indicates the status of this entry.

table.name: ospfMultiProcessSystemTable
table.description: A conceptually table for ospfMultiProcessSystemEntry.

row.name: ospfMultiProcessSystemEntry
row.description: A conceptually row for ospfMultiProcessSystemTable.

column.name: ospfMultiProcessRouterIdType
column.description: Set router ID automatically or manually.

column.name: ospfMultiProcessRfc1583CompatibleState
column.description: Enable or disable rfc1583 compatibility.

column.name: ospfMultiProcessAutoCost
column.description: Set the reference bandwidth of auto cost, the unit is Mbps.

column.name: ospfMultiProcessOriginateDefaultRoute
column.description: Enable or disable ASBR to generate a default external route into an OSPF domain if the default route already exists.

column.name: ospfMultiProcessAdvertiseDefaultRoute
column.description: If 'always', always advertises default route regardless of whether the default route exists. Note that any operation on it will not take effect unless ospfMultiProcessOriginateDefaultRoute has firstly been enabled.

column.name: ospfMultiProcessExternalMetricType
column.description: External link type associated with the default route advertised into the OSPF routing domain. Note that any operation on it will not take effect unless ospfMultiProcessOriginateDefaultRoute has firstly been enabled.

column.name: ospfMultiProcessDefaultExternalMetric
column.description: Metric used for generating the default route. Note that any operation on it will not take effect unless ospfMultiProcessOriginateDefaultRoute has firstly been enabled; '-1' is only for 'unset', that will destroy this metric value.

column.name: ospfMultiProcessSpfHoldTime
column.description: Sets the hold time between two consecutive SPF calculations.

column.name: ospfMultiProcessAreaNumber
column.description: Records the OSPF area numbers.

column.name: ospfMultiProcessAreaLimit
column.description: Max number of ospf area.

column.name: ospfMultiProcessSystemStatus
column.description: The status of this conceptual row entry. This object is used to manage the creation and deletion of conceptual rows. Currently only support 4 status: 1. active 2. notInService 4. createAndGo 6. destroy ('active' and 'notInservice' status are used for getting action, 'createAndGo' and 'destroy' status are used for setting action.) - 'active', which indicates that the current OSPF instance exists in - the system. - 'notInService', if not exist in the system. - 'createAndGo', set this status to create an OSPF instance. - 'destroy', to delete an OSPF instance.

column.name: ospfMultiProcessRouterId
column.description:
A 32-bit integer uniquely identifying the router in the Autonomous System. By convention, to ensure uniqueness, this should default to the value of one of the router's IP interface addresses.
This object is persistent and when written the entity SHOULD save the change to non-volatile storage. This is a private substitution for ospfRouterId of RFC1253.

column.name: ospfMultiProcessAdminStat
column.description:
The administrative status of OSPF in the router. The value 'enabled' denotes that the OSPF Process is active on at least one interface; 'disabled' disables it on all interfaces.
This is a private substitution for ospfAdminStat of RFC1253.

column.name: ospfMultiProcessVersionNumber
column.description: The current version number of the OSPF protocol is 2. This is a private substitution for ospfVersionNumber of RFC1253.

column.name: ospfMultiProcessAreaBdrRtrStatus
column.description: A flag to note whether this router is an Area Border Router. This is a private substitution for ospfAreaBdrRtrStatus of RFC1253.

column.name: ospfMultiProcessASBdrRtrStatus
column.description:
A flag to note whether this router is configured as an Autonomous System Border Router.
This is a private substitution for ospfAreaBdrRtrStatus of RFC1253.

column.name: ospfMultiProcessExternLsaCount
column.description:
The number of external (LS type-5) link state advertisements in the link state database.
This is a private substitution for ospfExternLsaCount of RFC1253.

column.name: ospfMultiProcessExternLsaCksumSum
column.description: The 32-bit sum of the LS checksums of the external link state advertisements contained in the link state database. This sum can be used to determine if there has been a change in a router's link state database and to compare the link state database of two routers. The value should be treated as unsigned when comparing two sums of checksums. This is a private substitution for ospfExternLsaCksumSum of RFC1253.

column.name: ospfMultiProcessOriginateNewLsas
column.description:
The number of new link state advertisements that have been originated. This number is incremented each time the router originates a new LSA.
Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur at re-initialization of the management system. This is a private substitution for ospfOriginateNewLsas of RFC1253.

column.name: ospfMultiProcessRxNewLsas
column.description:
The number of link state advertisements received that are determined to be new instantiations. This number does not include newer instantiations of self-originated link state advertisements.
Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur at re-initialization of the management system. This is a private substitution for ospfRxNewLsas of RFC1253.

column.name: ospfMultiProcessAsLsaCount
column.description: The number of AS-scope link state advertisements in the AS-scope link state database. This is a private substitution for ospfAsLsaCount of RFC4750.

column.name: ospfMultiProcessSpfDelayTime
column.description: Sets the delay between receiving a change to SPF calculation.

column.name: ospfMultiProcessDefaultMetric
column.description: The default metric for all redistributed routes. If the value is -1, then there is no default metric.

table.name: ospfMultiProcessNssaTable
table.description: A conceptually table for ospfNssaEntry.

row.name: ospfMultiProcessNssaEntry
row.description: A conceptually row for ospfNssaTable.

column.name: ospfMultiProcessNssaTranslatorRole
column.description: Specify NSSA-ABR translator-role. Candidate: Router may translate NSSA-LSA to Type-5 LSA if it is elected. Never: Router never translate NSSA-LSA. Always: Router always translate NSSA-LSA to Type-5 LSA.

column.name: ospfMultiProcessNssaRedistributeStatus
column.description: Enabled or disabled to import routes only into the normal areas, but not into the NSSA area.

column.name: ospfMultiProcessNssaOriginateDefaultInfoStatus
column.description: Enable or disable to generate a Type 7 default into the NSSA area.

column.name: ospfMultiProcessNssaMetricType
column.description: Specify NSSA external metric type.

column.name: ospfMultiProcessNssaMetric
column.description: Specify NSSA external metric value.

column.name: ospfMultiProcessNssaStatus
column.description: The status of this conceptual row entry. This object is used to manage the creation and deletion of conceptual rows. Currently only support 4 status: 1. active 2. notInService 4. createAndGo 6. destroy ('active' and 'notInservice' status are used for getting action, 'createAndGo' and 'destroy' status are used for setting action.) - 'active',which indicates that the current NSSA exists in the system. - 'notInService', if not exist in the system. - 'createAndGo', set this status to create a NSSA instance. - 'destroy', to delete a NSSA instance.

column.name: ospfMultiProcessNssaTranslatorState
column.description: Indicates if and how an NSSA border router is performing NSSA translation of type-7 LSAs into type-5 LSAs. When this object is set to enabled, the NSSA Border router's OspfAreaNssaExtTranslatorRole has been set to always. When this object is set to elected, a candidate NSSA Border router is Translating type-7 LSAs into type-5.When this object is set to disabled, a candidate NSSA border router is NOT translating type-7 LSAs into type-5.

table.name: ospfMultiProcessRedistributeTable
table.description: The conceptual table of all of ospfRedistributeEntry.

row.name: ospfMultiProcessRedistributeEntry
row.description: The conceptual row for ospfRedistributeTable.

column.name: ospfMultiProcessRedistributeMetricType
column.description: Metric type.

column.name: ospfMultiProcessRedistributeMetric
column.description: Metric value.

column.name: ospfMultiProcessRedistributeTag
column.description: The external route tag.

column.name: ospfMultiProcessRedistributeFilterListName
column.description: List name of access filter which use in other routing protocols.

column.name: ospfMultiProcessRedistributeStatus
column.description: The status of this conceptual row entry. This object is used to manage the creation and deletion of conceptual rows. Currently only support 4 status: 1. active 2. notInService 4. createAndGo 6. destroy ('active' and 'notInservice' status are used for getting action, 'createAndGo' and 'destroy' status are used for setting action.) - 'active', which indicates that the current type of redistribute - exists in the system. - 'notInService', if not exist in the system. - 'createAndGo', set this status to create a type of redistribute - instance. - 'destroy', to delete a type of redistribute instance.

column.name: ospfMultiProcessRedistributeRoutemapName
column.description: Name of the route map.

table.name: ospfMultiProcessSummaryAddressTable
table.description: The conceptual table of all of ospfSummaryAddressEntry.

row.name: ospfMultiProcessSummaryAddressEntry
row.description: The conceptual row for ospfSummaryAddressTable.

column.name: ospfMultiProcessSummaryStatus
column.description: The status of this conceptual row entry. This object is used to manage the creation and deletion of conceptual rows. Currently only support 4 status: 1. active 2. notInService 4. createAndGo 6. destroy ('active' and 'notInservice' status are used for getting action, 'createAndGo' and 'destroy' status are used for setting action.) - 'active', which indicates that the current summary address exists in - the system. - 'notInService', if not exist in the system. - 'createAndGo', set this status to create a summary address. - 'destroy', to delete a summary address.

table.name: ospfMultiProcessNetworkAreaAddressTable
table.description: The conceptual table of all of ospfNetworkAreaAddressEntry.

row.name: ospfMultiProcessNetworkAreaAddressEntry
row.description: The conceptual row for ospfNetworkAreaAddressTable.

column.name: ospfMultiProcessNetworkAreaAreaId
column.description: NetworkArea area ID.

column.name: ospfMultiProcessNetworkAreaStatus
column.description: The status of this conceptual row entry. This object is used to manage the creation and deletion of conceptual rows. Currently only support 4 status: 1. active 2. notInService 4. createAndGo 6. destroy ('active' and 'notInservice' status are used for getting action, 'createAndGo' and 'destroy' status are used for setting action.) - 'active', which indicates that the current network exists in the - system. - 'notInService', if not exist in the system. - 'createAndGo', set this status to create a network. - 'destroy', to delete a network.

column.name: ospfMultiProcessNetworkAreaAreaId2
column.description: NetworkArea area ID as IP address format.

table.name: ospfMultiProcessIfTable
table.description: The OSPF Interface Table describes the interfaces from the viewpoint of OSPF.

row.name: ospfMultiProcessIfEntry
row.description: The OSPF Interface Entry describes one interface from the viewpoint of OSPF.

column.name: ospfMultiProcessIfCost
column.description: The output cost of this OSPF interface. Set 0 means unset the cost, thus the cost is dependent on ospfMultiProcessAutoCost.

column.name: ospfMultiProcessIfMtu
column.description: The mtu of this OSPF interface. Set 0 to unset the mtu.

column.name: ospfMultiProcessIfMtuIgnore
column.description: If check(0), OSPF will check the MTU size during DD (Database Description) exchange. If ignore(1), OSPF will not check the MTU size during DD exchange.

column.name: ospfMultiProcessIfAreaId
column.description: A 32-bit integer uniquely identifying the area to which the interface connects. Area ID 0.0.0.0 is used for the OSPF backbone. This is a private substitution for ospfIfAreaId of RFC1253.

column.name: ospfMultiProcessIfRtrPriority
column.description: The priority of this interface. Used in multi-access networks, this field is used in the designated router election algorithm. The value 0 signifies that the router is not eligible to become the designated router on this particular network. In the event of a tie in this value, routers will use their Router ID as a tie breaker. This is a private substitution for ospfIfRtrPriority of RFC1253.

column.name: ospfMultiProcessIfTransitDelay
column.description: The estimated number of seconds it takes to transmit a link state update packet over this interface. Note that the minimal value SHOULD be 1 second. This is a private substitution for ospfIfTransitDelay of RFC1253.

column.name: ospfMultiProcessIfRetransInterval
column.description: The number of seconds between link state advertisement retransmissions, for adjacencies belonging to this interface. This value is also used when retransmitting database description and Link State request packets. Note that minimal value SHOULD be 1 second. This is a private substitution for ospfIfRetransInterval of RFC1253.

column.name: ospfMultiProcessIfHelloInterval
column.description: The length of time, in seconds, between the Hello packets that the router sends on the interface. This value must be the same for all routers attached to a common network. This is a private substitution for ospfIfHelloInterval of RFC1253.

column.name: ospfMultiProcessIfRtrDeadInterval
column.description: The number of seconds that a router's Hello packets have not been seen before its neighbors declare the router down. This should be some multiple of the Hello interval. This value must be the same for all routers attached to a common network. Note that 1..65535 is for 'set' range ; The read value may be (1...65535)*4 by default according to the Hello interval if this dead interval have not been set. This is a private substitution for ospfIfRtrDeadInterval of RFC1253.

column.name: ospfMultiProcessIfState
column.description: The OSPF Interface State. This is a private substitution for ospfIfState of RFC1253.

column.name: ospfMultiProcessIfDesignatedRouter
column.description: The IP address of the designated router. This is a private substitution for ospfIfDesignatedRouter of RFC1253.

column.name: ospfMultiProcessIfBackupDesignatedRouter
column.description: The IP address of the backup designated router. This is a private substitution for ospfIfBackupDesignatedRouter of RFC1253.

column.name: ospfMultiProcessIfEvents
column.description:
The number of times this OSPF interface has changed its state or an error has occurred.
Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur at re-initialization of the management system. This is a private substitution for ospfIfEvents of RFC1253.

column.name: ospfMultiProcessIfAuthKey
column.description:
The cleartext password used as an OSPF authentication key when simplePassword security is enabled. This object does not access any OSPF cryptogaphic (e.g., MD5) authentication key under any circumstance.
If the key length is shorter than 8 octets, th agent will left adjust and zero fill to 8 octets.
Unauthenticated interfaces need no authentication key, and simple password authentication cannot us a key of more than 8 octets.
Note that the use of simplePassword authentication is NOT recommended when there is concern regarding attack upon the OSPF system. SimplePassword authentication is only sufficient to protect against accidental misconfigurations because it re-uses cleartext passwords [RFC1704].
When read, ospfIfAuthKey always returns an octet string of length zero. This is a private substitution for ospfIfAuthKey of RFC1253.

column.name: ospfMultiProcessIfStatus
column.description:
This variable display the status of the ospf interface. Currently only active and notInService statues are supported.
The value of this object has no effect on whether other objects in this conceptual row can be modified. This is a private substitution for ospfIfStatus of RFC1253.

column.name: ospfMultiProcessIfAuthType
column.description:
The authentication type specified for an interface.
Note that this object can be used to engage in significant attacks against an OSPF router. This is a private substitution for ospfIfAuthType of RFC1253.

column.name: ospfMultiProcessIfDesignatedRouterId
column.description: The Router ID of the designated router. This is a private substitution for ospfIfDesignatedRouterId of RFC4750.

column.name: ospfMultiProcessIfBackupDesignatedRouterId
column.description: The Router ID of the backup designated router. This is a private substitution for ospfIfBackupDesignatedRouterId of RFC4750.

table.name: ospfMultiProcessAreaTable
table.description: Information describing the configured parameters and cumulative statistics of the router's attached areas. The interfaces and virtual links are configured as part of these areas. Area 0.0.0.0, by definition, is the backbone area. This is a private substitution for ospfAreaTable of RFC1253.

row.name: ospfMultiProcessAreaEntry
row.description:
Information describing the configured parameters and cumulative statistics of one of the router's attached areas. The interfaces and virtual links are configured as part of these areas. Area 0.0.0.0, by definition, is the backbone area.
Information in this table is persistent and when this object is written the entity SHOULD save the change to non-volatile storage.

column.name: ospfMultiProcessAuthType
column.description: The authentication type specified for an area.

column.name: ospfMultiProcessImportAsExtern
column.description: Indicates if an area is a stub area, NSSA, or standard area. Type-5 AS-external LSAs and type-11 Opaque LSAs are not imported into stub areas or NSSAs. NSSAs import AS-external data as type-7 LSAs.

column.name: ospfMultiProcessSpfRuns
column.description:
The number of times that the intra-area route table has been calculated using this area's link state database. This is typically done using Dijkstra's algorithm.
Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur at re-initialization of the management system.

column.name: ospfMultiProcessAreaBdrRtrCount
column.description: The total number of Area Border Routers reachable within this area. This is initially zero and is calculated in each Shortest Path First (SPF) pass.

column.name: ospfMultiProcessAsBdrRtrCount
column.description: The total number of Autonomous System Border Routers reachable within this area. This is initially zero and is calculated in each SPF pass.

column.name: ospfMultiProcessAreaLsaCount
column.description: The total number of link state advertisements in this area's link state database, excluding AS-external LSAs.

column.name: ospfMultiProcessAreaLsaCksumSum
column.description: The 32-bit sum of the link state advertisements' LS checksums contained in this area's link state database. This sum excludes external (LS type-5) link state advertisements. The sum can be used to determine if there has been a change in a router's link state database, and to compare the link state database of two routers. The value should be treated as unsigned when comparing two sums of checksums.

column.name: ospfMultiProcessAreaSummary
column.description:
This variable controls the import of summary LSAs into stub and NSSA areas. It has no effect on other areas.
If it is noAreaSummary, the router will not originate summary LSAs into the stub or NSSA area. It will rely entirely on its default route.
If it is sendAreaSummary, the router will both summarize and propagate summary LSAs.

column.name: ospfMultiProcessAreaStatus
column.description:
Row status of area. Note ospf area can't be created or destroyed solely in this table. Only read is permitted.
The value of this object has no effect on whether other objects in this conceptual row can be modified.

table.name: ospfMultiProcessStubAreaTable
table.description: The set of metrics that will be advertised by a default Area Border Router into a stub area. This is a private substitution for ospfStubAreaTable of RFC1253.

row.name: ospfMultiProcessStubAreaEntry
row.description:
The metric for a given Type of Service that will be advertised by a default Area Border Router into a stub area.
Information in this table is persistent and when this object is written the entity SHOULD save the change to non-volatile storage.

column.name: ospfMultiProcessStubMetric
column.description: The metric value applied at the indicated Type of Service. By default, this equals the least metric at the Type of Service among the interfaces to other areas.

column.name: ospfMultiProcessStubStatus
column.description: This object permits management of the table by facilitating actions such as row creation, construction, and destruction. Currently set only support 'createAndGo' and 'destroy'. The value of this object has no effect on whether other objects in this conceptual row can be modified.

table.name: ospfMultiProcessLsdbTable
table.description: The OSPF Process's link state database (LSDB). The LSDB contains the link state advertisements from throughout the areas that the device is attached to. This is a private substitution for ospfLsdbTable of RFC1253.

row.name: ospfMultiProcessLsdbEntry
row.description: A single link state advertisement.

column.name: ospfMultiProcessLsdbSequence
column.description: The sequence number field is a signed 32-bit integer. It starts with the value '80000001'h, or -'7FFFFFFF'h, and increments until '7FFFFFFF'h. Thus, a typical sequence number will be very negative. It is used to detect old and duplicate Link State Advertisements. The space of sequence numbers is linearly ordered. The larger the sequence number, the more recent the advertisement.

column.name: ospfMultiProcessLsdbAge
column.description: This field is the age of the link state advertisement in seconds.

column.name: ospfMultiProcessLsdbChecksum
column.description: This field is the checksum of the complete contents of the advertisement, excepting the age field. The age field is excepted so that an advertisement's age can be incremented without updating the checksum. The checksum used is the same that is used for ISO connectionless datagrams; it is commonly referred to as the Fletcher checksum.

column.name: ospfMultiProcessLsdbAdvertisement
column.description:
The entire link state advertisement, including its header.
Note that for variable length LSAs, SNMP agents may not be able to return the largest string size.

table.name: ospfMultiProcessVirtIfTable
table.description: Information about this router's virtual interfaces that the OSPF Process is configured to carry on. This is a private substitution for ospfVirtIfTable of RFC1253.

row.name: ospfMultiProcessVirtIfEntry
row.description:
Information about a single virtual interface.
Information in this table is persistent and when this object is written the entity SHOULD save the change to non-volatile storage.

column.name: ospfMultiProcessVirtIfTransitDelay
column.description: The estimated number of seconds it takes to transmit a Link State update packet over this interface. Note that the minimal value SHOULD be 1 second.

column.name: ospfMultiProcessVirtIfRetransInterval
column.description: The number of seconds between link state avertisement retransmissions, for adjacencies belonging to this interface. This value is also used when retransmitting database description and Link State request packets. This value should be well over the expected round-trip time. Note that the minimal value SHOULD be 1 second.

column.name: ospfMultiProcessVirtIfHelloInterval
column.description: The length of time, in seconds, between the Hello packets that the router sends on the interface. This value must be the same for the virtual neighbor.

column.name: ospfMultiProcessVirtIfRtrDeadInterval
column.description: The number of seconds that a router's Hello packets have not been seen before its neighbors declare the router down. This should be 4 multiple of the Hello interval. This value must be the same for the virtual neighbor. Note that 1..65535 is for 'set' range ; The read value may be (1...65535)*4 by default according to the Hello interval if this dead interval haven't been set.

column.name: ospfMultiProcessVirtIfState
column.description: OSPF virtual interface states.

column.name: ospfMultiProcessVirtIfEvents
column.description:
The number of state changes or error events on this virtual link.
Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur at re-initialization of the management system.

column.name: ospfMultiProcessVirtIfAuthKey
column.description:
The cleartext password used as an OSPF authentication key when simplePassword security is enabled. This object does not access any OSPF cryptogaphic (e.g., MD5) authentication key under any circumstance.
If the key length is shorter than 8 octets, the agent will left adjust and zero fill to 8 octets.
Unauthenticated interfaces need no authentication key, and simple password authentication cannot use a key of more than 8 octets.
Note that the use of simplePassword authentication is NOT recommended when there is concern regarding attack upon the OSPF system. SimplePassword authentication is only sufficient to protect against accidental misconfigurations because it re-uses cleartext passwords. [RFC1704]
When read, ospfVirtIfAuthKey always returns an octet string of length zero.

column.name: ospfMultiProcessVirtIfStatus
column.description:
This object permits management of the table by facilitating actions such as row creation, construction, and destruction.
The value of this object has no effect on whether other objects in this conceptual row can be modified.

column.name: ospfMultiProcessVirtIfAuthType
column.description:
The authentication type specified for a virtual interface.
Note that this object can be used to engage in significant attacks against an OSPF router.

table.name: ospfMultiProcessNbrTable
table.description: A table describing all non-virtual neighbors in the locality of the OSPF router. This is a private substitution for ospfNbrTable of RFC1253.

row.name: ospfMultiProcessNbrEntry
row.description: The information regarding a single neighbor.

column.name: ospfMultiProcessNbrRtrId
column.description: A 32-bit integer (represented as a type IpAddress) uniquely identifying the neighboring router in the Autonomous System.

column.name: ospfMultiProcessNbrOptions
column.description:
A bit mask corresponding to the neighbor's options field.
Bit 0, if set, indicates that the system will operate on Type of Service metrics other than TOS 0. If zero, the neighbor will ignore all metrics except the TOS 0 metric.
Bit 1, if set, indicates that the associated area accepts and operates on external information; if zero, it is a stub area.
Bit 2, if set, indicates that the system is capable of routing IP multicast datagrams, that is that it implements the multicast extensions to OSPF.
Bit 3, if set, indicates that the associated area is an NSSA. These areas are capable of carrying type-7 external advertisements, which are translated into type-5 external advertisements at NSSA borders.

column.name: ospfMultiProcessNbrPriority
column.description: The priority of this neighbor in the designated router election algorithm. The value 0 signifies that the neighbor is not eligible to become the designated router on this particular network.

column.name: ospfMultiProcessNbrState
column.description: The state of the relationship with this neighbor.

column.name: ospfMultiProcessNbrEvents
column.description:
The number of times this neighbor relationship has changed state or an error has occurred.
Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur at re-initialization of the management system.

column.name: ospfMultiProcessNbrLsRetransQLen
column.description: The current length of the retransmission queue.

table.name: ospfMultiProcessVirtNbrTable
table.description: This table describes all virtual neighbors. Since virtual links are configured in the Virtual Interface Table, this table is read-only. This is a private substitution for ospfVirtNbrTable of RFC1253.

row.name: ospfMultiProcessVirtNbrEntry
row.description: Virtual neighbor information.

column.name: ospfMultiProcessVirtNbrIpAddr
column.description: The IP address this virtual neighbor is using.

column.name: ospfMultiProcessVirtNbrOptions
column.description:
A bit mask corresponding to the neighbor's options field.
Bit 1, if set, indicates that the system will operate on Type of Service metrics other than TOS 0. If zero, the neighbor will ignore all metrics except the TOS 0 metric. Bit 2, if set, indicates that the system is network multicast capable, i.e., that it implements OSPF multicast routing.

column.name: ospfMultiProcessVirtNbrState
column.description: The state of the virtual neighbor relationship.

column.name: ospfMultiProcessVirtNbrEvents
column.description:
The number of times this virtual link has changed its state or an error has occurred.
Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur at re-initialization of the management system.

column.name: ospfMultiProcessVirtNbrLsRetransQLen
column.description: The current length of the retransmission queue.

table.name: ospfMultiProcessExtLsdbTable
table.description:
The OSPF Process's external LSA link state database.
This table is identical to the OSPF LSDB Table in format, but contains only external link state advertisements. The purpose is to allow external LSAs to be displayed once for the router rather than once in each non-stub area.
Note that external LSAs are also in the AS-scope link state database. This is a private substitution for ospfExtLsdbTable of RFC1253.

row.name: ospfMultiProcessExtLsdbEntry
row.description: A single link state advertisement.

column.name: ospfMultiProcessExtLsdbSequence
column.description: The sequence number field is a signed 32-bit integer. It starts with the value '80000001'h, or -'7FFFFFFF'h, and increments until '7FFFFFFF'h. Thus, a typical sequence number will be very negative. It is used to detect old and duplicate link state advertisements. The space of sequence numbers is linearly ordered. The larger the sequence number, the more recent the advertisement.

column.name: ospfMultiProcessExtLsdbAge
column.description: This field is the age of the link state advertisement in seconds.

column.name: ospfMultiProcessExtLsdbChecksum
column.description: This field is the checksum of the complete contents of the advertisement, excepting the age field. The age field is excepted so that an advertisement's age can be incremented without updating the checksum. The checksum used is the same that is used for ISO connectionless datagrams; it is commonly referred to as the Fletcher checksum.

column.name: ospfMultiProcessExtLsdbAdvertisement
column.description: The entire link state advertisement, including its header.

table.name: ospfMultiProcessAreaAggregateTable
table.description:
The Area Aggregate Table acts as an adjunct to the Area Table. It describes those address aggregates that are configured to be propagated from an area. Its purpose is to reduce the amount of information that is known beyond an Area's borders.
It contains a set of IP address ranges specified by an IP address/IP network mask pair. For example, a class B address range of X.X.X.X with a network mask of 255.255.0.0 includes all IP addresses from X.X.0.0 to X.X.255.255.
Note that if ranges are configured such that one range subsumes another range (e.g., 10.0.0.0 mask 255.0.0.0 and 10.1.0.0 mask 255.255.0.0), the most specific match is the preferred one. This is a private substitution for ospfAreaAggregateTable of RFC1253.

row.name: ospfMultiProcessAreaAggregateEntry
row.description: A single area aggregate entry. Information in this table is persistent and when this object is written the entity SHOULD save the change to non-volatile storage.

column.name: ospfMultiProcessAreaAggregateStatus
column.description:
This object permits management of the table by facilitating actions such as row creation, construction, and destruction.
The value of this object has no effect on whether other objects in this conceptual row can be modified.

column.name: ospfMultiProcessAreaAggregateEffect
column.description: Subnets subsumed by ranges either trigger the advertisement of the indicated aggregate (advertiseMatching) or result in the subnet's not being advertised at all outside the area.

table.name: ospfMultiProcessIfAuthMd5Table
table.description: The OSPF Interface Message Digest Authentication Table describes the interfaces from the viewpoint of OSPF.

row.name: ospfMultiProcessIfAuthMd5Entry
row.description: The OSPF Interface Message Digest Authentication Entry describes one interface from the viewpoint of OSPF.

column.name: ospfMultiProcessIfAuthMd5Key
column.description: The Message Digest Authentication key of this OSPF interface. When read, ospfIfAuthMd5Key always returns an octet string of length zero. Set zero-length string to unset the md5 key.

table.name: ospfMultiProcessVirtIfAuthMd5Table
table.description: The OSPF Virtual Interface Message Digest Authentication Table describes the interfaces from the viewpoint of OSPF.

row.name: ospfMultiProcessVirtIfAuthMd5Entry
row.description: The OSPF Virtual Interface Message Digest Authentication Entry describes one interface from the viewpoint of OSPF.

column.name: ospfMultiProcessVirtIfAuthMd5Key
column.description: The Message Digest Authentication key of this OSPF virtual interface. When read, ospfVirtIfAuthMd5Key always returns an octet string of length zero. Set zero-length string to unset the md5 key.

table.name: ospfMultiProcessRouteTable
table.description: A conceptual table for ospfRouteEntry.

row.name: ospfMultiProcessRouteEntry
row.description: A conceptually row for ospfRouteTable.

column.name: ospfMultiProcessRouteInterface
column.description: The name of outgoing interface which links to nexthop. Return an octet string of length zero when it is discard route.

column.name: ospfMultiProcessRouteCost
column.description: The cost of this route. Always return 4294967295 if it is a discard route.

column.name: ospfMultiProcessRoutePathType
column.description: The path type of this route. unknown, unknown path type. connected, directly connected. discard, discard route. intra, intra-area route. inter, inter-area route. type1, external type 1 route. type2, external type 2 route. nssa1, nssa external type 1 route. nssa2, nssa external type 2 route.

column.name: ospfMultiProcessRouteAreaId
column.description: Area ID of the path which links to nexthop. Note that, discard and external routes have no area option for the path. Always return 0.0.0.0.

column.name: ospfMultiProcessRouteTransitArea
column.description: To display if the area is a transit area or not for the path. Note that, discard and external routes have no area option for the path. Always return normalArea(2).

table.name: ospfIfParamTable
table.description: The TOS metrics for a non-virtual interface identified by the interface index.
table.reference: OSPF Version 2, Appendix C.3 Router interface parameters

row.name: ospfIfParamEntry
row.description: A particular TOS metric for a non-virtual in- terface identified by the interface index.

column.name: ospfIfParamCost
column.description: The metric of using this type of service on this interface. The default value of the TOS 0 Metric is 10^8 / ifSpeed.

column.name: ospfIfParamStatus
column.description: Writing this to valid(1) creates an entry. Writing this to invalid(2) destroys an entry.

scalar.name: routeMultipath
scalar.description: This object is the multipath numbers installed to FIB. The default value is 4.

scalar.name: sysLogStatus
scalar.description: Whether the system log is enabled.

scalar.name: sysLogHistoryFlashLevel
scalar.description: Severity level for logging to flash.

scalar.name: sysLogHistoryRamLevel
scalar.description: Severity level for logging to RAM.

scalar.name: remoteLogStatus
scalar.description: Whether the remote log system is enabled.

scalar.name: remoteLogLevel
scalar.description: Severity level for remote log.

scalar.name: remoteLogFacilityType
scalar.description: The facility type for remote log.

table.name: remoteLogServerInetTable
table.description: A table for storing the remote log server list.

row.name: remoteLogServerInetEntry
row.description: A conceptual row for remoteLogServerInetTable.

column.name: remoteLogServerInetAddress
column.description: The IP address of the remote log Server.

column.name: remoteLogServerUdpPort
column.description: The UDP port number of the remote log Server.

column.name: remoteLogServerStatus
column.description: Setting this to valid(1) creates an entry. Setting this to invalid(2) destroys an entry.

scalar.name: smtpStatus
scalar.description: Set enabled(1) to enable the SMTP, set disabled(2) to disable the SMTP.

scalar.name: smtpSeverityLevel
scalar.description: Specify the SMTP minimum severity level to send the event message.

scalar.name: smtpSourceEMail
scalar.description: SMTP source email address, the sender's mail address that appears in the 'From' field of the mail.

table.name: smtpServerIpTable
table.description: The SMTP server IP table. The maximum servers to be added is 3.

row.name: smtpServerIpEntry
row.description: A conceptual row of the smtpServerIpTable.

column.name: smtpServerIp
column.description: SMTP mail server's IP address.

column.name: smtpServerIpStatus
column.description: Setting this to valid(1) creates an entry. Setting this to invalid(2) destroys an entry.

table.name: smtpDestEMailTable
table.description: The table of the destination e-mail address. The maximum numbers of destination email address to be added is 5.

row.name: smtpDestEMailEntry
row.description: A conceptual row of the smtpDestEMailTable.

column.name: smtpDestEMail
column.description: SMTP destination e-mail address.

column.name: smtpDestEMailStatus
column.description: Setting this to valid(1) creates an entry. Setting this to invalid(2) destroys an entry.

scalar.name: consoleDataBits
scalar.description: Number of data bits.

scalar.name: consoleParity
scalar.description: Defines the generation of a parity bit.

scalar.name: consoleBaudRate
scalar.description: Baud rate: Valid values are 115200, 57600, 38400, 19200, and 9600.

scalar.name: consoleStopBits
scalar.description: The console stop bits, valid values are stopbits1(1) or stopbits2(2)

scalar.name: consoleExecTimeout
scalar.description: In a serial console, use the consoleExecTimeout variable to set the interval that the EXEC command interpreter waits until user input is detected; set the value to 0 to disable it.

scalar.name: consolePasswordThreshold
scalar.description: The number of failed console logon attempts that may be made before the system will not accept a further attempt in the time specified by consoleSilentTime. A value of 0 disables the functionality.

scalar.name: consoleSilentTime
scalar.description: The length of time that the management console is inaccessible after the number of failed logon attempts has reached consolePasswordThreshold. A value of 0 disables the functionality.

scalar.name: consoleLoginResponseTimeout
scalar.description: Console login response timeout setting.

scalar.name: telnetStatus
scalar.description: To enable or disable the telnet function. Any new telnet request will be rejected and all current telnet sessions will be terminated if this status is set to disabled(2).

scalar.name: telnetPortNumber
scalar.description: The telnet session port number.

scalar.name: vtyExecTimeout
scalar.description: Specifies the interval that the system waits for user input before terminating the current session.

scalar.name: vtyPasswordThreshold
scalar.description: The number of failed logon attempts that may be made before the system will not accept a further attempt to log on. Setting to 0 means disabled.

scalar.name: vtyLoginResponseTimeout
scalar.description: Login response timeout setting.

scalar.name: vtyMaxSession
scalar.description: The maximum number of allowed sessions.

scalar.name: vtySilentTime
scalar.description: The time the system waits before etablishing a new session after the number of failed logins reaches the specified limit. Setting to 0 means disabled.

scalar.name: sntpStatus
scalar.description: Set enabled(1) to enable the SNTP, set disabled(2) to disable the SNTP.

scalar.name: sntpServiceMode
scalar.description: Service mode.

scalar.name: sntpPollInterval
scalar.description: Polling interval.

table.name: sntpServerTable
table.description: Table for SNTP servers. IP addresses must occupy contiguous indexes, starting from 1. If a removed entry is not the last entry, the table will be shifted to contiguous indexes automatically.

row.name: sntpServerEntry
row.description: Entry for SNTP servers.

column.name: sntpServerIndex
column.description: The index of a server.

column.name: sntpServerInetAddressType
column.description: Indicates the type of address denoted in sntpServerInetAddress type. Only ipv4(1), ipv6(2) and ipv6z(4) types are supported.

column.name: sntpServerInetAddress
column.description: The IP address of a time server.

column.name: sntpServerStatus
column.description: Setting this to valid(1) creates an entry. Setting this to invalid(2) destroys an entry.

scalar.name: sysCurrentTime
scalar.description: This is a text string in the following form, based on Unix: 'Mmm _d hh:mm:ss yyyy'. 'Mmm' are the first three letters of the English name of the month. '_d' is the day of month. A single-digit day is preceded by a space. 'hh:mm:ss' is a 24-hour representations of hours, minutes, and seconds. A single-digit hour is preceded by a zero. 'yyyy' is a four-digit year. An example is: 'Jan 1 02:03:04 2002'.

scalar.name: sysTimeZone
scalar.description: This is a text string in the following form: '[s]hh:mm'. '[s]' is a plus-or-minus sign. For UTC, this is omitted. For a positive offset, this is '+'. For a negative offset, this is '-'. 'hh:mm' in the hour and minute offset from UTC. A single-digit hour is preceded by a zero. When sysTimeZonePredefined object is set to any value other than none(1), this object will be empty string.

scalar.name: sysTimeZoneName
scalar.description: The name of the time zone. When sysTimeZonePredefined object is set to any value other than none(1), this object will be empty string.

scalar.name: ntpStatus
scalar.description: Set enabled(1) to enable the NTP, set disabled(2) to disable the NTP.

scalar.name: ntpServiceMode
scalar.description: Service mode.

scalar.name: ntpPollInterval
scalar.description: Polling interval in seconds.

scalar.name: ntpAuthenticateStatus
scalar.description: Set enabled(1) to enable the NTP Authenticate, set disabled(2) to disable the NTP.

table.name: ntpServerTable
table.description: Table for NTP servers

row.name: ntpServerEntry
row.description: Entry for NTP servers.

column.name: ntpServerIpAddress
column.description: The IP address of a server. Valid IP addresses must occupy contiguous indexes. All IP addresses after the last valid index is 0.

column.name: ntpServerVersion
column.description: NTP version.

column.name: ntpServerKeyId
column.description: Key for a NTP server. This variable can only be written.

column.name: ntpServerStatus
column.description: Setting this to valid(1) creates an entry. Setting this to invalid(2) destroys an entry.

table.name: ntpAuthKeyTable
table.description: Table for NTP Authentication keys

row.name: ntpAuthKeyEntry
row.description: Entry for NTP Authentication keys.

column.name: ntpAuthKeyId
column.description: The index of a Authentication key. This table has fixed size.

column.name: ntpAuthKeyWord
column.description: The Authentication key word is used to created a key by the MD5 And the max length is 32.

column.name: ntpAuthKeyStatus
column.description: Setting this to valid(1) creates an entry. Setting this to invalid(2) destroys an entry.

scalar.name: fileCopySrcOperType
scalar.description:
fileCopySrcOperType specifies where to copy from, and fileCopyDestOperType specifies where to copy to.
Possible combinations of 'fileCopySrcOperType to fileCopyDestOperType' and required parameters are listed in the following table.
--------------+------------------+--------------------------------- Source | Destination | Required parameters --------------+------------------+--------------------------------- file(1) | file(1) | fileCopySrcFileName | | fileCopyDestFileName +------------------+--------------------------------- | runningCfg(2) | fileCopySrcFileName +------------------+--------------------------------- | startUpCfg(3) | fileCopySrcFileName | | fileCopyDestFileName +------------------+--------------------------------- | tftp(4) | fileCopySrcFileName | | fileCopyDestFileName | | fileCopyFileType | | fileCopyServerInetAddressType | | fileCopyServerInetAddress +------------------+--------------------------------- | unit(5) | fileCopySrcFileName | | fileCopyDestFileName | | fileCopyFileType | | fileCopyUnitId +------------------+--------------------------------- | ftp(7) | fileCopySrcFileName | | fileCopyDestFileName | | fileCopyFileType | | fileCopyServerInetAddressType | | fileCopyServerInetAddress | | fileCopyServerUserName | | fileCopyServerPassword --------------+------------------+--------------------------------- runningCfg(2) | file(1) | fileCopyDestFileName +------------------+--------------------------------- | startUpCfg(3) | fileCopyDestFileName +------------------+--------------------------------- | tftp(4) | fileCopyDestFileName | | fileCopyServerInetAddressType | | fileCopyServerInetAddress +------------------+--------------------------------- | ftp(7) | fileCopyDestFileName | | fileCopyServerInetAddressType | | fileCopyServerInetAddress | | fileCopyServerUserName | | fileCopyServerPassword --------------+------------------+--------------------------------- startUpCfg(3) | file(1) | fileCopyDestFileName +------------------+--------------------------------- | runningCfg(2) | None. +------------------+--------------------------------- | tftp(4) | fileCopyDestFileName | | fileCopyServerInetAddressType | | fileCopyServerInetAddress +------------------+--------------------------------- | ftp(7) | fileCopyDestFileName | | fileCopyServerInetAddressType | | fileCopyServerInetAddress | | fileCopyServerUserName | | fileCopyServerPassword --------------+------------------+--------------------------------- tftp(4) | file(1) | fileCopySrcFileName | | fileCopyDestFileName | | fileCopyFileType | | fileCopyServerInetAddressType | | fileCopyServerInetAddress +------------------+--------------------------------- | runningCfg(2) | fileCopySrcFileName | | fileCopyServerInetAddressType | | fileCopyServerInetAddress +------------------+--------------------------------- | startUpCfg(3) | fileCopySrcFileName | | fileCopyDestFileName | | fileCopyServerInetAddressType | | fileCopyServerInetAddress --------------+------------------+--------------------------------- unit(5) | file(1) | fileCopySrcFileName | | fileCopyDestFileName | | fileCopyFileType | | fileCopyUnitId --------------+------------------+--------------------------------- ftp(7) | file(1) | fileCopySrcFileName | | fileCopyDestFileName | | fileCopyFileType | | fileCopyServerInetAddressType | | fileCopyServerInetAddress | | fileCopyServerUserName | | fileCopyServerPassword +------------------+--------------------------------- | runningCfg(2) | fileCopySrcFileName | | fileCopyServerInetAddressType | | fileCopyServerInetAddress | | fileCopyServerUserName | | fileCopyServerPassword +------------------+--------------------------------- | startUpCfg(3) | fileCopySrcFileName | | fileCopyDestFileName | | fileCopyServerInetAddressType | | fileCopyServerInetAddress | | fileCopyServerUserName | | fileCopyServerPassword --------------+------------------+---------------------------------

scalar.name: fileCopySrcFileName
scalar.description: The source file name for fileCopyMgt when a copy operation is next requested via this MIB. This value is set to a zero length string when no file name has been specified.

scalar.name: fileCopyDestOperType
scalar.description: See the description for fileCopySrcOperType.

scalar.name: fileCopyDestFileName
scalar.description: The destination file name for fileCopyMgt when a copy operation is next requested via this MIB. This value is set to a zero length string when no file name has been specified.

scalar.name: fileCopyFileType
scalar.description: Type of file to copy in fileCopyMgt. opcode(1) indicates operation code, config(2) indicates configuration file.

scalar.name: fileCopyUnitId
scalar.description: Specifies the switch unit for stackable devices.

scalar.name: fileCopyAction
scalar.description: Set this object to copy(2) to begin the copy operation. When the device is not copying, this object will have a value of notCopying(1). Setting this object to abortTftp(3) to abort a TFTP transfer.

scalar.name: fileCopyStatus
scalar.description: The status of the last copy procedure, if any. This object will have a value of fileCopyUnknown(18) if no copy operation has been performed.

scalar.name: fileCopyServerInetAddressType
scalar.description: Internet address type of the remote server. Only ipv4(1) type is supported.

scalar.name: fileCopyServerInetAddress
scalar.description: Internet address of the remote server.

scalar.name: fileCopyServerUserName
scalar.description: Login user name for the remote server. When this variable is empty, the system will use 'anonymous' as user name to log in to the remote server.

scalar.name: fileCopyServerPassword
scalar.description: Login password for the remote server. This variable can only be written. When this variable is read, it always returns a zero-length string.

table.name: fileInfoTable
table.description: This table contain the information of the file system; we can also perform the delete, set startup file operation.

row.name: fileInfoEntry
row.description: A conceptually row for fileInfoTable.

column.name: fileInfoFileType
column.description: The file type of the file System in the device.

column.name: fileInfoUnitID
column.description: The switch unit in a stacking system, in a non-stacking system, this value is always 1.

column.name: fileInfoFileName
column.description: The file Name of the file System in the device.

column.name: fileInfoIsStartUp
column.description: This flag indicate whether this file is a startup file. Set this object to true(1) to indicate that this is a startup file. Setting this object to false(2) is a invalid operation.

column.name: fileInfoFileSize
column.description: The sizes( in bytes) of the file.

column.name: fileInfoCreationTime
column.description: The creation time of the file, This is a text string in the following form, based on Unix: 'Mmm _d hh:mm:ss yyyy'. 'Mmm' are the first three letters of the English name of the month. '_d' is the day of month. A single-digit day is preceded by a space. 'hh:mm:ss' is a 24-hour representations of hours, minutes, and seconds. A single-digit hour is preceded by a zero. 'yyyy' is the four-digit year. An example is: 'Jan 1 02:03:04 2002'.

column.name: fileInfoDelete
column.description: Write this object to delete(2) to delete a file, when read, this always return noDelete(1).

table.name: fileAutoDownloadResultTable
table.description: This table contains file auto download result information.

row.name: fileAutoDownloadResultEntry
row.description: A conceptual row for fileAutoDownloadResultTable.

column.name: fileAutoDownloadResultUnitID
column.description: The switch unit in a stacking system, in a non-stacking system, this value is always 1.

column.name: fileAutoDownloadResultAction
column.description:
The status of the auto download action. value copying(2) will be obtained if the auto download action is currently processing, or value notCopying(1) will be obtained if no auto download action is currently processing.
You can check the download result through the fileAutoDownloadResultStatus object after the download action has finished.
Please note that this object is read-only, since the auto download action is triggered automatically by the system when an image file or a config file is set as startup setting through the fileInfoIsStartUp, restartOpCodeFile or restartConfigFile objects, but not set by the user manually through this fileAutoDownloadResultAction object.

column.name: fileAutoDownloadResultStatus
column.description: The last auto download result status. value fileCopyUnknown(18) will be obtained if no download action has been performed before.

scalar.name: fileAutoUpgradeOpCodeStatus
scalar.description: Set this variable to enabled(1) to enable the device to automatically upgrade the current software image when a new version is detected. Set this variable to disabled(2) to disable this feature.

scalar.name: fileAutoUpgradeOpCodePath
scalar.description: The URL (Universal Resource Location) of the image file location for automatic upgrades. The URL schema can be set to TFTP. The Hostname is the IP address of the server. The last character of the URL is always a '/' and the filename must not be included in the URL.

scalar.name: fileAutoUpgradeOpCodeFileName
scalar.description: The file name of the image file.

scalar.name: dnsDomainLookup
scalar.description: To enable the IP Domain Naming System (DNS)-based host name-to-address translation.

scalar.name: dnsDomainName
scalar.description: To define a default domain name to complete unqualified host names (names without a dotted-decimal domain name).

table.name: dnsCacheTable
table.description: To display the RRs in DNS cache.

row.name: dnsCacheEntry
row.description: A conceptual row for the dnsCacheTable.

column.name: dnsCacheIndex
column.description: The entry sequence number.

column.name: dnsCacheFlag
column.description: Always get 4, means this record is unreliable.

column.name: dnsCacheType
column.description: Cache Type: address(1); cname(2).

column.name: dnsCacheTtl
column.description: The DNS cache TTL.

column.name: dnsCacheDomain
column.description: The DNS cache domain.

column.name: dnsCacheInetAddressType
