column.description: Indicates the type of address denoted in dnsHostAddrInetAddress type. Only ipv4(1) and ipv6(2) types are supported.

column.name: dnsCacheInetAddress
column.description: IP address of DNS cache item.

table.name: dnsHostTable
table.description: The conceptual table of dnsHostEntry. The dnsHostTable and dnsHostAddrTable are used to define static host name-to-address mapping.

row.name: dnsHostEntry
row.description: A conceptual row for the dnsHostTable.

column.name: dnsHostIndex
column.description: The entry sequence number.

column.name: dnsHostName
column.description: Host name.

column.name: dnsHostStatus
column.description: Setting this to valid(1) creates an entry. Setting this to invalid(2) destroys an entry.

table.name: dnsHostAddrTable
table.description: The conceptual table of dnsHostAddrEntry. The dnsHostTable and dnsHostAddrTable are used to define static host name-to-address mapping.

row.name: dnsHostAddrEntry
row.description: A conceptual row for the dnsHostAddrTable.

column.name: dnsHostAddrInetAddressType
column.description: Indicates the type of address denoted in dnsHostAddrInetAddress type. Only ipv4(1), ipv6(2) and ipv6z(4) type are supported.

column.name: dnsHostAddrInetAddress
column.description: Specifies the address of the host. Adding one address to two different hosts is not allowed.

column.name: dnsHostAddrStatus
column.description: Setting this to valid(1) creates an entry. Setting this to invalid(2) destroys an entry.

table.name: dnsDomainListTable
table.description: This table defines a list of default domain names to complete unqualified host names.

row.name: dnsDomainListEntry
row.description: A conceptual row for the dnsDomainListTable.

column.name: dnsDomainListIndex
column.description: The entry sequence number.

column.name: dnsDomainListName
column.description: Domain name.

column.name: dnsDomainListStatus
column.description: Setting this to valid(1) creates an entry. Setting this to invalid(2) destroys an entry.

table.name: dnsNameServerInetTable
table.description: Specifies the address of one or more name servers to use for name and address resolution.

row.name: dnsNameServerInetEntry
row.description: A conceptual row for dnsNameServerInetTable.

column.name: dnsNameServerInetAddressType
column.description: Type of address. Only ipv4(1), ipv6(2) and ipv6z(4) types are supported.

column.name: dnsNameServerInetAddress
column.description: IP address of name server.

column.name: dnsNameServerInetStatus
column.description: Setting this to valid(1) creates an entry. Setting this to invalid(2) destroys an entry.

table.name: mcastStormTable
table.description: Table to manage the control of multicast storms for ports.

row.name: mcastStormEntry
row.description: The conceptual row of multiStormTable.

column.name: mcastStormIfIndex
column.description: The port and the trunk (including trunk members) interface of the portTable. The interface identified by a particular value of this index is the same interface as identified by the same value of ifIndex in the IF-MIB.

column.name: mcastStormStatus
column.description: Whether multicast storm protection is enabled.

column.name: mcastStormPktRate
column.description: Multicast storm threshold as packets per second. If this entry is for a trunk, this is the value for each member port. The range is 500 to 262143.

table.name: bcastStormTable
table.description: Table to manage the control of broadcast storms for ports.

row.name: bcastStormEntry
row.description: The conceptual row of bcastStormTable.

column.name: bcastStormIfIndex
column.description: The port and the trunk (including trunk members) interface of the portTable. The interface identified by a particular value of this index is the same interface as identified by the same value of ifIndex in the IF-MIB.

column.name: bcastStormStatus
column.description: Whether broadcast storm protection is enabled.

column.name: bcastStormPktRate
column.description: Broadcast storm threshold as packets per second. If this entry is for a trunk, this is the value for each member port. The range is 500 to 262143.

table.name: unknownUcastStormTable
table.description: Table to manage the unknown unicast storm control.

row.name: unknownUcastStormEntry
row.description: The conceptual row of unknownUcastStormTable.

column.name: unknownUcastStormIfIndex
column.description: The port or trunk interface of the portTable. The interface identified by a particular value of this index is the same interface as identified by the same value of ifIndex in the IF-MIB.

column.name: unknownUcastStormStatus
column.description: The parameter indicates that the unknown unicast storm protection is enabled/disabled.

column.name: unknownUcastStormPktRate
column.description: The parameter indicates the packet rate(packet per second) of the storm protection. The range is 500 to 262143.

scalar.name: atcBcastStormTcApplyTime
scalar.description: The parameter indicates the timing when the ATC (Auto Traffic Control) is activated after the broadcast traffic being detected as the storm.

scalar.name: atcBcastStormTcReleaseTime
scalar.description: The parameter indicates the timing when the ATC is released after the broadcast traffic being detected as no storm.

table.name: atcBcastStormTable
table.description: The table contains the Auto Traffic Control configuration and the status for broadcast traffic.

row.name: atcBcastStormEntry
row.description: The conceptual row of the table.

column.name: atcBcastStormIfIndex
column.description: The specified port on which the ATC is applied.

column.name: atcBcastStormEnable
column.description: The parameter indicates whether the ATC of the broadcast traffic is applied.

column.name: atcBcastStormAutoRelease
column.description: The parameter indicates whether the Auto-Release feature of ATC is applied.

column.name: atcBcastStormSampleType
column.description: The parameter indicates the unit of traffic rate and threshold.

column.name: atcBcastStormCurrentTrafficRate
column.description: The parameter indicates the current broadcast traffic rate.

column.name: atcBcastStormAlarmFireThreshold
column.description: The parameter indicates that if the current broadcast traffic rate exceeds the specified threshold, it will be treated as the storm.

column.name: atcBcastStormAlarmClearThreshold
column.description: The parameter indicates that if the current broadcast traffic falls below the specified threshold it will be treated as the normal traffic.

column.name: atcBcastStormTcAction
column.description: The parameter indicates the protecting action which ATC will applied to the specified port.

column.name: atcBcastStormAlarmFireTrapStatus
column.description: The parameter indicates whether the trap has to be sent when the broadcast storm has been detected.

column.name: atcBcastStormAlarmClearTrapStatus
column.description: The parameter indicates whether the trap has to be sent when the broadcast storm has been detected as the normal traffic.

column.name: atcBcastStormTcApplyTrapStatus
column.description: The parameter indicates whether the trap has to be sent when the ATC is activated.

column.name: atcBcastStormTcReleaseTrapStatus
column.description: The parameter indicates whether the trap has to be sent when the ATC is released.

scalar.name: atcMcastStormTcApplyTime
scalar.description: The parameter indicates the timing when the ATC (Auto Traffic Control) is activated after the broadcast traffic being detected as the storm.

scalar.name: atcMcastStormTcReleaseTime
scalar.description: The parameter indicates the timing when the ATC is released after the broadcast traffic being detected as no storm.

table.name: atcMcastStormTable
table.description: The table contains the Auto Traffic Control configuration and the status for mulicast traffic.

row.name: atcMcastStormEntry
row.description: The conceptual row of the table.

column.name: atcMcastStormIfIndex
column.description: The specified port on which the ATC is applied.

column.name: atcMcastStormEnable
column.description: The parameter indicates whether the ATC of the mulicast traffic is applied.

column.name: atcMcastStormAutoRelease
column.description: The parameter indicates whether the Auto-Release feature of ATC is applied.

column.name: atcMcastStormSampleType
column.description: The parameter indicates the unit of traffic rate and threshold.

column.name: atcMcastStormCurrentTrafficRate
column.description: The parameter indicates the current mulicast traffic rate.

column.name: atcMcastStormAlarmFireThreshold
column.description: The parameter indicates that if the current mulicast traffic rate exceeds the specified threshold, it will be treated as the storm.

column.name: atcMcastStormAlarmClearThreshold
column.description: The parameter indicates that if the current mulicast traffic falls below the specified threshold it will be treated as the normal traffic.

column.name: atcMcastStormTcAction
column.description: The parameter indicates the protecting action which ATC will applied to the specified port.

column.name: atcMcastStormAlarmFireTrapStatus
column.description: The parameter indicates whether the trap has to be sent when the mulicast storm has been detected.

column.name: atcMcastStormAlarmClearTrapStatus
column.description: The parameter indicates whether the trap has to be sent when the mulicast storm has been detected as the normal traffic.

column.name: atcMcastStormTcApplyTrapStatus
column.description: The parameter indicates whether the trap has to be sent when the ATC is activated.

column.name: atcMcastStormTcReleaseTrapStatus
column.description: The parameter indicates whether the trap has to be sent when the ATC is released.

scalar.name: cpuCurrentUti
scalar.description: The current CPU utilization in percent in the past 5 seconds.

scalar.name: cpuStatMaxUti
scalar.description: The maximum CPU utilization in percent in the past 60 seconds.

scalar.name: cpuStatAvgUti
scalar.description: The average CPU utilization in percent in the past 60 seconds.

scalar.name: cpuPeakTime
scalar.description: The time when the CPU utilization reaches cpuUtiRisingThreshold in the format of 'Mmm _d hh:mm:ss yyyy' as defined in sysCurrentTime of this MIB.

scalar.name: cpuPeakDuration
scalar.description: The duration from the CPU utilization reaches cpuUtiRisingThreshold to reaches cpuUtiFallingThreshold, in seconds.

scalar.name: cpuUtiRisingThreshold
scalar.description: The rising threshold of the cpu utilization.

scalar.name: cpuUtiFallingThreshold
scalar.description: The falling threshold of the cpu utilization.

scalar.name: memoryTotal
scalar.description: The total amount of the memory in kilobytes.

scalar.name: memoryAllocated
scalar.description: The amount of the memory allocated in kilobytes.

scalar.name: memoryFreed
scalar.description: The amount of the free memory in kilobytes.

scalar.name: memoryFreedInPercent
scalar.description: the memory freed in proportion to the total memory.

scalar.name: memoryUtiRisingThreshold
scalar.description: The rising threshold of the memory utilization.

scalar.name: memoryUtiFallingThreshold
scalar.description: The falling threshold of the memory utilization.

table.name: mvrDomainTable
table.description: The table for configuring the MVR port.

row.name: mvrDomainEntry
row.description: The entry for configuring the MVR Domain.

column.name: mvrDomainId
column.description: Speicfies which MVR domain to configure.

column.name: mvrDomainStatus
column.description: Parameter to enable or disable MVR(Multicast VLAN Registration) on the device.

column.name: mvrDomainRunningStatus
column.description: Describes the running status of MVR (Multicast VLAN Registration) to the switch. A value of active(1) indicates that all necessary conditions in the MVR environment are satisfied. A value of inactive(2) indicates that some necessary conditions in the MVR environment are not satisfied.

column.name: mvrDomainVlanId
column.description: To set VLAN for MVR.The VLAN identified by a particular value of this index is the same VLAN as identified by the same value of dot1qVlanIndex in the Q-BRIDGE-MIB.

column.name: mvrDomainUpstreamSourceIp
column.description: Set the source IP address which MVR will carry in IP header when send IGMP packet to upstream router through MVR source port.

table.name: mvrDomainPortTable
table.description: The table for configuring the MVR port.

row.name: mvrDomainPortEntry
row.description: The entry for configuring the MVR port.

column.name: mvrPortDomainId
column.description: Speicfies which MVR domain to configure.

column.name: mvrDomainIfIndex
column.description: The port interface of the portTable. The interface identified by a particular value of this index is the same interface as identified by the same value of ifIndex in the IF-MIB.

column.name: mvrDomainPortType
column.description: For configuring the MVR port type. To disable the MVR port type, use the none(0).

column.name: mvrDomainPortImmediateLeave
column.description: To enable immediate leave on MVR port.

column.name: mvrDomainPortActive
column.description: To indicate if the port is associated with the MVR group. If the port is the MVR receiver port or the MVR source port in MVR vlan, the status is active(1); otherwise the status is inactive(2).

table.name: mvrProfileCtlTable
table.description: The entry for configuring the MVR profile.

row.name: mvrProfileCtlEntry
row.description: The entry for configuring the MVR profile.

column.name: mvrProfileCtlId
column.description: Profile ID to index which MVR profile

column.name: mvrProfileName
column.description:
MVR Profile name which identify a group range.
NOTE: All mvrProfileCtlEntry use the same buffer to temply store the mvrProfileName before mvrProfileCtlAction really creat the profile.

column.name: mvrProfileCtlAction
column.description: Set this object to create(2) to create profile. Set this object to destory(3) to delete profile. When the action is complete, this object becomes noAction(1).

table.name: mvrProfileGroupCtlTable
table.description: The entry for configuring the MVR group ranges for MVR profile.

row.name: mvrProfileGroupCtlEntry
row.description: The entry for configuring the group ranges on MVR profile.

column.name: mvrProfileGropuCtlProfileId
column.description: Profile ID to index which MVR profile

column.name: mvrProfileGroupCtlId
column.description: Profile ID to index which group range in MVR profile

column.name: mvrProfileGroupStartIPAddress
column.description:
MVR Profile range start IP address.
NOTE: All mvrProfileGroupCtlEntry use the same buffer to temply store the mvrProfileStartIPAddress before mvrProfileGroupCtlAction really creat the group rang on profile.

column.name: mvrProfileGroupEndIPAddress
column.description:
MVR Profile range end IP address.
NOTE: All mvrProfileGroupCtlEntry use the same buffer to temply store the mvrProfileEndIPAddress before mvrProfileGroupCtlAction really creat the group rang on profile.

column.name: mvrProfileGroupCtlAction
column.description:
Set this object to create(2) to create group range. Set this object to destory(3) to delete group range. When the action is complete, this object becomes noAction(1).
NOTE: If mvrProfileGroupStartIPAddress and mvrProfileGroupEndIPAddress pattern already exist on other mvrProfileGroupCtlId, it won't be stored.

table.name: mvrDomainAssociatedProfileTable
table.description: Configure MVR domain associate which MVR profile

row.name: mvrDomainAssociatedProfileEntry
row.description: The entry for configuring MVR domain associate MVR profile.

column.name: mvrProfileDomainId
column.description: Profile ID to index which MVR profile

column.name: mvrProfileId
column.description: Profile ID to index which MVR profile

column.name: mvrProfileAction
column.description: Set this object to create(1) to associate profile. Set this object to destory(2) to deassociate profile. When the action is complete, this object becomes noAction(0).

table.name: mvrDomainGroupStaticTable
table.description: The table for configuring the static members of the MVR group.

row.name: mvrDomainGroupStaticEntry
row.description: The entry for configuring the static members of the MVR group.

column.name: mvrGroupStaticDomainId
column.description: Profile ID to index which MVR profile

column.name: mvrDomainGroupStaticAddress
column.description: The multicast address of the MVR group.

column.name: mvrDomainGroupStaticReceiverVlan
column.description: The receiver vlan of this MVR group

column.name: mvrDomainGroupStaticPorts
column.description: The set of ports configured by management in this entry. Ports entered in this list will be the static members of this MVR group.

table.name: mvrDomainGroupCurrentTable
table.description: The table for the current members of the MVR group.

row.name: mvrDomainGroupCurrentEntry
row.description: The entry for the current members of the MVR group.

column.name: mvrGroupCurrenDomainId
column.description: Profile ID to index which MVR profile

column.name: mvrDomainGroupCurrentAddress
column.description: The multicast address of the MVR group.

column.name: mvrDomainGroupCurrentReceiverVlan
column.description: This object indicates the receiver VLAN of the MVR group.

column.name: mvrDomainGroupCurrentPorts
column.description: The complete set of ports currently associated with this MVR group.

scalar.name: mvrProxySwitching
scalar.description: Parameter to enable or disable MVR(Multicast VLAN Registration) proxy switching ability on the device.

scalar.name: mvrRobustnessValue
scalar.description: Paremete to set IGMP robustness value. This value apply to proxy-switching for how many IGMP report/leave will be send out from source port, and how many g-s query will be send on receiver port.

scalar.name: mvrProxyQueryInterval
scalar.description: Set the query interval that active receiver port will use to send out general query

scalar.name: mvrSourcePortmode
scalar.description: Paremete to set MVR Source Port forward mode. When set dynamic, MVR source port won't forward multicast streams received from other source port. When set forward, MVR source port will forward multicast streams received from other source port. These multicast stream all are in MVR group range.

scalar.name: dhcpSnoopEnable
scalar.description: This object indicates whether the DHCP Snooping feature is enabled.

scalar.name: dhcpSnoopVerifyMacAddressEnable
scalar.description: This object indicates whether DHCP Snooping Mac address verification is enabled.

scalar.name: dhcpSnoopInformationOptionEnable
scalar.description: This object indicates whether the DHCP snooping information option(option 82) feature is enabled.

scalar.name: dhcpSnoopInformationOptionPolicy
scalar.description: This object indicates which reforwarding policy shall be used for DHCP snooping information option(option 82). A value of drop(1) means to drop the DHCP request packet which has the information option(option 82). A value of keep(2) means to keep the existing information option(option 82) of the DHCP request packet. A value of replace(3), which is the default value, means to replace the existing information option(option 82) of the DHCP request packet.

scalar.name: dhcpSnoopBindingsTableCtlAction
scalar.description: Set this to store(2) to store DHCP snooping binding entries to flash. Set this to clear(3) to clear DHCP snooping binding entries from flash. noAction(1) will always be obtained when reading this variable.

table.name: dhcpSnoopVlanConfigTable
table.description: A table contains DHCP Snooping configurations of existing VLANs.

row.name: dhcpSnoopVlanConfigEntry
row.description: An instance contains the configuration to enable or disable DHCP Snooping at each existing VLAN.

column.name: dhcpSnoopVlanEnable
column.description: This object indicates whether DHCP Snooping is enabled in this VLAN.

table.name: dhcpSnoopPortConfigTable
table.description: A table provides the mechanism to configure the trust state of each port or trunk for DHCP Snooping purpose.

row.name: dhcpSnoopPortConfigEntry
row.description: An instance contains the configuration to enable or disable trust state of each port or trunk for DHCP Snooping purpose.

column.name: dhcpSnoopPortTrustEnable
column.description: This object indicates whether the port or trunk is trusted for DHCP Snooping purpose.

table.name: dhcpSnoopBindingsTable
table.description: A table contains the DHCP bindings information learnt by the device.

row.name: dhcpSnoopBindingsEntry
row.description: An instance contains the Mac address, IP address type, IP address, VLAN number, interface number, leased time and status.

column.name: dhcpSnoopBindingsAddrType
column.description: This object indicates the type of IP address denoted in dhcpSnoopBindingsIpAddress type.

column.name: dhcpSnoopBindingsEntryType
column.description: This object indicates that this binding is obtained from dynamically learning or is a static configuraion.

column.name: dhcpSnoopBindingsIpAddress
column.description: This object indicates the allocated IP address of a DHCP client host.

column.name: dhcpSnoopBindingsPortIfIndex
column.description: This object indicates the port or trunk where a DHCP client host connects to.

column.name: dhcpSnoopBindingsLeaseTime
column.description: This object indicates the leased time of this DHCP bindings.

scalar.name: dhcpSnoopTotalForwardedPkts
scalar.description: Indicates the total number of packets subjected to DHCP Snooping is forwarded.

scalar.name: dhcpSnoopUntrustedPortDroppedPkts
scalar.description: Indicates the number of packets subjected to DHCP Snooping is dropped because they come from untrusted interface.

scalar.name: clusterEnable
scalar.description: Enables or disables clustering on the device.

scalar.name: clusterCommanderEnable
scalar.description: Enables or disables the device as commander in a cluster.

scalar.name: clusterIpPool
scalar.description: The start internal IP address of a cluster pool.

scalar.name: clusterClearCandidateTable
scalar.description: Setting this object to clear(2) starts to clear the candidate table.

scalar.name: clusterRole
scalar.description: The current role of the device in a cluster. commander(1) : The switch is the controlling device in a cluster. candidate(2) : The switch has been discovered by the commander, but it has not been manually configured for access from the commander. activeMember(3): The switch has been manually configured for access from the commander and it is active in the cluster. disabled(5) : The switch has clustering disabled.

scalar.name: clusterMemberCount
scalar.description: The total number of members in a cluster.

scalar.name: clusterCandidateCount
scalar.description: The total number of candidates in a cluster.

table.name: clusterCandidateTable
table.description: A table listing cluster candidates.

row.name: clusterCandidateEntry
row.description: A conceptual row containing the information of the candidate.

column.name: clusterCandidateDesc
column.description: The description of the candidate.

column.name: clusterCandidateRole
column.description: The role of the candidate. candidate(2) : The switch is discovered by the commander, but it has not been manually configured for access from the commander. activeMember(3) : The switch is manually configured for access from the commander and it is active in the cluster. inactiveMember(4): The switch is manually configured for access from the commander, but it is inactive in the cluster.

table.name: clusterMemberTable
table.description: A table listing clustering members.

row.name: clusterMemberEntry
row.description: A conceptual row containing the information of the member.

column.name: clusterMemberMacAddr
column.description: The MAC address of the member.

column.name: clusterMemberDesc
column.description: The description of the member.

column.name: clusterMemberActive
column.description: The active status of the member. activeMember(3) : The switch is manually configured for access from the commander and it is active in the cluster. inactiveMember(4): The switch is manually configured for access from the commander, but it is inactive in the cluster.

scalar.name: clusterMemberAddCtlMacAddr
scalar.description: The MAC address of the device associated with clusterMemberAddCtlAction.

scalar.name: clusterMemberAddCtlId
scalar.description: The member id associated with clusterMemberAddCtlAction.

scalar.name: clusterMemberAddCtlAction
scalar.description: Adds the device to members that can be accessed from the commander. The MAC of the device is the current value of clusterMemberAddCtlMacAddr and the assigned member ID is the current value of clusterMemberAddCtlId. Set this object to add(2) to begin adding the member.

scalar.name: clusterMemberRemoveCtlId
scalar.description: The member ID associated with clusterMemberRemoveCtlAction.

scalar.name: clusterMemberRemoveCtlAction
scalar.description: Removes the device from members that can be accessed from the commander. The member ID is the current value of clusterMemberRemoveCtlId. Set this object to remove(2) to begin removing the member.

table.name: ipSrcGuardConfigTable
table.description: A table contains the configurations to enable or disable IP Source Guard at each port or trunk.

row.name: ipSrcGuardConfigEntry
row.description: An instance contains the configuration to enable or disable IP Source Guard at each port or trunk.

column.name: ipSrcGuardMode
column.description: This object indicates whether Ip Source Guard is enabled at this interface. If the value equals 0, it means Ip Source Guard is disabled. If the value equals 1, it means Ip Source Guard is enabled, and packets are filtered by checking source ip. If the value equals 2, it means Ip Source Guard is enabled and packets are filtered by checking source ip and source mac.

table.name: ipSrcGuardAddrTable
table.description: A table contains the IP Source Guard bindings information learnt by the device.

row.name: ipSrcGuardAddrEntry
row.description: An instance contains the Mac address, IP address type, IP address, VLAN number, interface number, leased time and status.

column.name: ipSrcGuardBindingsAddrType
column.description: This object indicates the type of IP address denoted in ipSrcGuardBindingsIpAddress type.

column.name: ipSrcGuardBindingsEntryType
column.description: This object indicates that this binding is obtained from dynamically learning or is a static configuraion.

column.name: ipSrcGuardBindingsIpAddress
column.description: This object indicates the allocated IP address of a DHCP client host.

column.name: ipSrcGuardBindingsPortIfIndex
column.description: This object indicates the port or trunk where a DHCP client host connects to.

column.name: ipSrcGuardBindingsLeaseTime
column.description: This object indicates the leased time of this DHCP bindings.

column.name: ipSrcGuardBindingsStatus
column.description: The status of this conceptual row entry. This object issued to manage the creation and deletion of conceptual rows. The status column has six defined values: - 'active', which indicates that the conceptual row is available for use by the managed device; - 'notInService', which indicates that the conceptual row exists in the agent, but is unavailable for use by the managed device.

table.name: oamPortClearStatTable
table.description: A table contains the information of clear OAM statistics at each port.

row.name: oamPortClearStatEntry
row.description: An entry contains the information of clear OAM statistics at each port.

column.name: oamClearStatistics
column.description: This variable is used to clear the counters for OAM. Set this variable to clear(2) to perform the clear operation, noClear(1) will always be displayed when reading this variable.

scalar.name: mldSnoopStatus
scalar.description: Parameter to enable or disable MLD snooping on the device. When enabled, the device will examine MLD packets and set up filters for MLD ports.

scalar.name: mldSnoopQuerier
scalar.description: Enables (disables) whether the switch acts as an MLD querier.

scalar.name: mldSnoopRobustness
scalar.description: The Robustness Variable allows tuning for the expected packet loss on a subnet. If a subnet is expected to be lossy, the Robustness Variable may be increased. MLD is robust to (Robustness Variable-1) packet losses. The discussion of the Robustness Variable is in Section 7.1 of RFC 2710.

scalar.name: mldSnoopQueryInterval
scalar.description: The interval (in seconds) between MLD host-query messages sent by the switch.

scalar.name: mldSnoopQueryMaxResponseTime
scalar.description: The time after a query, during which a response is expected from an endstation. If a querier has sent a number of queries defined by mldSnoopRobustness, but an endstation has not responded, a countdown timer is started using an initial value set by mldSnoopQueryMaxResponseTime. If the countdown finishes, and the endstation still has not responded, then that the endstation is deemed to have left the multicast group.

scalar.name: mldSnoopRouterPortExpireTime
scalar.description: Sets the time (in seconds) the switch waits after the previous querier has stopped querying before the router port (which received query packets from previous querier) expires.

scalar.name: mldSnoopVersion

scalar.name: daiGlobalStatus
scalar.description: Set enabled(1) to enable dynamic ARP inspection. Set disabled(2) to disable dynamic ARP inspection.

scalar.name: daiGlobalSrcMacValidation
scalar.description: Set enabled(1) to enable validation of source MAC address. Set disabled(2) to disable validation of source MAC address.

scalar.name: daiGlobalDestMacValidation
scalar.description: Set enabled(1) to enable validation of destination MAC address. Set disabled(2) to disable validation of destination MAC address.

scalar.name: daiGlobalIpAddrValidation
scalar.description: Set enabled(1) to enable validation of IP address. Set disabled(2) to disable validation of IP address.

scalar.name: daiGlobalLogNumber
scalar.description: The number of log buffers for saving log message. The value 0 means not generating system messages.

scalar.name: daiGlobalLogInterval
scalar.description: The value of the time interval for saving log messages.

scalar.name: daiGlobalAdditionalValidStatus
scalar.description: The vaule of this object is disabled(2) when the status of daiGlobalSrcMacValidation, daiGlobalDestMacValidation, and daiGlobalIpAddrValidation are disabled; enabled(1) when one or more of these variables are enabled.

table.name: daiVlanTable
table.description: A table contains dynamic ARP inspection configurations for existing VLANs.

row.name: daiVlanEntry
row.description: An instance containing the configuration of dynamic ARP inspection for each existing VLAN.

column.name: daiVlanStatus
column.description: This object indicates whether dynamic ARP inspection is enabled in this VLAN.

column.name: daiVlanArpAclName
column.description: Specifies the ARP ACL name bound to the interface. The default value of daiVlanArpAclStatus is dynamic(2).

column.name: daiVlanArpAclStatus
column.description: Set to static(1) means packets not matching the ACL are dropped. Set to dynamic(2) means packets not matching the ACL are validated by the DHCP snooping binding table. When daiVlanArpAclName is configured, the default value of daiVlanArpAclStatus is dynamic(2).

table.name: daiPortTable
table.description: A table containing dynamic ARP inspection configurations for port interfaces.

row.name: daiPortEntry
row.description: An instance containing the configuration of dynamic ARP inspection at each port interface.

column.name: daiPortTrustStatus
column.description: This object indicates whether the port is trusted for dynamic ARP inspection.

column.name: daiPortRateLimit
column.description: The value of rate limit threshold per second of disposing ARP messages. Set the value 0xFFFFFFFF as no rate limit.

table.name: daiLogTable
table.description: A table containing dynamic ARP inspection log information.

row.name: daiLogEntry
row.description: An instance containing log information of dynamic ARP inspection at each VLAN interface.

column.name: daiLogVlan
column.description: This object indicates the VLAN ID of dynamic ARP inspection log information.

column.name: daiLogPort
column.description: This object indicates the ifIndex of dynamic ARP inspection log information.

column.name: daiLogSrcIpAddress
column.description: The source IP address of dynamic ARP inspection log information.

column.name: daiLogDestIpAddress
column.description: The destination IP address of dynamic ARP inspection log information.

column.name: daiLogSrcMacAddress
column.description: The source MAC address of dynamic ARP inspection log information.

column.name: daiLogDestMacAddress
column.description: The destination MAC address of dynamic ARP inspection log information.

scalar.name: daiTotalReceivedPkts
scalar.description: Indicates the total number of ARP packets received before rate limiting.

scalar.name: daiTotalDroppedPkts
scalar.description: Indicates the total number of ARP packets dropped due to rate limt.

scalar.name: daiTotalProcessedPkts
scalar.description: Indicates the total number of ARP packets processed by ARP inspection.

scalar.name: daiTotalSrcMacDroppedPkts
scalar.description: Indicates the total number of ARP packets dropped by source MAC address validation.

scalar.name: daiTotalDestMacDroppedPkts
scalar.description: Indicates the total number of ARP packets dropped by destination MAC address validation.

scalar.name: daiTotalIpAddrDroppedPkts
scalar.description: Indicates the total number of ARP packets dropped by IP address validation.

scalar.name: daiTotalArpAclDroppedPkts
scalar.description: Indicates the total number of ARP packets dropped by ARP ACL.

scalar.name: daiTotalDhcpSnoopingDroppedPkts
scalar.description: Indicates the total number of ARP packets dropped by DHCP snooping.

scalar.name: udpHelperStatus
scalar.description: Set this variable to enabled(1) to enable UDP helper. Set this variable to disabled(2) to disable UDP helper.

table.name: udpHelperForwardProtocolTable
table.description: To specify which UDP ports the switch forwards when forwarding UDP broadcast packets.

row.name: udpHelperForwardProtocolEntry
row.description: A conceptual row of udpHelperForwardProtocolTable.

column.name: udpHelperForwardProtocolStatus
column.description: Set this variable to valid(1) to enable forwarding of packets. Set this variable to invalid(2) to disable forwarding of packets.

table.name: udpHelperInetAddrTable
table.description:
To forward UDP broadcasts, including BOOTP, received on an interface. After configuring an UDP helper address on an interface, the UDP broadcast packets on this network to which this interface is attached will be sent to the helper. Combined with the configuration of udpHelperForwardProtocolTable, it allows you to control which kind of broadcast packets can be forwarded.
One common application that requires helper addresses is Dynamic Host Configuration Protocol (DHCP), which is defined in RFC 1531. To enable BOOTP or DHCP broadcast forwarding for a set of clients, configure a helper address on the router interface connected to the client. The helper address should specify the address of the BOOTP or DHCP server. If you have multiple servers, you can configure one helper address for each server.

row.name: udpHelperInetAddrEntry
row.description: A conceptual row of udpHelperInetAddrTable.

column.name: udpHelperInetAddrStatus
column.description:
To forward UDP broadcasts, including BOOTP, received from the specified interface, to the specified address. Set this variable to valid(1) to enable forwarding of packets. Set this variable to invalid(2) to disable forwarding of packets.
All of the following conditions must be met in order for a User Datagram Protocol (UDP) or IP packet to be helped:
1. The MAC address of the received frame must be all-ones broadcast address (FF-FF-FF-FF-FF-FF). 2. The IP destination address must be one of the following: 1) all-ones broadcast (255.255.255.255) 2) subnet broadcast for the receiving interface 3. The IP protocol must be UDP (17). 4. The UDP destination port must be TFTP, Domain Name System (DNS), Time, NetBIOS, BOOTP or DHCP packet, or a UDP port specified by the udpHelperForwardTable.

scalar.name: pppoeiaGlobalStatus
scalar.description: Set enabled(1) to enable global status of PPPoE Intermediate Agent. Set disbaled(2) to disable global status of PPPoE Intermediate Agent.

scalar.name: pppoeiaGlobalAccessNodeId
scalar.description: Specifies access node identifier. Use empty to revert to default value.

scalar.name: pppoeiaGlobalOperAccessNodeId
scalar.description: The operational access node identifier.

scalar.name: pppoeiaGlobalGenericErrorMsg
scalar.description: Specifies generic error message. Use empty to revert to default value.

scalar.name: pppoeiaGlobalOperGenericErrorMsg
scalar.description: The operational generic error message.

scalar.name: pppoeiaGlobalClearStatisticsAction
scalar.description: This variable is used to clear the counters of all interfaces. Set clear(1) to perform the clear operation. The value noClear(2) will always be displayed when reading.

table.name: pppoeiaPortTable
table.description: Table for port configuration in PPPoE Intermediate Agent.

row.name: pppoeiaPortEntry
row.description: Entry for port configuration in PPPoE Intermediate Agent.

column.name: pppoeiaPortStatus
column.description: This parameter is used to enable/disable PPPoE Intermediate Agent on interfaces.

column.name: pppoeiaPortTrustStatus
column.description: This parameter is used to enable/disable trust mode of PPPoE Intermediate Agent on interfaces.

column.name: pppoeiaPortVendorTagStrip
column.description: This parameter is used to enable/disable stripping of vendor tag status of PPPoE Intermediate Agent on interfaces.

column.name: pppoeiaPortCircuitId
column.description: Specifies circuit ID of PPPoE Intermediate Agent on interfaces. Use empty to revert to default value.

column.name: pppoeiaPortOperCircuitId
column.description: The operational circuit ID of PPPoE Intermediate Agent on interfaces.

column.name: pppoeiaPortRemoteId
column.description: Specifies remote ID of PPPoE Intermediate Agent on interfaces. Use empty to revert to default value.

column.name: pppoeiaPortOperRemoteId
column.description: The operational remote ID of PPPoE Intermediate Agent on interfaces.

table.description: Table for port statistics in PPPoE Intermediate Agent.

row.name: pppoeiaPortStatsEntry
row.description: Entry for port statistics in PPPoE Intermediate Agent.

column.name: pppoeiaPortStatsRecvPkts
column.description: Indicates the total number of received packets of the interface.

column.name: pppoeiaPortStatsRecvPadiPkts
column.description: Indicates the total number of received PPPoE Active Discovery Initiation packets of the interface.

column.name: pppoeiaPortStatsRecvPadoPkts
column.description: Indicates the total number of received PPPoE Active Discovery Offer packets of the interface.

column.name: pppoeiaPortStatsRecvPadrPkts
column.description: Indicates the total number of received PPPoE Active Discovery Request packets of the interface.

column.name: pppoeiaPortStatsRecvPadsPkts
column.description: Indicates the total number of received PPPoE Active Discovery Session-confirmation packets of the interface.

column.name: pppoeiaPortStatsRecvPadtPkts
column.description: Indicates the total number of received PPPoE Active Discovery Terminate packets of the interface.

column.name: pppoeiaPortStatsDropUntrustRespPkts
column.description: Indicates the total number of response packets dropped because they were untrusted.

column.name: pppoeiaPortStatsDropUntrustReqPkts
column.description: Indicates the total number of request packets dropped because they were untrusted.

column.name: pppoeiaPortStatsDropMalformedPkts
column.description: Indicates the total number of malformed packets dropped because they were untrusted.

column.name: pppoeiaPortStatsClearAction
column.description: This variable is used to clear the counters of specified interface. Set clear(1) to perform the clear operation. The value noClear(2) will always be displayed when reading.

scalar.name: erpsGlobalStatus
scalar.description: Configures the ERPS function for an entire switch. Note that the ERPS domain will not take effect unless it becomes active and the global status is enabled.

table.name: erpsDomainTable
table.description: Table for ERPS domain configuration.

row.name: erpsDomainEntry
row.description: Entry for ERPS domain configuration.

column.name: erpsDomainName
column.description: The domain name that uniquely identifies an entry in the erpsDomainTable.

column.name: erpsDomainMegLevel
column.description: Configures the maintenance entity group (MEG) level which is used to provide a communication channel for ring automatic protection switching (R-APS) information.

column.name: erpsDomainNodeId
column.description: Configures the node id whcih is a MAC address unique to the ring node.

column.name: erpsDomainWestRingPort
column.description:
Each node on the ring connects to the ring through two ports. As part of the protection switching scheme, one port can be configured as the west port for the specified domain. The east port and west port can not be configured as the same port.
The interface identified by a particular value of this index is the same interface as identified by the same value of ifIndex in the IF-MIB. A value of 0 means no west ring port configured for this domain.

column.name: erpsDomainEastRingPort
column.description:
Each node on the ring connects to the ring through two ports. As part of the protection switching scheme, one port can be configured as the east port for the specified domain. The east port and west port can not be configured as the same port.
The interface identified by a particular value of this index is the same interface as identified by the same value of ifIndex in the IF-MIB. A value of 0 means no east ring port configured for this domain.

column.name: erpsDomainRplPort
column.description: This value displays the port for ring protection link which under normal conditions, i.e., without any failure or request, is blocked for traffic channel, to prevent the formation of loops.

column.name: erpsDomainGuardTimer
column.description: Configures the value of the guard timer which is used to prevent ring nodes from receiving outdated R-APS messages. The range is in 10 ms steps between 10 ms and 2 seconds, with a default value of 500 ms.

column.name: erpsDomainHoldoffTimer
column.description: Configures the value of the holdoff timer which is used to prevent reporting error event immediately to protection switching if the provisioned holdoff timer value is non-zero. The range is in 100 ms steps between 0 and 10 seconds, with a default value of 0 ms.

column.name: erpsDomainWtrTimer
column.description: Configures the value of the wait-to-restore timer which is used by the RPL owner node to prevent frequent switching operations that may be caused by intermittent failures. The range is in 1 minute steps between 5 and 12 minutes with a default value of 5 minutes. This object will not take effect for the non RPL owner node.

column.name: erpsDomainControlVlanID
column.description: This is defined as dot1qVlanIndex in the Q-BRIDGE-MIB. Configures one control VLAN for each ERPS domain. The control VLAN is used only to send and receive ERPS message. A control VLAN can not belong to more than one ERPS domain. A value of 0 means no control VLAN configured for this domain.

column.name: erpsDomainNodeState
column.description: This value displays the node's current state. It displays one of the following states (1) init -- The node is in the init state. (The node state will stay in init state if global status or domain status is not enabled.) (2) idle -- The node is in idle state (i.e., no detected failures, and receiving only 'NR, RB' R-APS frames). (3) protection -- The node is in protection state. (4) manualSwitch -- The node is in manual switch state. (5) forcedSwitch -- The node is in forced switch state. (6) pending -- The node is in pending state.

column.name: erpsDomainWestRingPortState
column.description: This value displays the west ring port's current state. It displays one of the following states (1) unknown -- The port's current state is unknown. (The port's current state will stay in unknown state if the node's current state is in init state.) (2) blocking -- The transmission and reception of traffic are blocked. (3) forwarding -- The traffic can be transmitted and received normally.

column.name: erpsDomainEastRingPortState
column.description: This value displays the east ring port's current state. It displays one of the following states (1) unknown -- The port's current state is unknown. (The port's current state will stay in unknown state if the node's current state is in init state.) (2) blocking -- The transmission and reception of traffic are blocked. (3) forwarding -- The traffic can be transmitted and received normally.

column.name: erpsDomainRowStatus
erpsDomainMajorDomainIndex
column.description: An index that uniquely identifies an entry in the erpsDomainTable. A value of 0 means this domain has no major domain. Notes: This objest can not be configured if erpsDomainRingPortEast has a vaule other than 0.

column.name: erpsDomainPropagateTC
column.description: Set to enabled(1) to transmit topology change signal to the major domain. It will not take effect, if erpsDomainMajorDomainIndex has a value of 0.

column.name: erpsDomainWestMepId
column.description: Configures a CFM Down MEP on west ring port. A down MEP can be uniquely select by given a MEPID, domain's MEG level, and domain's control VLAN ID. A value of 0 means no west MEP is not configured for this domain.

column.name: erpsDomainEastMepId
column.description: Configures a CFM Down MEP on east ring port. A down MEP can be uniquely select by given a MEPID, domain's MEG level, and domain's control VLAN ID. A value of 0 means no east MEP is not configured for this domain.

column.name: erpsDomainNonErpsDevProtect
column.description: Set to enabled(1) to use non-standard protection mechanism for network containing non-ERPS devices.

column.name: erpsDomainNodeType
column.description: Set to none(1) to make this node act as a normal node. Set to owner(2) to make this node act as an RPL owner. Set to neighbor(3) to make this node act as an RPL neighbor.

column.name: erpsDomainNonRevertive
column.description: Set to enabled(1) to enable non-revertive mode operation.

column.name: erpsDomainRapsDefMac
column.description: Set to enabled(1) to use R-APS default MAC.

column.name: erpsDomainRapsWithoutVc
column.description: Set to enabled(1) to enable R-APS sub ring without virtual-channel for a sub domain.

column.name: erpsDomainVersion
column.description: Set to v2(2) to enable ERPS v2 operation.

column.name: erpsDomainForcedSwitch
column.description: Set to west(2) to perform the forced switch command on west ring port of specified domain. Set to east(3) to perform the forced switch command on east ring port of specified domain. The value none(1) will be displayed if no forced switch command is issued on local node.

column.name: erpsDomainManualSwitch
column.description: Set to west(2) to perform the manual switch command on west ring port of specified domain. Set to east(3) to perform the manual switch command on east ring port of specified domain. The value none(1) will be displayed if no manual switch command is issued on local node.

column.name: erpsDomainClear
column.description: Set to clear(1) to perform the clear command on specified domain. The value noClear(2) will always be displayed when reading.

column.name: erpsDomainStatsClearAction
column.description: This variable is used to clear the counters of specified domain. Set to clear(1) to perform the clear operation. The value noClear(2) will always be displayed when reading.

column.name: erpsDomainWtbTimer
column.description: Displays the value of the wait-to-block timer in ms which is used by the RPL owner node when recovering from an operator command (i.e. FS or MS). This object will not take effect for a non RPL owner node.

column.name: erpsDomainWtbExpire
column.description: Displays the time remaining in ms until the wait-to-block timer countdown expires. A value of 0 means no countdown is running.

column.name: erpsDomainWtrExpire
column.description: Displays the time remaining in seconds until the wait-to-restore timer countdown expires. A value of 0 means no countdown is running.

column.name: erpsDomainWestRingPortSf
column.description: This value displays the west ring port's current SF state. It displays one of the following states (1) none -- No SF is detected. (2) detected -- SF is detected.

column.name: erpsDomainEastRingPortSf
column.description: This value displays the east ring port's current SF state. It displays one of the following states (1) none -- No SF is detected. (2) detected -- SF is detected.

column.name: erpsDomainMultiRplOwnerWarn
column.description: This value displays the multiple PPL owner warning state. It displays one of the following states (1) none -- No multiple PPL owner warning is detected. (2) detected -- Multiple RPL owner warning is detected.

scalar.name: erpsGlobalClearStatisticsAction
scalar.description: This variable is used to clear the counters of all ERPS domains. Set to clear(1) to perform the clear operation. The value noClear(2) will always be displayed when reading.

table.name: erpsPortStatsTable
table.description: Table for port statistics in ERPS.

row.name: erpsPortStatsEntry
row.description: Entry for port statistics in ERPS.

column.name: erpsPortStatsLocalClrSfCount

column.name: erpsPortStatsSentNrPkts

column.name: erpsPortStatsSentNrRbPkts
column.description: Indicates the total number of R-APS NR-RB messages sent via this ring port (not including the forwarded ones).

column.name: erpsPortStatsSentFsPkts
column.description: Indicates the total number of R-APS FS messages sent via this ring port (not including the forwarded ones).

column.name: erpsPortStatsSentMsPkts
column.description: Indicates the total number of R-APS MS messages sent via this ring port (not including the forwarded ones).

column.name: erpsPortStatsSentEventPkts
column.description: Indicates the total number of R-APS EVENT messages sent via this ring port (not including the forwarded ones).

column.name: erpsPortStatsSentHealthPkts
column.description: Indicates the total number of non-standard health-check messages sent via this ring port (not including the forwarded ones).

column.name: erpsPortStatsRecvSfPkts
column.description: Indicates the total number of R-APS SF messages received via this ring port (not including the ignored ones).

column.name: erpsPortStatsRecvNrPkts
column.description: Indicates the total number of R-APS NR messages received via this ring port (not including the ignored ones).

column.name: erpsPortStatsRecvNrRbPkts
column.description: Indicates the total number of R-APS NR-RB messages received via this ring port (not including the ignored ones).

column.name: erpsPortStatsRecvFsPkts
column.description: Indicates the total number of R-APS FS messages received via this ring port (not including the ignored ones).

column.name: erpsPortStatsRecvMsPkts
column.description: Indicates the total number of R-APS MS messages received via this ring port (not including the ignored ones).

column.name: erpsPortStatsRecvEventPkts
column.description: Indicates the total number of R-APS EVENT messages received via this ring port (not including the ignored ones).

column.name: erpsPortStatsRecvHealthPkts
column.description: Indicates the total number of non-standard health-check messages received via this ring port (not including the ignored ones).

column.name: erpsPortStatsIgnoreSfPkts
column.description: Indicates the total number of R-APS SF messages ignored by this ring port because they have been timed out or for other reasons.

column.name: erpsPortStatsIgnoreNrPkts
column.description: Indicates the total number of R-APS NR messages ignored by this ring port because they have been timed out or for other reasons.

column.name: erpsPortStatsIgnoreNrRbPkts
column.description: Indicates the total number of R-APS NR-RB messages ignored by this ring port because they have been timed out or for other reasons.

column.name: erpsPortStatsIgnoreFsPkts
column.description: Indicates the total number of R-APS FS messages ignored by this ring port because they have been timed out or for other reasons.

column.name: erpsPortStatsIgnoreMsPkts
column.description: Indicates the total number of R-APS MS messages ignored by this ring port because they have been timed out or for other reasons.

column.name: erpsPortStatsIgnoreEventPkts
column.description: Indicates the total number of R-APS EVENT messages ignored by this ring port because they have been timed out or for other reasons.

column.name: erpsPortStatsIgnoreHealthPkts
column.description: Indicates the total number of non-standard health-check messages ignored by this ring port because they have been timed out or for other reasons.

table.name: ipv6TunnelTable

column.description: To set ipv6 tunnel mode.configured(1) is for static tunnel, sixtofour(2) and isatap(3) are for dynamic tunnels

column.name: ipv6TunnelTtl

column.name: ipv6TunnelSourceVlanIfindex

column.name: ipv6TunnelRowStatus

table.name: mvr6DomainTable
table.description: The table for configuring the MVR port.

row.name: mvr6DomainEntry
row.description: The entry for configuring the MVR Domain.

column.name: mvr6DomainStatus
column.description: Parameter to enable or disable MVR(Multicast VLAN Registration) on the device.

column.name: mvr6DomainRunningStatus
column.description: Describes the running status of MVR (Multicast VLAN Registration) to the switch. A value of active(1) indicates that all necessary conditions in the MVR environment are satisfied. A value of inactive(2) indicates that some necessary conditions in the MVR environment are not satisfied.

column.name: mvr6DomainVlanId
column.description: To set VLAN for MVR.The VLAN identified by a particular value of this index is the same VLAN as identified by the same value of dot1qVlanIndex in the Q-BRIDGE-MIB.

column.name: mvr6DomainUpstreamSourceIpv6
column.description: Set the source IP address which MVR will carry in IP header when send IGMP packet to upstream router through MVR source port.

column.name: mvr6DomainClearDynamicGroups
column.description: Clear dynamic learned groups

table.name: mvr6DomainPortTable
table.description: The table for configuring the MVR port.

row.name: mvr6DomainPortEntry
row.description: The entry for configuring the MVR port.

column.name: mvr6DomainPortType
column.description: For configuring the MVR port type. To disable the MVR port type, use the none(0).

column.name: mvr6DomainPortImmediateLeave
column.description: To enable immediate leave on MVR port.

column.name: mvr6DomainPortActive
column.description: To indicate if the port is associated with the MVR group. If the port is the MVR receiver port or the MVR source port in MVR vlan, the status is active(1); otherwise the status is inactive(2).

table.name: mvr6DomainAssociatedProfileTable
table.description: Configure MVR domain associate which MVR profile

row.name: mvr6DomainAssociatedProfileEntry
row.description: The entry for configuring MVR domain associate MVR profile.

column.name: mvr6ProfileAction
column.description: Set this object to create(1) to associate profile. Set this object to destory(2) to deassociate profile. When the action is complete, this object becomes noAction(0).

table.name: mvr6DomainGroupStaticTable
table.description: The table for configuring the static members of the MVR group.

row.name: mvr6DomainGroupStaticEntry
row.description: The entry for configuring the static members of the MVR group.

column.name: mvr6DomainGroupStaticPorts
column.description: The set of ports configured by management in this entry. Ports entered in this list will be the static members of this MVR group.

table.name: mvr6DomainGroupCurrentTable
table.description: The table for the current members of the MVR group.

row.name: mvr6DomainGroupCurrentEntry
row.description: The entry for the current members of the MVR group.

column.name: mvr6DomainGroupCurrentPorts
column.description: The complete set of ports currently associated with this MVR group.

scalar.name: mvr6ProxySwitching
scalar.description: Parameter to enable or disable MVR(Multicast VLAN Registration) proxy switching ability on the device.

scalar.name: mvr6RobustnessValue
scalar.description: Paremete to set IGMP robustness value. This value apply to proxy-switching for how many IGMP report/leave will be send out from source port, and how many g-s query will be send on receiver port.

table.name: mvr6ProfileCtlTable
table.description: The entry for configuring the MVR6 profile.

row.name: mvr6ProfileCtlEntry
row.description: The entry for configuring the MVR6 profile.

column.name: mvr6ProfileName
column.description:
MVR6 Profile name which identify a group range.
NOTE: All mvr6ProfileCtlEntry use the same buffer to temply store the mvrProfileName before mvr6ProfileCtlAction really creat the profile.

column.name: mvr6ProfileCtlAction
column.description: Set this object to create(2) to create profile. Set this object to destory(3) to delete profile. When the action is complete, this object becomes noAction(1).

table.name: mvr6ProfileGroupCtlTable
table.description: The entry for configuring the MVR group ranges for MVR6 profile.

row.name: mvr6ProfileGroupCtlEntry
row.description: The entry for configuring the group ranges on MVR6 profile.

column.name: mvr6ProfileGroupStartIPAddress
column.description:
MVR Profile range start IP address.
NOTE: All Mvr6ProfileGroupCtlEntry use the same buffer to temply store the mvr6ProfileStartIPAddress before mvr6ProfileGroupCtlAction really creat the group rang on profile.

column.name: mvr6ProfileGroupEndIPAddress
column.description:
MVR6 Profile range end IP address.
NOTE: All Mvr6ProfileGroupCtlEntry use the same buffer to temply store the mvr6ProfileEndIPAddress before mvr6ProfileGroupCtlAction really creat the group rang on profile.

column.name: mvr6ProfileGroupCtlAction
column.description:
Set this object to create(2) to create group range. Set this object to destory(3) to delete group range. When the action is complete, this object becomes noAction(1).
NOTE: If mvr6ProfileGroupStartIPAddress and mvr6ProfileGroupEndIPAddress pattern already exist on other mvr6ProfileGroupCtlAction, it won't be stored.

scalar.name: mvr6ProxyQueryInterval
scalar.description: Set the query interval that active receiver port will use to send out general query

scalar.name: mvr6SourcePortMode
scalar.description: Dynamic means active source port will only forward multicast stream when it has group joined. Forward means active source port will always forward MVR group range multicast streams recieved on another acitve source port.
